Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Nelson M
Reviews.Content: Nice location, nice room. A little overpriced. Watch out for parking... Expensive and far from hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Brings back memories”
Reviews.Author: Etienne P
Reviews.Content: Over twenty years ago I used to attend trade events at the Century Plaza. It was an extraordinary hotel at the time. Today it is still very nice but no longer at the top in regards to decor and service. Yes it still has valet parking and swimming pool etc, but Hyatt really should invest in remodeling the rooms, bathrooms and common areas to bring it up to its full potential.

Reviews.Title: “Great for shopping at Century City”
Reviews.Author: Laopei
Reviews.Content: We had a 24 hour layover in Los Angeles before heading home to Asia and decided to have a purely pedestrian experience. The hotel is an easy stroll from the Century City Mall, where there are plenty of shops and a couple of decent restaurants to choose from. Although the room, and especially the bathroom, was a bit dated, it was clean and comfortable. My only real complaint is having to pay for internet access, which I believe should be like electricity in this day and age!

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating, value is only fair”
Reviews.Author: BK-1K
Reviews.Content: I am a top-tier Gold Passport member & it had been a few years since I had stayed at the Century Plaza. Now, I know why. The staff were warm & welcoming, but the rooms are showing some wear and tear. The bed was worn and clearly sagged on one side. Bathrooms were in fair condition with visible mold in the shower area and poor quality towels. On the plus side, the public spaces (Breeze restaurant & outdoor areas) are nice - but they don't make up for the outdated room. The value equation for this hotel is not very good - room rates are high & the hotel needs updating. There are better quality hotels in the area - but if you need to stay at a Hyatt, check out the Andaz in nearby West Hollywood - it has been renovated more recently.

Reviews.Title: “LA is my Lady”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveller54
Reviews.Content: Great staying at this hotel, under traditionally top Hyatt standards: super amenities --pool, equinox gym, spa; attentive, kind, outstanding service; spacious rooms, optimal location at walking distance (for the ggod walker:)) to Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom poorly renovated, no sound insulation, Club Lounge far from rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Hongdemao
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days for a conference. I upgraded to Regency Club so that I could eat breakfast/ snacks. Unfortunately, the Club Room is off the lobby, making it inconvenient to reach from the rooms. The food selection was quite poor- just trail mix type stuff, yogurt and drinks normally. The cocktail food had some greasy grilled veggies, cookies, and smoked salmon/cream cheese rolls. None of them seemed very fresh. The rooms were renovated and had new bedding/ tv console desk and seemed clean. The woodwork was not renovated, so the closet doors/ interior, bathroom door was all dinged up and very old, probably from the 60's or 70's. The bathtub had dings and looked dirty, but were just refinished poorly, so that the previous scratched finish showed through. The bathrooms also were incredibly dim- no light over the tub. There was a 1/2" gap between the old door to the room and the hallway, with no insulation in between. I could hear anyone walking down the hall, not to mention any conversations. I could even hear conversations in rooms as I walked down the hallway. The location is near a Westfield Mall, with a food court, so that is convenient, but there is only very expensive valet parking. The driveway is too narrow for the volume of guests, so often the valet parking is backed up down the driveway almost to the street. For the money, don't bother with the Club upgrade, and I would find a different hotel for my next stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Top Pick for Biz Travel & Conferences”
Reviews.Author: channelhound
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel for business travel or conducting business conferences. We have done business here for many years and the service, rooms and conf. staff at top notch first class--actually world class.

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel, although more aimed at the business guest”
Reviews.Author: Ian2176
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this hotel in October 2011 as part of a 2 week holiday in California. Not having been to LA before, I was unsure of what to expect. However, the hotel was very good and modern inside (although does look dated from the outside) and is really a business orientated hotel rather than one for a holiday. We asked the hotel for recommendations for places to eat locally and it was clear that the concierge could tell we were there on holiday rather than business and as such wasn't really that helpful - they did seem more helpful to business guests (no doubt thinking that they are more likely to have repeat stays). The outdoor pool area was very nice, clean and tidy. Rooms were well equipped although our coffee maker did not work but within 10 mins of reporting this another was brought to the room. The rooms were very clean and the beds very comfortable. If you have a room on the front of the hotel you get an excellent view of downtown LA. The hotel is about 15-20 mins walk to Rodeo Drive, however, if you want to go to Hollywood or other major tourist sites you need to get a taxi or the open top tourist bus (whose timetable in October is rubbish!). We did hire a car for 3 days, but in hindsight it would have been better to have a car for the full 5 days. We know for next time, and our fault really. The car park at the hotel is located to the rear and is safe, although expensive, but I guess this is LA. If you have a car, the hotel is very well located for Hollwood, Universal Studios and the coast although as I say, there isn't really anywhere to walk to from the hotel (for tourists) other than Rodeo Drive. If I visit LA again, I would certianly consider staying at this hotel again, although it was expensive (the main reason we picked the hotel was because of the Trailfinders 'stay 5 nights get one night free offer'. And remember you will need a car!

Reviews.Title: “Corporate and Dated”
Reviews.Author: KellyLS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, for an event in nearby Beverly Hills. Take into account that I'm a person who prefers somewhat smaller, quirkier lodging with more personality and warmth. I can easily overlook a few dings on the baseboards and doors in exchange for charm. However, at a large, pricey hotel such as this, I do expect things to be recently updated and overhauled, and very very clean. I didn't find this to be true of my room. Yes, the bed was large and comfortable, and the accessories (like the lamps) were "pretty," but the bones of the room looked tired. The hallways and the crystal light fixtures felt very swank and luxurious, but room itself betrayed the age of the place. Especially the bathroom door, which was the cheap wooden type found in old apartments. I got this room on Priceline, and I'm thankful for the discounted rate, as I'd be upset to pay full price. This is definitely a destination for the business/corporate traveler. Again, the public areas such as the lobby and seating areas were lovely, but overall the hotel felt very chilly and, well...business-like. When I stopped by the downstairs bar in the lobby to order a nightcap, the bartender wasn't friendly and didn't return my smile...just plunked down the cocktail and turned away. The hotel is in walking distance to an upscale, outdoor mall just up the street, but you'll have to get into your car for any eating options beside the hotel. It was satisfactory, and I got a good night's sleep, but overall my experience was just average.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel close to century city shops”
Reviews.Author: sarahkgreen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice last year and both times were good. Hotel is very clean and staff are friendly. Close enough to walk to century city shopping. Only downside was no gym access without paying 20 to use the gym next door. Pool was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Scousepeasant
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here at a conference. The staff was friendly & helpful & despite the relatively gloomy corridors, my room was bright & spacious, with a great balcony. Being an early riser & coffee addict it was annoying that there were no coffee making facilities in the hotel. Especially since the Starbucks does not open until 6 a.m. & the room service menu quotes $10 for a pot of coffee. Luckily there is a Starbucks in an office building 2 minutes walk away which opens at 4.30 a.m. The pool area is very nice & I found the bed wonderfully comfortable. I didn't have time to visit the fitness center but at $20 a visit for residents I'm not sure I'd have gone, even if I'd had more time. It's very handy for a Westfield shopping center which has a host of eating options and is about a 15 minute walk to the shops on Rodeo Drive. Overall this is a lovely hotel, but free wifi & a coffee maker would make it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “So Incredible, I never want to go home!!!”
Reviews.Author: aj_sandiego
Reviews.Content: So I'm still lying in my incredibly comfortable bed here at the Hyatt Regency and wanted to write this review as quickly as possible before my departure. I must say that this experience was awesome from beginning to end and I haven't even left yet (nor do I want to). I came into LA for business and have been on the road for 3 days with over 800 miles travelled so far and needed a place to stay so after a quick "cat and mouse" game with Priceline, I was treated to a 4 Star Victory (should be 5) at the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza. I arrived at the peak of rush hour which I thought would only add to my already long day and as I pulled into the extra-long driveway with 6 cars in front of me at the valet stand. At most properties, even the high end locations, you'd normally have to wait a good 20 minutes or so as these properties usually have 2-3 guys working the drive. This was not the case here. I swear in a matter of seconds, there were 6 guys that showed up to welcome these new arrivals, with smooth transitions to the bell captains and before you know it, I was welcomed as well with a smile and escort to the front desk. So far, so good. The downstairs lobby, which is huge, felt like it had several separate and distinct areas where people could gather or relax amongst a full service bar with probably 12 TV's in case you want to watch the Lakers overtake the Dallas Mavericks or any other of their opponents. It did not feel like a sports bar however but rather an upscale yet comfortable lounge with a variety of couches, love seats, overstuffed lounge chairs, and tables to accommodate parties of 1 or many. Although the hotel was supporting a convention or meeting group of some sort, it didn't feel crowded or overrun by any stretch. After watching a little bit of the game, and wandering outside for a moment to check out their spacious pool area that I wish I could enjoy had I arrived about 3 hours earlier, it was time to check in to my room. I get to the front desk and after providing my last name, and I'm welcomed warmly and even though the room was booked through Priceline, I wasn't treated like a second class citizen like so many other hotels do with their holier than thou tone in their voice. I was told that I had a king bed nonsmoking room reserved for me (which rarely happens with Priceline) and it would be his pleasure to make dining recommendations if needed, an overview of the amenities of the hotel, and a wakeup call preference if necessary. This might not sound as "above and beyond" as I'm making it out to be but I must say that the way these folks make you feel is second to none. I make it up to the room and the decor is very current and contemporary with a nice sitting area, comfortable desk and chair, good sized flat screen TV and a bed that was firm but extremely soft pillow top comfort. After a great night's sleep and a personal wakeup call from a friendly human being rather than the automated computer wake up, my stay is closely coming to an end. I'm at risk to miss my appointments this morning because I don't want to get out of bed!!! I wish I could extend my stay as this was a great experience and the next time I come to town, I might have to book this hotel directly just to ensure I'm not placed somewhere else in the random luck of the draw hotel spinner of Priceline. You definitely can't go wrong with this hotel. I highly recommend it for the business traveler, couples getaway, family trip, or business meeting. Great job all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Conference in LA”
Reviews.Author: Catherine M
Reviews.Content: A typical good business focussed hotel, however rooms lacked a little personal luxury at the end of long workff filled days! Hotel was clean and staff friendly. Conference catering provided at the hotel was only average. Nice outside seating area and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: kamal66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights recently.I can honestly say the staff are brilliant as is the hotel.The 2 people who I had contact with,Abinaskh (reception)Greg (concierge)were a credit to the hotel.I cannot thank them enough.They really are a credit to the hotel.Definatly will stay here again.Only a 15 minute walk to Rodeo Drive

Reviews.Title: “Well situated”
Reviews.Author: Marce1111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 15 minute cab ride from Santa Monica Beach. Its a block to a shoping center with American staples as well as a ries of restaurants. It is about 15 minute walking to Rodeo DR. The hotel has a starbucks in the Lobby level - they are open until 11:00 am-ish only. There is a Hertz counter but with really BAD service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Large Hotel in Need of Updating”
Reviews.Author: stonecroft
Reviews.Content: Family stayed for six nights in February 2012. We were on the 15th floor with connecting rooms (One for Teenagers and one for Parents). The rooms are showing some wear and tear but decent. Bathrooms were in good condition and room size was good. Each room has a small balcony. The lobby is large and usually very busy in the bar area. The location is very good; walk to Century Mall, Beverly Hills/Rodeo Drive within a mile, downtown within 8 miles. Our rooms were cleaned every day and had no issues with the cleanliness of the hotel. Valet parking was prompt and the staff were very courteous. All in all a good hotel that is in need of a makeover. I would stay again if we return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “2 star Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: Kamal W
Reviews.Content: Don't get fooled by the pictures. Very out dated and filthy rooms. Very worn out carpets in room. In room service too slow. Being a platinum member the check in rep still gave is lower floor and road facing noisy rooms. And when we spoke to the manager that we want to leave they moved us to 16th floor.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Lynnpatricia
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel to us, we stayed for 9 nights and were very happy overall. Our check in was made very easy by the friendly and efficient receptionist, Hope. We paid extra for use of the Regency Lounge and enjoyed the breakfast, coffee, canapÃ©s and all day soft drinks available there. The staff in the lounge were great as were the staff throughout the Hotel in general. Good pool area. Starbucks in lobby and Earth Bar (fabulously healthy and delicious smoothies) in the Equinox Spa. So convenient for the great shopping mall a 2 minute walk away. Cinema and numerous good restaurants there too. Only negatives are the slightly stuffy smell in the rooms (could this stem from old vacuums)? Also, although the beds are comfortable, the way they are made by sandwiching the duvet between 2 sheets is a little weird and the bottom sheets on the bed were too small and a little uncomfortable as they never stayed tucked in. Minor grumbles over, we have stayed in a number of more luxurious and expensive hotels in LA but this is certainly now our favorite. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC L.A. HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: misslolly21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely hotel, while attending a convention and would definitely return. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and looked very recently renovated. The balcony offered a fantastic view of the city, especially at night. It's in an excellent location, right next to Westfield mall for some amazing shopping, good restaurants and a grocery store. Rodeo Drive and Beverly Hills is a very short drive away. The hotel also has an excellent pool and would appeal to both families, couples and business travelers alike. There's a Starbucks on the property, and great restaurants. It truly is gem with EXCELLENT customer service and amenities. A MUST STAY IN LA :)

Reviews.Title: “Big Hyatt Hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: Hardik V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hyatt for a week . Its a big hotel with lots of rooms & lots of activity going on in the lobby. The rooms are pretty good , spacious & fairly clean. Staff is friendly , specially the concierge staff is very helpful & they get you all the information & good deals for different activities. Very personalised attention to detail by the concierge. The hotel has a great outdoor patio bar where you could relax and have a drink. Just a short walk away is the Century City Mall where there are lots of shopping & dining options. One of them i would highly recommend is The Pink Taco. Its a kinda Mexican Hard Rock Cafe type of place. Great decor and amazing food & drinks. Sunset Boulevard & all the Hollywood attractions are a short cab ride away. Overall a great hotel to stay. Upside - Helpful staff - Location Downside - None

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: MrsM0129
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza from 01/12 to 01/15 of 2012. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was very friendly. The location is great and convenient to Beverly Hills, Rodeo Drive, etc. We had a very large, clean room with a nice balcony (which faced the street and was a bit noisy with the doors opened), however, our shower was disgusting! For a hotel like this, I was shocked to see black mildew and dirt in the grout, on the tiles and on the shower door tracks. My husband and I were afraid to shower in there (good thing we brought shower shoes!). Also, we paid $10.00 for 24-hour Wi-Fi access that was slow as molasses! Overall, we would definitely stay there again, but if we got a room with a disgusting shower again, we would definitely have to request that someone clean it (which we probably should have done on this stay, but oh well....) before we used it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a great Beverly Hills location”
Reviews.Author: Ashp501
Reviews.Content: We (me and the wife) highly recommend this hotel and have actually booked it for a return trip to LA in March. The location is prime, literally a 2-minute walk to the Westfield shops and food courts (and Cinema) means you can sneak out of the hotel and eat / drink anything you want and/or pamper yourself without having to get a taxi, its a lovely street so you can walk around at night too with no worries. The actual building, inside and out is stunning and the pool / jacuzzi area is also lovely. We had a standard room with balcony and found it ticked most boxes. For the kind of money you can pay in Beverly Hills this one is well priced and a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at The Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: sherbet
Reviews.Content: This is primarily a business hotel in the City but there is also a large pool and deck area. In addition, this is a good location for exploring Beverly Hills and just a 5 minute walk from Westfield Century City Shops, for anywhere else you need a car. The room was large and quiet, the bed was comfy and the bathroom was a good size with a decent shower and a bathtub. Breakfast was expensive but you can buy fruit, yoghurts, bagels etc in Starbucks located in the lobby for a fraction of the cost. Wi-fi was only free in the lobby, there was an additional charge to have it in the room. Overall we were very happy with our stay and would definitely stay here again but would choose to have a room at the back overlooking the pool, which is a little quieter and has better views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Talal A
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hyatt during the NUKS conference, Nice hotel with a great lobby, location is good, rooms are good with balconies, rooms are new. Also a great thing is the pool and the starbucks in the lobby! Good reception and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: goodmangang
Reviews.Content: Great 4 day stay with family. Clean comfortable rooms, friendly staff. Heated pool was great. Club room could use a few more food choices that appeal to a broader age group.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and excellent view of downtown LA's skyline”
Reviews.Author: dmas6
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel and loved the restaurant Breeze for lunch. Had a chicken sandwich which was not too fancy with too many extras so it was excellent. The hotel is not too kind to having some music outside of the bar area as they don't want to disturb the guests. That was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinegirl044
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on my way back from a month world trip, the hotel has everything you need for a stopover and more. The staff very helpful and the facilities too. There is a shopping complex just behind the hotel and here you can find Macys and many more, including some good places to eat. The bus stop outside the hotel is for the hop on hop off bus tour which takes you to all the local sites and attractions. i like the Grove and farmers market, where I had a good meal at the Marmalade restaurant, can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value via Priceline”
Reviews.Author: RockyCFC
Reviews.Content: We travelled here in August 2010, so the review may be a little out of date. We reserved this hotel via Priceline and managed to get it at a really good rate considering the prices we were seeing for Hotels in LA. This was a fantastic piece of nostalgia for me as I stayed here as a child with my parents many years ago. We were very pleasently surprised by the quality of the room, was spacious clean and a modern with a nice bit of history thrown in. The staff were really helpful, one of the reception team pointing out a fantastic little diner for us to have breakfast in our first morning in the US. I also proposed to my partner whilst in LA and the concierge helped me arrange flowers etc to be sent the restaurant which was really helpful. My only gripes were the pool area felt a little tired and the Wi-FI was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gindic54
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hyatt Century Plaza, and it was amazing, the staff was ok, the can do much better. The concierge was excelent and the restorant in the lobby amazing for brakefast

Reviews.Title: “Love this place.”
Reviews.Author: dman1708
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge, quiet, well designed, have balconies and are really comfortable. I've stayed for work (business in Century City) and leisure (to visit family in Rancho Park, Cheviot Hills and Brentwood) and enjoyed it equally for both. Really nice pool, helpful service, fast parking attendants, really good happy hour bar and really good room service. All at a relatively reasonable price. Could not really ask for much more.

Reviews.Title: “A Fav Place to Stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelRod
Reviews.Content: This is an updated Hyatt property and centrally located to everything on the Westside/BH. Love the access to the Century City mall for dining/ent/shopping. Great on site spa. Rooms are tastefully done, not over the top but very nice. 4 star plus hotel from my perspective. Service is good, rarely eat in the hotel but when I have its very good. Location-clean-safe-easy access-whats not to like? Parking is easier than the W Safer than sketchy hotels on Sunset Easy to get on the freeway

Reviews.Title: “Great West LA location, Nice Facilities.”
Reviews.Author: mgeolina
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here quite a lot actually. I was just about living here for a little bit a couple of years ago. The rooms are fine and nicely appointed. I love rooms with balconies or patios and I like floor to ceiling glass, as these rooms have. It also has a big sliding door that opens wide for fresh air or if you smoke you can go right out there its pretty convenient. Being my defacto residence for a bit, I ordered a bunch of room service, at least one order or meal a day. Prices are on the higher side but on par with similarly appointed hotels. Food quality, delivery time, accuracy, and presentation all good. Only drawback is that the lobby and ground floor can be like grand central station during the day and early pm.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely decor, spotlessly clean, just beware of extra charges.”
Reviews.Author: EquineDoc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly located for my needs, so that worked well. The room was lovely, super clean and comfortable, with extra touches, such as a tube of toothpaste. I liked that. It is a busy hotel, lots of events going on, but the guest rooms are still quiet. Be sure to check out the pictures downstairs: Presidents who have stayed there. Be forewarned: the valet parking is $36 (which I did find excessive) a day and their service was a bit spotty. When I arrived, there was an event going on, so there were more attendants than necessary and I felt swarmed. When I first arrive at a place I like to collect myself and get organized. There were 5 attendants grabbing things out of the car, which was annoying and overwhelming. And then the next day, I had an early appointment. When I arrived back at the hotel, you guessed it -- not a valet attendant in sight. I walked over and gave the keys to the girl in the kiosk. She didn't even look up. I was sorry that I had put her to so much trouble. Other thing: when you are charging the daily rate that they are charging, you cannot afford to throw in free internet? I asked. And I am a member of the Hyatt Gold Passport. No way, they'll tell you to schlep your laptop to the lobby to hook up. Real convenient. I love balancing my laptop on my lap to conduct business. But, stubborn me, wouldn't give them the 9.95. It is one of my pet peeves. And my key card "timed out". I arrived back on evening, tired and ready to call it a day, and the card doesn't work. It was sorted out quickly, but... just something I did not need thrown into the mix of a high stress day. Otherwise, good stay. Enjoyed the breakfast. They had some very unique breakfast selections. If I came without a car, I would certainly stay again. With car, absolutely not.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a central LA location”
Reviews.Author: CarolA817
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. Near the Century City mall if you forget anything. Near the Beverly Hills/Rodeo Drive area. Not too far from the Hollywood area. Easy to get to the freeway if you're looking to go to other areas of LA, such as Venice Beach, Santa Monica. The hotel itself is wonderful and the staff is great. We had a very nice room, clean and great for a good night sleep. There's even a Starbucks located downstairs in the lobby area. The hotel could have received a 5 rating, although the only minus I would give the hotel is the rates of parking for hotel guests for parking/valet. I think as a guest the rate shouldn't cost as much as it is. I could see charging those who are not staying at the hotel the rate that they were charging, but basically you need to add on about $40/day for your hotel cost to get a true cost of this hotel. The hotel tries to sell the parking/valet costs as a "deal" by stating costs of the mall parking rates if we would park there instead, but we're staying at the hotel not the mall!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Annette T
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed one night, our experience was excellent. The valet was so helpful and getting our car the next day was super fast. Love the hallway decor in this hotel, soothing and the paintings and lighting make it a nice walk to your room. The bathrooms are really big, the beds very comfortable. The pool looked amazing, we didn't have time to use it. Hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Safe bet!”
Reviews.Author: no1bbd
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5days here and we have had a good experience the staff are all friendly and very helpful. It's right near Century City shopping mall and a cheap taxi drive down to Cannon Drive restaurants. I would suggest that tea & coffee facilities in the room would be nice as would easy to connect wi-fi in all rooms not just the lobby. However, would I stay again? Yes as the location is just perfect for a Berverly Hills experience, although on the expensive side, but it is Berverly Hills!

Reviews.Title: “Protester attack squads”
Reviews.Author: 4rabbit
Reviews.Content: Checked in Thursday to help with my little brother's wedding after getting a priceline reservation for 3 nights. Friday morning, 7 a.m. sharp, about 5-10 folks with amplified bullhorns started chanting at the guests (why?) for more pay and benefits, and to check-out. If people asked them to leave, they chanted on their megaphones saying that you should leave, not them. They left at about 8:15.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but severely overpriced...”
Reviews.Author: laketravishill
Reviews.Content: I suppose it's the neighborhood that puts this hotel at a premium, but if not attending for a work convention, I would never choose this hotel. Not that I can't afford it, but when I spend money, I want a good value. This is a nice hotel, and the staff is very friendly. Parking is $36 per night for valet, and $26 for self parking. The rooms, even at a convention price were about $300 with tax. The rooms are small and cramped, and they don't even have a coffee maker. I don't care how fancy a hotel thinks itself, this is gross inconvenience not having a coffee maker (even if I had to pay for the coffee from the minibar). And what blew me away is you have to pay $20 to use the gym - excuse me? I want to use the elliptical for 30 minutes a day during my 5 day stay and I would have to pay the equivalent of a 4-5 month gym membership. The staff was apologetic about this, but stated the gym is run by a third party - Hyatt, get with the program. The on-site restaurant is decent, but again, way overpriced. And of course, you have to pay for internet. The business center has odd hours, which was very inconvenient for me - a business traveler. Because of meetings, I only have time to take care of stuff at odd hours, but the biz center was not open. I actually felt a little sick looking at my final bill - if this had been my own money, I would feel as though I didn't spend it wisely. Again, this is a nice hotel, but there are alot of nice hotels. I did appreciate the staff though - good people.

Reviews.Title: “Really just average..... OK....”
Reviews.Author: drew_farris
Reviews.Content: I guess the place is OK - but for the money, it should be better than it is. Also, I know it is LA, and believe me, I get the "premium" cost of being in LA - but this place takes it to an extreme. Way too expensive for way too average. This goes for parking, FOOD (really guys??) and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Needs major improving...”
Reviews.Author: MMGq
Reviews.Content: I'm a Diamond member with Hyatt and this hotel was not up to standards of other Hyatt's. Our suite appeared very dated - old furniture, stains, etc. Cleanliness was poor too. There were hairs on the floor in both of our bathrooms. The Regency Club is very lacking in its offerings. Oh and they are extremely stingy with the honor bar. The attendant literally comes over and immediately asks for you to fill out the room charge slip. Even if you are planning to have another drink. Very awkward if you ask me. Parking for $36 is ridiculous and the walk from the self park $25 is long and very dark at night. Service standards need major improving...I walked up to the Front Desk and the clerk was chewing gum and literally popped a huge bubble right before saying "can I help you". All in all, there are much better places to stay while in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely warm reception in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Chicago60604
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice recently and each time have received genuinely warm treatment and really excellent service. The rooms are a good size, many or most with a balcony facing the sunrise or the sunset, nice for coffee in the morning or glass of wine at sunset. Rooms are contemporary and the beds very comfortable. Bathrooms are big, although the light can be a little dim, and modern but in need soon of some renovation. Large closets and plenty of storage. Ample desk space. The facilities and location of the hotel are excellent. Very large and inviting pool and surrounding bar area and a large related work-out facility (with extra charge however) The lobby and bar areas are attractive and nice places to sit and read, people watch or eat or drink. The hotel is close to Rodeo drive (a long walk or quick cab ride) and the Century City shopping mall is across the road with high end and fun shops to while away some time or go to eat or a movie. Each time we were there the personnel did something genuinely nice for us and we felt like welcomed guests, which is greatly appreciated as much as we travel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem ...”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel several times when in Los Angeles and this is a real gem. I love staying here. Yes, you pay $36 for parking, but internet is free in the lobby area, and Hyatt Gold card holders get free coffee at the Starbucks in the lobby. I was allocated a room on the Penthouse level - definitely recommended - with an ocean view. The room was lovely - every room has a terrace - and the view astounding. And you can walk easily to a range of restaurants, nightlife and shops. Looking forward to staying again. Oh, and I booked the hotel on Priceline's Name Your Price - Â£70 plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, Almost Historic by LA Standards - BUT $36 parking & $20 health club”
Reviews.Author: penpalpenpal
Reviews.Content: The place is nearly historic by LA standards. It is a great place for a large convention in good location in the center of Century City. Not small. Not intimate. Not a bargain. Examples including $9.95 internet fee, $36 parking fee (plus tips) and no free health club. If you want to work out, pay $20 per visit to Equinox on the grounds, but not part of the hotel. The pool is nice, the balconies are good and the views (facing west) are great from a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. A bit pricey, but not bad for L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Kiev_October
Reviews.Content: Summary: Great location. A bit pricey, but not bad for L.A. Recently visited the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza for a conference. Great Points: Location, location, location. This hotel is a block from Santa Monica Boulevard and about three miles from Rodeo Drive dining and shopping. It seems to be within a short drive of just about everything you want to see in L.A. â€“ 20 minutes from Venice Beach and Santa Monica Pier, close to UCLA, and pretty convenient to Downtown. Of course, it is very close to Wilshire Boulevard. If youâ€™re in LA for the shopping, thereâ€™s a mall a block away. The staff!! Very attentive, from the polite and efficient maid service to the polite and efficient valet parking team, to a checkout desk that was... polite and efficient. Mr Hyatt, you've figured out how to pick staff!! The hotel itself feels like a slightly dated movie set. We had a huge room, with a king bed, humongous bathroom, full-sized writing table, and a full-width balcony. Carpets are a little faded, paint is a little chipped, furniture has seen better days, but the T.V. worked and the in-room safe was one of the largest I have seen in the U.S. â€“ big enough for two laptop computers, cameras, and I probably could have fit my gym bag as well! And speaking of gyms. The hotel has a 25 meter outdoor pool, thatâ€™s free to guests and open to 10pm, and there is a fitness center (Equinox) that is on the Hyatt premises. Equinox is one of those places with valet parking for your Ferrari, and the staff is a little condescending. But itâ€™s got great hours and fabulous equipment, including a spin studio. It costs $20 per day per person; I thought it was well worth it. (I made the mistake one morning of taking a jog over to a nearby 24-Hour Fitness Club. 24-Hour Fitness is â€œmy gymâ€� in San Diego. If you score the 24 hour fitness clubs in San Diego one point each for lighting, cleanliness, equipment, and friendly staff, most are 4 on a scale of 4. The 24-Hour Fitness Center in Century City, near the Hyatt scores at most a 1 on this scale). The conference center on the lower level was truly outstanding. There is a large theater-style auditorium, and the smaller rooms for the breakout session had good acoustics. I guess the conference center not only attracts guests from every corner of the world, but also what I think was well dressed scum from LA. Why do I think this? Because s/he lifted my new IPhone right there in the conference registration lobby. I think I would have noticed poorly attired scum. One flaw in what would otherwise be a great setup â€“ breakfast. There is a Starbucks in the lobby that was way too small for the number of people lined up between 6:30 and 9 every morning. There is also a Starbucks across the street, equally busy. We did not feel like driving to get breakfast, and the room service prices are truly extortionist. Bring a thermos of coffee and skip the line! There is a very nice sit-down restaurant on the lobby level. While it does not compete with any of the amazing and quite inexpensive restaurants on Rodeo Drive, we had dinner there one night. The food was good, if not great. Service was very attentive, and very quick for a hotel of this size. The hotel was reasonably quiet. We were on the side facing the street (Avenue of the Stars) and even though we were about 9 floors up, could still hear street noise, particularly busses. Thereâ€™s also a night club across the street. If you can get a room on the â€œgardenâ€� side facing away from the street, it will be quieter. Price? If you need to askâ€¦no, actually including hotel room, valet parking (a must), gym, and L.A. taxes, it came out to be about $300 a night for the two of usâ€“ no bargain, but what we expected in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: David94707
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with some drawbacks. Very clean, well-appointed, standard hotel room, bed comfortable, bathroom roomy. Hotel staff was spotty- there was some construction on our floor and they promised there would be no noise before 9:30, but they were banging away at 8:30. Room service was friendly and prompt, though the multiple "fees" they tack on were almost comical. The Valet parking, a $36 dollar add-on!, was often very slow to retrieve our car- best to call for it 20-25 minutes early. Worst thing was we expected a gym at this 4-star hotel, but there was none in-house. Rather, they sent you to an adjoining building, where you had to pay $20/day.

Reviews.Title: “Super LA Location”
Reviews.Author: JimB58
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at the Century Plaza. This hotel is located in a perfect location for a west LA base. Stayed on a Friday and Saturday. It is close to Beverly Hills, Westwood, and a 15 minute drive to Downtown LA. (with reasonable traffic). Mall and movie theaters across street, and several restaurant choices in the mall. Staff was very friendly, helpful and seemed to enjoy working there. Room was recently updated with flat screens. Only negative comment was size of bathrooms and lack of shelf or drawers to put bathroom stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roenicke35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel the week of October 16th for a convention being held at the LA Convention Center. A bit far by shuttle bus (~45 minutes), but well worth the extra time. Great rooms and friendly staff. Located withing walking distance of an outdoor mall with restaurants and high shops. Starbucks in lobby. Great open air lobby bar as soon as you enter.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the standard of a Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: SiskiyouTraveler
Reviews.Content: Let me say I have given the Hyatt Regency Century City a fair chance. I have stayed on three separate occasions over the last year, each a minimum of three nights. The location is convenient, the rooms are very nice, the pool and bar look great. Let me also say that I am a frequent guest at the Kimpton Palomar and the Intercontinental Century City so I know the competition. Each time at the Hyatt there have been frustrations, but the last visit was the last straw. On Sunday midnight 10/31 they had a planned electric power shutdown at the hotel from until 4 am. Yes, I said planned, not accidental. The only notification I received was a note in my room when I arrived back at 11:30 pm. No notice at booking. No notice at check in. No notice the day before. So after an extremely stressful meeting, I could not watch TV, read a book, use my laptop, or take a shower. The Hyatt provided a chemical glow stick for light. Seriously, camping at the Hyatt Regency? Yes, I did complain in person at the front desk. Even though I am a Hyatt Gold member, because I had booked through Travelocity, the front desk could not refund my room so I could move to another hotel. Yes, they did offer me free valet parking in compensation. Sorry, but that did not help me relax so I could get some sleep. The letter said they only do this once a year (lucky me) but the true issue is the management's attitude. This attitude applies to many other issues at the Hyatt, If you stay during the week, and are not part of a convention, you will find the lobby packed, a ridiculously long wait to check in, and an impossible line at Starbucks. The valet parking is incredibly congested and has not improved over a year's time. It can take 10 minutes waiting to drop off your car and over 15 minutes for them to retrieve it. And for this they charge $36 a day! Yes, I have parked in the self-park lot. This is a long outdoor walk in the dark around the corner and up/down stairs to reach the hotel entrance. Not comfortable for women who are alone. Management needs to stop resting on reputation of the hotel from 20 - 30 years ago and start addressing the current problems. I'll stick with the Palomar from now on - excellent and personal service, free wireless, wine hour each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury but more of a Formal Hotel than a 'Holiday Hotel'”
Reviews.Author: Sessel
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were really taken aback at how luxurious this hotel was. The rooms are very European luxury style (i.e. one big bed and one sink etc rather than the American luxury of two big beds and dual sinks in bathroom) but we preferred this as it made us feel more at home and it added to the classiness I felt. We were on the 13th floor (they called it 14th as the floors skipped from 12th floor to 14th so it was actually 13 floors up but maybe they are superstitious) and we had a great view up towards LA and of the impressive buildings in front of the hotel. We sat on the balcony most mornings watching the sun come up with our coffees. That was one negative there is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room so you have to order from room service (extremely expensive) or you can get one from Starbucks downstairs in the lobby, nice touch I thought but some facilities in your room would be nice too. There is a Westfields shopping centre just behind the hotel and in there (along with all the shops) there is a food court and some really good restaurants. We went out for a couple of meals at night there and also got our breakfast from the supermarket restaurant every day. Breakfast was not included in our room rate and was far too expensive for us (plus my boyfriend hates eggs and everything on the breakfast menu seemed to contain eggs) so we had a walk round there every morning and got some fruit salads and coffees to bring back to the room. The hotel has a gym ($20 per person per day for use, but you can use it as many times throughout that day as you like) it seems expensive but you get what you pay for, I used it once and my boyfriend used it a few times. It was lovely, everything so new and clean and also some great machines in there, I was a bit overexcited at the fact you could choose a TV channel to watch whilst on the elliptical machine, I watched half a film on it and increased my workout time by about 25 minutes, the novelty factor was brilliant. It has all the machines and free weights you need to have a really full, good solid workout. They also have daily classes you can attend as part of your gym fee, we didn't try them but they looked good. There is a spa also but we didn't use this as we didn't have time. The hotel has a lovely pool area and outside bar, unfortunately we didn't have time to use this whilst we were there but it looked like a great place to chill out and have a swim, I dipped my feet into the water and it was very warm!! The staff were very helpful and the maid service extremely efficient and thorough. The only downside to this hotel is it's location. It is located in Century City which is more of a business area than a holiday area. There is the Westfields shopping centre nearby which has restaurants, bars and a cinema though so there is something to do. But it is 8 miles from Hollywood and roughly 7 miles from Santa Monica so if you want some proper night-life you have to cab it to one of those places (we used the bus one night and wished we hadn't apparently Los Angeles buses at night are not the safest of places) We got a cab to Venice for $30 which isn't too expensive considering the distance but if you were wanting to go out down near Santa Monica every night it would add up ($60 each night there and back) but then again everything in Los Angeles is spread out anyway so this is not an unusual thing. We hired a car and parked it in the car park at the back of the hotel which was $24 overnight, the valet was $35 but the only benefit from that was that you could go in and out multiple times and the other car park you couldn't. But Westfields car park is free up to an hour or so, so if you need to pop back to the hotel during the day you can park up there and then only use the paid for hotel car park at night which stops the need for valet parking, unless you just prefer the ease of that kind of thing. Overall it is a beautiful luxurious hotel but just a little too expensive for us, if you are really splashing out or staying here for business it is a perfect hotel. One last thing if you want wifi you have to pay for it and it is very expensive, but if you take your laptop down to the lobby and log onto the wifi it is free there, you can then take your laptop up to your room and still have the free wifi for 24 hours from that point. A little tip we were given before we went to the hotel and so glad we were told about it. I think the hotel are aware people do this and don't seem to mind.

Reviews.Title: “Superb room”
Reviews.Author: ScottishPaul
Reviews.Content: This hotels location makes it rather expensive, but you get what you pay for, the room was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: roscoe2010
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Excellent service. Very good location. One negative-would have appreciated a better option for self parking. That being said, valet service was always excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: misscuriousity
Reviews.Content: Big, clean, spacious room. Bathroom is a little tight. Valet parking. Location is great for the Beverly hills area...not so much for Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: melbournetravellers
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel & thoroughly enjoyed it. Our room was large, nicely decorated & had great views - everything we would expect from a Hyatt Hotel. We even received a welcome fruit platter & letter on arrival. The Regency Club members room was quite small compared to what we were used to, but we did enjoy the pre-dinner drinks & canapes as well as the lovely fresh fruit and continental breakfast - oh and the free wi-fi! We tried X-bar one night which has a fun atmosphere but was rather expensive. The pool was great and we enjoyed a number of cocktails by the pool which was very relaxing! The location was fantastic - right around the corner from Westfield shopping centre & fantastic restaurants and just a short stroll to the gorgeous Beverly Hills & Rodeo Drive. We had a car with us and it was relatively cheap to leave it in valet parking which was a nice change! Overall we loved our stay here and would highly recommend it to others traveling to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Edward-A A
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel is not located in downtown LA, there is a large shopping mall nearby (within 5-minutes walking distance) and with many high-quality restaurants and food court. Good swimming pool and fitness center and good in-room dining service. I also like the Starbucks here and if you are a Hyatt Diamond/Platinum member, you have free Starbucks coupons as well!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mikefre3
Reviews.Content: This Hotel ticked all the boxes for us on a recent 5 day break to L A . We had a lovely big room overlooking the fountain and the awesome buildings at 2000 Avenue of the Stars. The Concierge was a mine of information and very helpful and the valet parking, whilst pricey at $ 36 a day , worked well for us and was much easier than self park ( $24) which is a bit of a walk and dosen,t allow for unlimited re entry. The hotel is 2 mins walk from a big Westfield centre that has enough restaurants to cater for at least a weeks stay, and a supermarket for beer, wine , water etc. There is also an even bigger Westside centre 10 mins drive away. Starline bus tours stop outside, book the tour via concierge and spend the first day on this trip, and then cherry pick what you like under your own steam thereafter ( a car is a must ) . The hotel is known as a convention destination , we were lucky - there was a knitting convention which was bizarre to look at , and a Ferrari convention with 25 Ferraris and 2 Lamborghinis parked outside for 2 nights! Neither made noise ( apart from cars) and were a great window on US culture. All in all a really nice hotel as a base for Santa Monica, Bev hills etc and whatever you do don,t miss the Getty Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Xbar Staff are RUDE”
Reviews.Author: Prince_Nono
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel is what you expect in any 5-star hotel. Great pool, beautiful spacious rooms, wifi good (costs $10/day), parking costs $36/day. I was there to attend a conference which went fine. The only issue I had (which negatively influenced my rating) is with the Xbar staff. They have managed to recruit some of the rudest humans in the service industry. The bigger problem is that there was no one there to complaint to. I left it at that as there is nothing more to do.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel with OK location.”
Reviews.Author: rossharris
Reviews.Content: It is obvious that Hyatt Century Plaza went through a massive rennovation and ivnestment. The decor is modern, the elevators are rocket ships, and the whole place feels "new" century. But, if you look close, you can see elements of the old hotel including a mail chute (how cute). In total, I must say that it was a good hotel with good service and ammenities. My only complaint would be that food service in the Breeze restaurant was painfully slow. It caused my dining group to be late to our afternoon meetings. The prices in the restaurants are what you would expect from a hotel...high, very high. There is a starbucks in the lobby which is very convenient. The folks who work there are the friendliest in the hotel. My other complaint would be the lack of coffee makers in the room. You have to call to room service or housekeeping to get one delivered. Also, be careful with the minibar. It is on a "hair trigger". SOME HELPFUL TIPS: -Bring coat hangers if more than one of you will be in the room. You get about 5. -Bring your MP3 or iPod. There is a plugin to the hotel clock radio. So, you can enjoy your own tunes. -There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby and meeting rooms. Use it. Wi-fi in the rooms is $13++ -If you connect a mobile device such as an iPad, iPod etc. to the lobby wi-fi, it stays connected when you return to your room. So, you can keep the free Wi-fi going for 24 hours. -If you use the app Foursquare, be sure to check-in at the hotel. You get a coupon for free coffee at the Starbucks which is a plus given the steep prices. -The mall across the street has loads of good places to eat and shop. So, don't stay stuck in the hotel. -Try to go to Vanilla in the mall for somehting sweet...the macaroons are the best. -For an awesome margarita or other tequilla drink, go to Pink Taco in the mall. Have fun and enjoy LA, the land of one season!

Reviews.Title: “Additional charge”
Reviews.Author: tiisai
Reviews.Content: Parking sucks... Can you believe valet is cheaper if you need in and out and it is $36 a day... Crazy Self park is $3 per 15 mins and max out at $24 with no in out privilege plus is a bit of walk and there is only stairs. Everything is extra including mini fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Veryy Pleased, I will forsure come backk!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kriss16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Aug 20-24, 3 families, with a group of 15 ages 6 to 60!! I was a bit dissapointed that we all couldnt be in the same floor, as we he each had 2 rooms each. It was the least of my worry though! When checkin in i asked about the free starbucks cards as the operator on the phone signed each family up as we booked our room!! And we all got one each! The place overall was quite beautiful, the rooms were amazing!!! I slept like a baby considering that we were across from the elevator, at the front of the hotel (traffic) and there is a water fountain in the front outside which they shut off at night! We did valet parking, and I see people complaining about prices, but what do u expect? Your in Los angeles, your in a high end area and very close to bevelery hills and rodeo drive. I would like to point out that you are in the center of the city!! Minutes away from a mall (walking distance), close to Beverly Hills, Rodeo Drive, Hollywood, THe Highways, Santa MOnica beach, and many more!!! And the staff was great, might i just add!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Candace8789
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband last weekend while he attended a conference at the hotel. The service was fantastic and the people who worked there incredibly friendly. When we checked out we were given two vouchers for complimentary coffee at the Starbucks located in the hotel, and the girl who worked there threw in our two bananas we were purchasing for free as well! The rooms and location were pretty average, but the staff were great!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible”
Reviews.Author: Conchliver123
Reviews.Content: I have worked in a five star resort for five years and traveled all over and I have never received such phenomenal service. The location was great the rooms outstanding but the service incredible. I made it a point to go to the manager to let him know from one to another manager he must be doing something right! The restaurant down stairs was great I wish I could remember the name of our waiter he was awesome and so good with the kids. All that said best hotel I have ever stayed at. Ps the beds are sooooo comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: deedee1951
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and common areas. Service was excellent in all areas. Pool area lovely

Reviews.Title: “It's the Hyatt, A Charge For EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: lmoore406
Reviews.Content: As expected the Hyatt Regency Century is luxurious from the moment you walk into the building, to the restaraunts, to the rooms. Though this luxury comes with a cost that does not stop when you pay for the hotel room. You have to pay for parking, whether it is self parking or valet ($24/$36), the gym, breakfast, the cabanas, airport shuttle,wireless, etc. Even the "edgeless" pool was not impressive to what I would have expected. I have a hard time justifying paying to park and to use the gym, when paying between $150-$260 a night, for that price everything should be included. Mainly outside of the name of the hotel, it really has nothing special to truly offer to actually justify the cost. I mean it is a room with a bed(s), a TV, and a bathroom. So what does the hotel really have that others do not to account for the cost of the room? I am not sure. The positives of the hotel, location! The hotel sits next to Westfield Mall, which offers several restaraunt choices, shopping, and a great atmosphere. A few more positives - employees are very nice, the rooms are clean, and the rooms have a balcony. If you do not mind paying for the extras when already paying $150+ a night, then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel if you are travelling as a family”
Reviews.Author: Aidan1976
Reviews.Content: Please read carefully all the other traveller reviews. This is not a hotel - it is a conference centre. We stayed for 1 week and had only 1 day that was not disrupted by conferences. The first was a 3 day "remax" conference that took over large parts of the hotel and closed of many of the communal areas.... The second was a 3 day party organised by playboy for 400 guests and, this meant that the pool and outdoor area were off limits to regular guests - totally unacceptable when travelling as I was with small children. None of this was mentioned by my travel agent and I was not offered any satisfactory form of compensation. Otherwise the hotel is good, but please check with the hotel prior to booking that you won't suffer a similar disappointment / inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-Century Architecturural Gem in A Sterile Office Park Setting”
Reviews.Author: cyclistmike
Reviews.Content: I was kind of stunned to learn that this hotel was almost a victim of the wreckers ball (http://www.laconservancy.org/_googlesearch/?q=century+plaza&x=0&y=0), and glad that its mid-century architecture and history as a Western White House of sort where many diginitaries have stayed was preserved. The lobby is lovely and very spacious, and the pool area had both a lap pool and spa as well as some private cabanas. There was a grill for light fare. The hotel is in the stark office area of Century City, but close to Westfields, an upscale shopping mall you can walk to for shopping and food. All else you need to drive to....In general,the room was comfortable and had a nice balcony overlooking the pool and skyline. The place felt a bit corporate. I had to ask for newspapers, such as New York Times, at front desk--they were provided but not out to see and not without first asking. I also had to pay for daily internet, which was another insult at this rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AJandJG
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline and stayed here for one night, mid-week. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. It was also nice to be able to sit out on the balcony. The only thing in walking distance is Westfield Mall, which has a nice food court, some other restaurants, and good shopping. We enjoyed a drink at the lobby bar and the service was prompt and friendly. We spoke to 2 concierges during out stay and both were satisfactory - not the friendliest or most helpful, but neither was rude. We were given free breakfast buffet coupons upon check-in and took advantage of that the next morning. The buffet was excellent, but I'm not sure if it would be worth the price if we had to pay. We parked in the self-serve lot to save a few dollars on parking. If you park here and you have luggage, there is a gate on the walkway that leads to the back of the hotel. It's much easier to go that way then to deal with the stairs. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beverly Hills Shopping Trip, Loved Hotel and will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: AKGIRL411
Reviews.Content: I booked here not knowing what to expect, as I had not been here in 15 years, and I was amazed at at the hotel, located right int he heart of Beverly Hills! The room was great, except that it did not cool very well, other than that it was clean, big comfy bed, private balcony overlooking Century City, and Beverly Hills. Very convenient to all shopping, restaurants, etc. Hotel staff was very polite and accommodating, concierge very knowledgable! I would highly recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Great Hotel, shame about the constant parties”
Reviews.Author: tromanCardiff
Reviews.Content: It's not often I'm disappointed. I was going to give this review a 5/5 and I felt this way throughout my entire stay, but it all changed on the last day. When I got here, I had the best welcoming I've ever had from reception. They couldn't be more helpful and informative. When I was taken to my room, I was very impressed. The rooms were big and spotlessly clean. There's ipod docks in each room and balconies. Despite this, the minibar was terribly expensive and the charges for room service were extortionate. This didn't bother me anyway, as I didn't intent to use it. The hotel is right next to Westfield Shopping Centre, which has some great shops. The restaurant was good with reasonable prices for a 5* hotel. I recommend taking Star Line City Sightseeing as it has a stop right outside the hotel. The swimming pool was great and a really warm jacuzzi. I rented a car through Hertz in the hotel, which was marvelous and was also brought up from Valet Parking for you. The one thing that would have been nice, would have been to have newspapers to the room. As you can see, my stay was perfect and a real 5* service was being provided, BUT, that was all going to change. The hotel had regular parties and conference parties, which during the end of my stay was becoming a daily and nightly thing. I was not happy with this as there was very loud music being played throughout the day right through to 1am most nights. I didn't think this was acceptable for a 5* star hotel, but nevertheless I put up with it. My last night at the hotel saw another party. The biggest of them all so far. The hotel was full with tarty 'playboy wannabees' and flirtatious middle aged men. This party, like the others was loud and continuous until 1am again. Again I thought they'd have all gone by the morning and I wouldn't see them again. Unfortunately, the following morning, they were all still there, partying around the poolside with loud music. Also, the pool was out of action as this party had got so mental in the night, there was glass in the pool and filter system, so there was no pool for many hours. Now this was my last day. I was only here until 4, so I was very angry to find the pool closed until 1pm. I felt sorry for all the families with young kids who couldn't make the most of the amenities of this 'family friendly' hotel. I was offered to go to the Intercontinental pool, but this is 5-10 minutes walk away. My advice is, don't come here if you're a family, because you will be disturbed and overwhelmed by a mass crowd of party goers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt uphold the brand reputation by providing excellent and friendly service from check-in to check-out. Personnel is attentive to guest needs and met my expectations. Room was spacious and everything worked properly, the bed was good but not as good as other top brand hotels. Location is excellent if your business is in that specific area. The gym, bar, and restaurant were adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the partying!”
Reviews.Author: RosieCadiff
Reviews.Content: On first arrival, my family and I felt that we had left the best til last [we were on a 2 week Californian trip and this was our last port of call for 6 days before returning home]. However, we were very much mistaken. It's a 5 star very good looking, comfortable hotel with good facilities and fairly close to attractions/amenities. There's just one problem and believe me if you have had a hectic 2 week tour like we had, we wanted peace and quiet with relaxation. The hotel appears to attract the party folk including event organisers. Every day and night an event would take place that would take over the entire hotel inside and out. This included many pool parties - day and night! You were lucky if you got a lounger by the pool let alone space in the pool to swim. Loud music blasting all day by a poolside DJ with young female wannabes and sleezy males parading around with limited clothing. This went on sometimes til about 1.00 a.m. The night before we were due to fly home there was a pool party that got out of hand and revellers thought it would be fun to throw glasses and bottles into the pool - some of which smashed causing the pool to be out of action the following day. Needless to say we were not impressed. Instead of offering us some sort of compensation staff just told us to use the hotel's pool down the road instead [Intercontinental - wish we stayed there]. However, service and cleanliness is very good. Our stay was just let down by this 'partying' attitude. Really think the Hyatt should grow up! Not really for families.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine but the location was NOT fun for me...”
Reviews.Author: Kreskin2207
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly fine its just the location that sucks. The room was clean and the staff friendly. There's a bar in the main lobby and a bar with outside seating (X Bar) which has fire pits spread around. There's a Starbucks in the lobby that opens at 6am (come on man, can't you just make it 5:30 for those of us with early flights?!) The hotel is across the street from the Westfield Mall and in perfect proximity to a slew of lawyers if you need one. The only thing in walking distance here is the mall so if you're up for shopping you're in luck. Definitely do not go the Breeze restaurant or whatever it is. I can't find any reason to recommend that. We went for lunch and enjoyed sub-par service and an $18 grilled cheese....which sucked. As someone put it when I told them where I was staying, "oh that's cool....not the coolest...but cool."

Reviews.Title: “Great As Always, But Beware The Expensive Parking”
Reviews.Author: RoyalSilk
Reviews.Content: As for personal reasons this is my second favourite hotel in the world, I am biased. However this hotel continues to shape up well and located as it is close to the Century City Shopping Plaza, a view over the back facing south (you may need to pay extra for this) also allows great views of the sunset. Service was very good (you would expect that). It's 1.4 miles from the Young Israel of Century City congregation - though the hills make it seem a longer walk. Do watch for the parking though - there isn't any cheap lots around. I found the $29 a day touch in the parking garage next to MGM the cheapest.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient for an overnight stay, but needs renovations, especially carpeting”
Reviews.Author: Bearnard
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night for a business trip. Front desk was ok, but upon discovery of my Hyatt member status, they became friendlier. It was immediately noticeable that the carpeting needed to be thoroughly cleaned, or probably better yet replaced. The room was moderatley updated, but I would say other Hyatt Regencies have better upgrades. I didn't get to use the vouchers they gave me for free coffee , as there were 20 in line with the same vouchers and only 3 staff working the stand. Overall suffucient for the stay, but could use improvement. I wouldn't want to stay for an extended period as is.

Reviews.Title: “It's a terrific Hyatt. A real one.”
Reviews.Author: Silent Crow
Reviews.Content: First off, I am not a chain hotel guy at all, but if my favorite boutique hotel is sold out in LA, I always choose this Hyatt. It's old-school top-notch Hyatt Regency. Great amenities and classic service. Yes, you pay a bundle for valet, and breakfast costs a lot, but this is LA, baby. Account for that in your budget. The rooms have great balconies, they're very nicely appointed with all the fancy fixin's, and it's in the most business-friendly location there is in LA. Easy to get to Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Studio City, several networks (across the street), and the FOX lot is a 2 minute drive. It's also not typically a "scene" in there with scads of people milling about with their flip-flops looking for the "Homes of the Stars" bus. Whew. If you're NOT in LA on business, you'd still like the hotel - I just wonder why you'd stay in Century City. So if you make that mistake and wonder why you're paying 20 bucks for your eggs, then that's on you. I like it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you like to be nickel and dimed and adore tired decor”
Reviews.Author: jannibob
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here the last week of July. This was a vacation. On its website this hotel says it is recently remodeled and has gym facilities. I don't consider tired decor and worn, needs a cleaning carpets to be recently remodeled. Maintenance is also an issue - bathtub didn't drain and mold is building up in the corners of the shower. I have seen Days Inns with compatible decor. The gym facilities are available if you'd like to spend $ 20 per day per person. Wireless in the room is an extra charge. The courtesy bar is wired so that if you move anything you've bought it. Forget bringing in a drink and cooling it in their frig. They will rent you another refrigerator for a fee. You also must request daily changes of sheets and towels. Hyatt pases this off as a green incentive, get real -- this is a budget issue for the hotel. This hotel is horrible -- they nickel and dimed us the entire stay and our room was too ugly to do anything in but sleep and I wanted a blindfold to do that. Room reeked of cheap sanitizer and insecticide. Hyatt got us this time - but we were Hyatt Gold members who now will never spend another night in a Hyatt hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Stay”
Reviews.Author: tk72
Reviews.Content: Location is a mixed bag - Just a few metres from the Century City shopping mall, so very accessible to a wide range of restaurants, food outlets, cinemas & shopping. However not so well connected by public transport, and you have to drive or take a cab almost everywhere. However, the whole of LA is poorly connected by public transport, so I guess it might have been a similar story anywhere we stayed. The hotel is fair, rooms are fairly basic, but comfortable. The staff were OK, but would not call them the friendliest.

Reviews.Title: “They made our "Make a Wish" trip special!”
Reviews.Author: mzkris10
Reviews.Content: Wow! We were so impressed with not just the facility, but the staff. EVERY employee we came in contact with was nothing but friendly, service-oriented, professionals. Javier, one of the valet employees was fantastic! He had the best guest-service mentality and personality! We enjoyed all of the on-site amenities and can't say enough about our overall experience. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: harvey019
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the and of a 3 week holiday touring the west coast. Wished we had booked longer. Facilities were all great hotel room was immaculate, could not fault anything. Traveled as a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 69gtojim
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a decnet business hotel in a corporate area of town. My only gripes were the long walk to the parking garage which was way out back, up stairs, through elevators etc. and also the $25/day charge to use the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “A gem still exists in LA Land”
Reviews.Author: globbiztravel
Reviews.Content: On my travels and always staying at Hyatt I have stayed at this property several times over the years. I always feel like royalty driving up to valet. Great location. The rooms are spacious and great for business travelers like myself. High speed Internet is excellent and business center available as well. Excellent location with a large mall around the corner and just centralized enough if most meetings are on the west side of town. I can't say enough about the wonderful staff. From arrival to departure and everywhere in between attention to details and courteous friendly attentive staff makes this a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality ,location and service”
Reviews.Author: Shube1
Reviews.Content: The Century Hyatt never fails in its quality and service well placed near major freeways and Beverly Hills this hotel is your best bet for business close to restaurants malls and business in Beverly Hills or downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic Century City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: notsofrosty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an anniversary, weekend getaway. This Hyatt has been here for a very long time and is a recognizeable building in West LA. It has been remodeled elegantly and tastefully. We were very pleased with our stay. I don't think you can go wrong with either the ocean or the city views. The ocean view overlooks Santa Monica city and out to the sea, but know that the ocean is quite a distance away. The city view gives you a beautiful perspective of 2000 Ave of the Stars, which now stands where the former ABC studios and Shubert Theater once stood. The architectural style of 2000 Ave is both unique and gorgeous and you will definitely not be shortchanged on this side of the hotel. We actually preferred it over the ocean view. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Elevators were very quick. The lobby has a Starbucks for which we were given complimentary passes at check in. We found all the staff extremely polite and helpful. The room is a bit small but not unusual for city hotel rooms, and naturally any remodeling was constrained by the original architecture. The location is right next to Beverly Hills, Brentwood and Santa Monica. There is a large mall across the street, which makes some food/shopping convenient, but I would suggest using one's own car for other LA travel as there is not much else in immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference hotel and family loved it too!”
Reviews.Author: s0ccerdad
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty sure this is the hotel where Claire from Modern Family got her trench coat stuck in the lobby escalator on Valentine's day! Great west LA location. Friendly service. Love having Starbucks in the lobby. 1 block from great upscale shopping including Microsoft and Apple stores. Good balcony view although it is a little noisy. My family loved the outdoor pool area. Rec staff were very good with my 11-year-old son. Spacious room. What you would expect from a Hyatt. I would prefer if there was self parking and if the minibar fridge had room for personal items.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location.. extended check out.. awesome room!”
Reviews.Author: poshw5
Reviews.Content: The location is fab. Right next to Century City Mall which is by the way fantastic.. and I enjoyed shopping here more than New York! Easy distance from Bev Hills.. a 20 min drive to Hollywood. I can't fault this hotel. We had a heavy package delivered and they were very careful with it. They extended our check out so we had more time in the room before our late night flight and they looked after our luggage! I thought the buffet breakfast was immense. I would definitely stay here again if I go back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service”
Reviews.Author: kritch
Reviews.Content: After a lost booking at another hotel, at 1am I called the Hyatt to see if they had a room available. Thankfully not only did they have an available room, they gave us a discount and directions to the hotel. When we arrived very tired at the hotel, we had a speedy check in and were given a 2pm checkout. Nothing was too much and they were very helpful. We were only there for one night so we didn't try out any of the facilities of the hotel but the service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but unfriendly (Platinum member review)”
Reviews.Author: heather1997
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, glamorously refurbished with stunning spacious marble bathroom and balcony. The receptionist checking us in was very nice and moved our room to one with a view of the pool and the MGM building which we appreciated. Â The location is great. Right next to upmarket shopping centre with excellent restaurants, Rock Sugar being our favorite.Â  The pool area was great, the lobby gift shop and Starbucks were well stocked.Â  Luis carried our luggage to our room and provided us with a charming introduction to Century Plaza. The bar staff in the lobby were very good but i have to say the Concierge staff were quite unfriendly, no smiles from any of them.Â  The bellhops on the day we checked out were also unfriendly and really quite rude when we wanted to get my daughters jumper from a bag they were storing.Â  The Concierge desk recommended a tour company called El Dorado which we booked for their 2.5hr celeb homes and Hollywood tour. It was very disappointing. I would definitely not recommend it. Of all the tours we did in Washington, Raleigh and Warner Bros, this was very disappointing. They don't seem to have a presence on Trip Advisor or I would have reviewed them there. However I would still recommend this hotel overall for the rooms, the location and most of the staff and will stay there again when next in LA.Â

Reviews.Title: “Plan to wait awhile at the front desk...”
Reviews.Author: Trvlite
Reviews.Content: I like the location and ambience of this hotel, however, the service at the front desk is consistently slow... If you are on a business trip checking in late and hungry while the next morning has an early meeting then give yourself at least 15 more minutes to be at the front desk. But if you are on vacation, then go ahead and chat up a storm with the front desk personnel while a line of people wait impatiently to check in! The room service is good even though the selection is sparse but food is tasty and service is great so do order room service if you are too tired to leave the room or have too much work to do.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay hear again, unless I have NO other choice”
Reviews.Author: wineguysf
Reviews.Content: I am giving this hotel a 1 for one reason only... they have NO Gym.
