Yes, for $20 a day, you can go to the gym across the court yard, but comon... in 15 years of traveling and staying in 4 and 5 star hotels, I've NEVER been in one that has no gym or makes a guest pay. I had a VERY long tiring day today and had 30 minutes to get some excercise in and this was just so disappointing. $20 for 20 min... it's the principal. I'm already paying $300+ a night to stay here. Forget about it. The W Hotel in Westwood is just as nice if not nicer and they have a nice Gym. I'll go back there. See ya Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...”
Reviews.Author: erinlayne89
Reviews.Content: First of all the bellman told me and my fiance that we could handle our own bags (after we asked for assistance up to our room). Then the front desk agent was extremely rude and unhelpful. The room was nice once we got in. We decided that we would go to their restaurant downstairs Breeze for lunch. There was no one at the front podium and when someone finally came to the front, they answered the phone, finished the conversation, looked at us and walked away!! Later that night (early into the morning) we ordered room service with seemingly no problem. Except for when we called for the tray to be taken out of our room, they said they would be up shortly. Almost an hour later we had to call back because they still had not been up to our room to take our tray out. They told us that they came up but because we did not put the tray outside the door (something that I, nor my hotel employed fiance was aware of) they left. All around horrible experience with mostly rude employees (with the exception of the housekeeping department and the ladies/gentleman at both the Starbucks outlet and the Sundries store). I will never stay at a Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: davekat
Reviews.Content: Travelled on my own and needed a hotel for 1 night in the Beverly Hills area. Booked through Hotwire/Priceline for a very reasonable price. Great location, excellent service at front desk, valet parking, and concierge who offerred great advice to help me see what I wanted to in the 2 days I was there. Rent a car, don't try to get around without one. No problems driving with GPS.

Reviews.Title: “If the location is right for you this is the hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: bXMi
Reviews.Content: Location is so-so even with a car, but it really depends on what is the purpose of your stay. Our experience was that the hotel was located too far away from the restaurants we wanted to visit in the evenings. Taxi rides were not cheap, but the only option if we wanted to have a drink at diner. The distance to Santa Monica and Malibu was okay, except during rush hour. The room was excellent and very spacious, clean and nicely decorated. Service was good and the people at the valet parking were efficient and friendly. I did however choke at the price of valet parking. $35 a night and then some on tips really adds up and my impression is that the Priceline deal of $110 (129 incl. taxes) was not that good after all. I also disliked that wi-fi was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like Pretty Woman!”
Reviews.Author: lupie_love
Reviews.Content: This hotel was SOOO pretty and the atmosphere was SOOO upscale I felt like I was 'pretty woman' walking into an uber-classy establishment where I was underdressed for the occasion! The price was good for what you got. The view from the patio was great, too. Menu was pricey, so we mostly ate at the nearby mall and restaurants. Lovely stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “I always love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAgolfgirl
Reviews.Content: Each time I'm in LA for business I try and stay at this hotel. It get's very busy in the drive way area when you are valeting your car but the guys there are wonderful. Some have been there for years as I recognize them every time. The rooms are very nice, the beds are fantastic and I love it that they give you toothpaste and don't CHARGE you. Nice having a Starbucks on the bottom floor and if you are a Starwood member and stay there a few times, they always give me a free coupon for a coffee. I'm a tough one to please but they do it for me!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mayoite74
Reviews.Content: We needed a base for our short stay in LA and the Century Plaza offered a really great deal through Priceline. As we were doing the tourist thing (Universal Studios, LACMA, etc) the location on Avenue of the Stars in West Hollywood was ideal. We wrote to them beforehand and asked for connecting rooms since we were travelling as a family and they obliged with two large rooms facing the main Avenue. The only thing disappointing was the car parking service for which we got charged an astronomical $36/day. Thought the valet service was efficient and prompts, had I known this beforehand I would have parked the car myself and walked the short distance to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Don't complain about gas prices after paying parking fees”
Reviews.Author: Jack1560a
Reviews.Content: I just finished a stay at the regency. I'm a platinum member of hyatt and this hotel is a strong 4 diamond.the staff was very helpful and pleasant. The lobby bar waitress was preoccupied with herself and ignoring the customers. Could not get service. I think the name hyatt should be more visible as you don't even know it's a hyatt you just think is "century plaza hotel". The rooms were clean and everything was working. The tv should be larger. Great location just outside Beverly hills. The was over $30 per night. I think it the hotel should raise the room rate and advertise parking free. I loved having a balcony which you don't find in a lot of hotels these days. I have stayed many times at this hotel and would come back as it is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved how we were treated while we were here”
Reviews.Author: lovept
Reviews.Content: The whole family of 15 stayed at this hotel the night before the UCLA graduation. Conviently located, short walk to an awesome mall. The property was sold out the night we arrived so they upgraded our reservation to a penthouse suite. Even though we didn't even stay 12 hours in it, it was AWESOME!!! Loved the upgraded ammenities! I wish we could have stayed and enjoyed the pool/cabanas. They looked great. Valet was fast and being a hyatt gold member got us complementary starbucks! Great time at the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Top of the league - in overcharging”
Reviews.Author: juliusjulius
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels around Los Angeles all the time. I am used to all the little charges and surcharges and handling fees as well as the overprised valet parkings etc. BUT Hyatt Regency Century City made it to the top of my list so far. I made a 19 minute phone call to europe from the room and ended up being charged 99.60 USD fot that call. WhatÂ´s even worse, before making the call, I asked the guest service what the approximate charges were going to be. I was told about 1 dollar a minute, ok, I expected 2 or 2.50. At check out I was billed over 5 dollars a minute as the stone face receptionist named Monterossa explained "well you know there are many surcharges and handling fees, nothing to do about that now". 99.60 USD per 19mins on phone is tough. Not mentioning 36 USD per parking, 20 USD for the use of the gym in adjascent Equinox (no fitness at the hotel), or 10 USD a day for basic wireless internet in the room. As a gold senator status member I will pass a complaint to the management, but expect no reply. The hotel itself is fine but stayaway if you do not fancy to pay outrageous amounts for basic services.

Reviews.Title: “as always parking fee is a scam ...”
Reviews.Author: nick341
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, but really ticked off by the parking fee. decided to self park so parked behind the hotel in garage that clearly said HOTEL PARKING, get this .. NO in & out ..! $24.00 each time, whether you parked for 30 mins of 3 hrs ... hotel guests also charged extra to use the gym ... total scam and at their room rates .. would i stay again ? no thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but isolated”
Reviews.Author: G10b3tr0tt3r
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with saying the staff was kind and helpful. The concierge gave us some great advice on what to see, printed up directions and made reservations at restaurants for us. I had an issue with a long distance charge on my bill when I was checking out but after I explained to the lady at the front desk that it was a call to my credit card company (with proof of course) she removed the charge. It was much appreciated. The rooms are spacious with extremely comfortable beds and pillows. Provided in the rooms are a hairdryer, toothpaste, soap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner, in room safe, minibar and an alarm clock with ipod dock. There are no robes, which for me was a bit disappointing (but not enough to dislike the hotel). All the rooms have a balcony- that was such a treat because I cannot remember the last time I had a balcony, plus it gives you a chance to find out what the weather is like! I never had a problem with noise. I am not sure if it was because we didn't have anyone in the rooms beside us or because the hotel has thick walls. I guess my only complaint with the rooms was with the one phone we had. It was cordless, but the batteries were completely dead, so we couldn't use it. (again, not enough to dislike the hotel, but if you are going to have a cordless phone, make sure it works- and we did make a note informing housekeeping). My friend and I went to the hotel bar (X bar) one night to get a drink. There were probably 4 or 5 other people there while we were. I guess my experience isn't enough to give a solid review on it. But I will say that I was disappointed that it was closed the Sunday we were there. I never went to the pool during my stay, but my room did overlook the pool area so I got to see that it was cleaned daily. There were always people there and they seemed to be enjoying themselves. I was not really a fan of the location of the hotel but it may not be that bad depending on why you are visiting LA. I went to enjoy the nightlife and see some sights. If you are planning on having a great nightlife I wouldn't suggest staying at the Hyatt only because you are so far out from the action. West Hollywood is about a $25 cab ride from the hotel (so $50 return, not including tip).- it's not cheap. However, you are not completely isolated from the goods of LA. Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive are really close by (you can walk it). Westfield mall is literally a 2 minute walk and it has some great high-end and affordable shops, restaurants, movie theater and grocery store. Also, across the street from the Hyatt is Craft, a fantastic restaurant that I suggest you visit! Regardless of where you stay in LA, getting a rental car is a smart decision because it is hard to get around otherwise. The Hyatt has a Hertz car rental right off of the lobby. One final thing, I was not impressed with the fact that they do not offer free Wi-fi and that you have to pay $5/10min to use the internet in the business area. Give me a break!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in convenient, quiet area of LA”
Reviews.Author: StacyTX
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is really close to Sunset Blvd and Beverly Hills, and you're really not too much further out from most of Hollywood - downtown is a bit further out. We arrived to a very clean room and friendly staff. Valet parking in May was $35/night, or you could self-park around the corner from the hotel for a bit less. We were also within walking distance of a Westfield mall that had good restaurant and shopping choices. We didn't use the business center or any of the other hotel amenities but the pool and outdoor lounge areas also looked very nice. We also used company hotel vouchers so I can't comment much to the value of the price paid per night, but for LA I'd assume the rack rates are still pretty proportionate to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel - Better for business than lesuire”
Reviews.Author: nick1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hyatt for a week at the end of April / beginning of may. The rooms were nice and very spacious. It was really nice having a balcony and being able to sit out in the morning (Poolside rooms get sun in the aftenoon road side get sun in the morning). All the staff we came into contact with were very polite and helpful. There was a big conference on whilst we were there but it didnt affect us in any way. The shopping centre is only a 2 minute walk, lots of restaurants and shops and it is really nice having somewhere you can walk to (especially in LA). Only downside is the pool gets shaded in the afternoon (from about 3 onwards so sitting out in the sun is a monring only option. Valet parking was not cheap ($35 per day) but always efficient and not bad for beverly hills!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Micheman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt 1 night in May 2011. Service is good, no problems at checkin. Rooms are clean and well-equipped, TV, minibar, balcony,... Great valet-service. (not free) Location is good if you need to visit LA. About 20 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenny433
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 4 nights at the Hyatt Regency. It was a solid 4-star hotel in a great location (SUPER close to Beverly Hills). We spent most of our trip in north LA, Hollywood, West Hollywood, etc. It was nice traveling through Beverly Hills to get to and fro our hotel. There is a cute outdoor shopping mall (with an H&M!) within walking distance of the hotel. We called down for our car from our room and valet was very prompt and courteous. The rooms were nice and typical of a 4-star hotel. It was nice having a balcony (I think this is the norm in LA). There is a Starbucks in the lobby and we didn't have a chance to try out the restaurant. We were bummed that WiFi in the room was an additional $10ish per day because we couldn't find this information on the website (the $35 parking/day is easily found there) and thought it may have been complimentary. Additionally, I booked our stay on Hotwire - HIGHLY recommend in order to make the place a little more affordable for a lengthier stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: GreatTraveltime
Reviews.Content: The exterior of the hotel could use a facelift but the interior was undergoing some remodeling. It was also a nice surprise to see a Westfield shopping center within walking distance. Unfortunately, we had to wait over 30 minutes for the valet to get our car after checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to Beverly hills and great shops”
Reviews.Author: AliD78
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and allowed early check in at 10am which I was very grateful after long haul flight Rooms comfortable and clean. 15 min walk to Beverly hills and bus stop outside hotel for Santa Monica line. Westfield shopping centre next door with great shops Would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “My fav hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: rfouts
Reviews.Content: If I have business in the greater West LA area I always try and stay here. It's convenient of course, but it's so comfortable; has a spectacular pool, is next door to Equinox and has a great lobby bar. You can't really walk to anything (Century City shopping is nearby of course) but that's LA in general. And the price is right. Wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a $200 room”
Reviews.Author: atois
Reviews.Content: This is my seventh stay at this hyatt, which has recently gone through a fairly extensive renovation. Having said that, if looking for a true five star hotel, you will be sorely dissappointed. PROS almost always available, even when booking day of, and at a very reasonable price. Every room has a balcony which is particularly beneficial for smokers. Great video oh demand, which is a staple at most hyatts, but if you plan to use, expect to pay approx $16 per movie. Room service provides a fairly comprehensive selection of dishes that most people can find something that they enjoy. (the fries are phenomenal) There is a Starbucks in the lobby that provides convenient access to a standardized and renowned coffee maker with minimal hassle. (can be charged to room) The Hyatt Cenbtrury Plaza also offers an amazing convention center for throwing events and charity functions. CONS Expect to pay an additional $20 a day in valet fees if you have a car, not to mention a ten minute wait to receive your car, longer if there's an event Rooms are below average size compared to most hyatt regency's in the US. The AC is extremely outdated, which isn't a problem unless your in the heat of summer. the hyatt has many events, which will probably disappoint the family who comes here for a quite vacation. The bathroom is probably the biggest weakness of the whole hotel, being extremely small with a toilet that only a little boy would be comfortable on. The bar in the lobby always closes early, with bartenders that are more focussed on the women than the customer service OVERALL again this is a great hotel for either a hyatt patron, or someone who has come for an event at the haytt, but it could be equated to an older woman who has just gotten a face lift to attract its prey, many things are outdated, or poorly thought out in room layout

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: richc78
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Was given this hotel on an Expedia Top Secret Hotel and very pleased with what we got! On first view felt it was a bit quiet round this hotel, especially as we stayed at the weekend. However, brilliant location to explore LA! U have a shopping centre next to hotel and great access to Beverly Hills and West Hollywood and only about 30 mins drive to Universal too! Rodeo Drive is only about a mile away so we broke LA traditions and walked to save some money on parking! Valet parking at hotel is expensive at $35 a day but that seems pretty much the average! Would definitely stay here again, very impressed, service was first class too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: dailema
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after reading some of the previous reviews, as I am a woman and was traveling solo this time. The Hyatt was great! I felt very safe in the hotel and the surrounding area, which is basically a business center with high rise office buildings. There is a beautiful shopping center with a movie theater, an upscale food market and nice restaurants all a very short walk away. The room was spotless and comfortable, and the breakfast buffet in the restaurant had lots of fresh fruit, omelets, etc. Valet parking was $35, but there is a self-park lot adjacent to the hotel that charges $24. Free Internet in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is #1”
Reviews.Author: Maikolo
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at what this hotel had to offer. It's the small things that stand out to me and this hotel sets the bar for customer satisfaction. Friendliest staff I have ever encountered. They really care about the your needs and do so with class. The valet guys are professional and are NOT creepy tip sharks (if you know what I mean). As you walk in, the lobby is very spacious and nicely decorated with a modern elegance. You will find a Starbucks conveniently located to your right as you walk into the lobby as well. Rooms are very clean and recently updated (very nice) with very cool looking city views. I usually have at least one improvement that I would recommend, but I really can't think of a reason why I would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Playboy Golf Diminishes the Brand”
Reviews.Author: mr_sunol
Reviews.Content: I echo those who wrote with concern about the Playboy Golf group that the hotel accepted on the weekend of March 19-20, and the fact that management has not commented on those negative reviews is proof positive that it doesn't concern them. The front desk staff told me that this group has been booked for years and has gotten louder and crazier every year. For me, it forever diminishes the Hyatt brand because, unlike Ritz-Carlton or Intercontinental, if I pick a Hyatt I will have to ask what groups they have booked for fear of ruining my stay. I was also awakened at 6 AM by someone in an adjoining room turning on their bathroom fan; the vibration propagated into my room and sounded like a siren or loud buzzing. Do not use the valet parking, which is painfully slow; instead park behind the property in a garage shared by office buildings and mall. There is a walkway into the property.

Reviews.Title: “Awful! It looked like a hooker convention - trashy trashy trashy!”
Reviews.Author: 2011Dreamer
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible experience at this hotel. I, too, was there during the "playboy golf convention." They put signs just under each entrance door, so you were walking INTO the Playboy center - not into they Hyatt Regency Centruy Plaza. I spent a lot of money to stay at the HYATT, not at Playboy. There were what appeared to be a hundred scantily clad young girls in the lobby, the elevators, and the hallways. We couldn't go anywhere without seeing young girls in their underwear - literally. I agree with the reviewer who said that families looked horrified - I saw the same thing and I was embarassed for the parents who had to explain what was going on to their children. There were drunk middle-aged beer-bellied men comparing their assigned women (they must have been assigned one for each man). We ate at the hotel restaurant each morning and had to eat next to a daily discussion of whether the men had ... well you know ... with the women at the parties the night before. It was DISGUSTING. The hotel allowed the parties to go on each night in the lobby, out front, and at the pool area in the back. There was no quiet area anywhere. We got NO sleep during this time. The men and women were drunk and loud. The parties began around 7 pm and lasted until about 2 am. Some people got into busses to go to other locations - when they did so, they were yelling and cat-calling in the early hours of the morning. We will NEVER stay at this hotel again and it will be a long time before I stay at another Hyatt. I believe any other convention/conference would have met in the hotel's meeting areas and I believe any other convention/conference would not have been allowed to have a pajama/underwear party in the lobby at 8 pm. Our experience - and it sounds as others experienced this too - is that the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza hotel put the money of the Playboy force above the money of the average guest. There was NO consideration for other guests at the hotel. We were incidental to everything else going on there. It was so crowded that it was difficult to even walk through the lobby to the front of the hotel. We were embarassed to be staying at this hotel; our experience DID NOT meet the level of quality we expected. In other notes, the hotel is very far away from all major activities and you have to take a taxi anywhere you want to go if you don't have a car. The room was very loud. On the positive side, our interaction with the front-line hotel staff was very good. The conceirge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money, price of parking isn't worth the service”
Reviews.Author: mannypetruzzelli
Reviews.Content: My sister, father, and I stayed here from March 14 2011 - March 18 2011 because we found a "good deal" on Priceline and we had to go pick up her wedding dress in Hollywood. The price for parking at this hotel is $35.00 a day and it is not convenient at all, the valet service was never on time and the cost of parking cost more than breakfast everyday. The only other option was to spend $25.00 and choose not to do the valet and park in a different lot, extremely inconvenient. We were also in the hotel during the Playboy Golf experience, other than lots of skanky girls in the lobby, they werent harming anyone other than making way too much noise. The fridge in the rooms isnt even a fridge its just a ploy to get you to drink their microsized $5.00 bottles of water, you are designated one tiny spot in the fridge for something of your own but the only thing you can fit in it is a can of pop. I would not stay at this hotel again if the parking was free. P.S. Internet is like $12/day Stick with the Hampton inn = Free high speed internet

Reviews.Title: “didn't expect Skanksville”
Reviews.Author: tryvegcom
Reviews.Content: I would normally give this hotel 5 stars. We've stayed at the Hyatt many times booking through Priceline and booking through the hotel. It's always been clean, comfortable and upscale. We recently stayed there for the Genesis Awards and were shocked to see the whole hotel taken over by a "Playboy Golf" conference. Ah, that's scuh a polite title. It was a giant frat party with creepy druken men and drunken skanky women. They were loud, drunk, took over the whole hotel and pool area and kept us awake into the wee hours. I overheard a guest comment that 'these girls are working their way UP to street corner hooker.' If the Hyatt would put all their other paying guests at the mercy of such nastiness, I don't know if I'll stay there again. During our LA visit, we also stayed at the Intercontinental down the street. Very nice. We paid in full for the Hyatt but booked through Priceline for the Intercontinental and needless to say, had a much better stay at the latter.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: sajjidd
Reviews.Content: a/c was very loud and could not be repaired in a suite that I was paying $500 per night for...wow! and they did not even give me a discount on the room rate. the room service pizza was cold when it arrived and quality was horrible. $35.00 per night for parking wow is this new york? they wanted $20 for the gym and $22 per day for internet. ripoff hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best Beverly Hills hotel I've stayed in so far”
Reviews.Author: marathongirl505
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, in Century City, half a block from an awesome open-air mall, and extremely close to Beverly Hills. Santa Monica is just 5 miles away when you shoot directly down on Santa Monica Blvd. The hotel is perfectly clean, the hallways are elegantly decorated, and so are the rooms (black granite counter tops and gorgeous leather work chairs. LOVED IT !!! Nice breakfast buffet, not very varied, but not such a big deal. My room with a view was on the Avenue of the Stars side, which has a bit of traffic at night, but I noticed the slight background noise just because I'm used to extremely quiet places at night.

Reviews.Title: “It sucks big time......”
Reviews.Author: josephzhou1
Reviews.Content: Bad service, old hotel room, 3-star hotel with 5-star price... Unfriendly front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service From Sales Manager/Assistant”
Reviews.Author: rxk71
Reviews.Content: Writing in regards: Group Sales Manager Emily White and Assistant Janet Adams at Hyatt Regency Century Plaza Los Angeles Hotel. Both were very professional, helpful and patient with our requests/needs. They were very conversant, polite, and prompt with assisting our group. Ms. Emily White and Ms. Janet Adams hold the finest traits of being great manager/assistant team and are beyond doubt an asset to Hyatt Century Plaza Los Angeles Hotel and the hospitality industry. Simply the best.

Reviews.Title: “Just another business hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJ-EM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for leisure for two nights. The hotel is a real business hotel and lacks any charm. It wasn't a great base for tourists like us to explore LA. Don't get me wrong there is nothing wrong with this hotel, but there must be better hotels to stay if you are visiting LA for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well maintained”
Reviews.Author: ryanfrommd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in early February 2011. Hotel was clean and well maintained. I was able to check in using the automated kiosk, which was a welcome convenience after a long trip. Room was modern and spacious, matching the pictures on their website. Front desk staff was polite and professional. Concierge was helpful with recommendations. There is a nice bar in the lobby, with a pleasant atmosphere to hang out after a day of meetings. I also tried sushi for lunch at the hotel restaurant, and it was decent quality (if a little bit expensive). I wanted to work out, but the fitness center is part of the spa and they charge separately for it ($20 a day). This was my only real disappointment with this location. Don't get me wrong- it's a nice facility, but I would have preferred something a little less fancy that didn't cost extra. This location is very close to a westfield mall, with a supermarket and a good selection of dining options. I really enjoyed being able to get decent meals without needing a taxi. Speaking of taxis, my taxi ride from LAX was about $50, and I heard from others that their experience was similar. I flew out of burbank, and it was about $65, but much more pleasant. I recommend flying into Burbank if that is an option for you and you are staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased and would return”
Reviews.Author: FLLtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit. Very well maintained property with extremely spacious and quiet rooms. I was on the 18th floor facing west and had a great view and a spacious balcony. Room was very clean and well maintained. Service was quite good and valet was prompt but pricey at $35/day. Charge to use Equinox gym is $20/day but includes all classes, so not too bad if you take advantage of this. Very nice pool and hot tub area and felt like an urban resort. Located right next to Century City mall, with nice stores, restaurants and a grocery store. You need a car to get around but overall it can be a great choice in LA. FYI...take Olympic instead of Santa Monica Blvd. to avoid traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hollins1984
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I made plans to travel to LA on very short notice. She took care of the hotel booking and managed to get a really good deal on the Hyatt through Priceline. I felt like a star at the hotel - it was welcoming, the staff were friendly, and it looked like a fancy hotel from a movie. While we were there they had some BBC America event that we later discovered some celebrities attended (we didn't see any though). The rooms were great, I've included some pictures. Had a nice view of Century Blvd. Our first day there was a protest that blocked the street, which was kind of loud but it was only that afternoon that they were noisy. I don't know if it's a popular intersection for protests but as I said it only bothered me a little that one afternoon. The hotel is convenient to Westfield Century City Mall, which has many restaurants, stores, also an iMAX theater and grocery store. It's only a 5-minute walk or so from the hotel so if you don't have a car or don't want to pay for a taxi, you have easy access to shopping. Also, one day we went to Rodeo Drive and ended up walking back. It was maybe a 10-20 minute walk, so a little farther, but if you don't mind the exercise it's very close to the famous (and expensive) area in Beverly Hills. We didn't eat in the restaurant downstairs, but we did try out room service one evening and had a very delicious white pizza. Overall, the experience was amazing and I highly recommend it, if you're willing to pay a little extra for a nice hotel. Hopefully you can find some good deals on the internet to help lower the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive. Rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: avidgolfer2010
Reviews.Content: Was there hoping to have a relaxing MLK vacation. Check-in takes forever. I'm a Hyatt Diamond member and my friend is Hyatt Platinum. They have a special line for that, but they were so busy they put everyone through the status line; so much for my loyalty to the Hyatt brand. The valet couldn't find my car and was unapologetic about making me wait for 1.5 hours to finally find it, even though they had my ticket and my last name. Not to mention parking is $45. Breakfast took 1 hour (it was not crowded) from the time we ordered eggs to the time it arrived at our table. Not to mention the breakfast is $29. Finally, I lost my key and it took 30 minutes for them to believe me that I was actually staying at the hotel even though my name was on the reservation and I had my driver's license with me. So absurd.

Reviews.Title: “Great As Always”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: This hotel has something about it that everytime I go there I feel at home. Rooms are great, staff even better..... Even though LA isn't my favorite destination, I always look forward to staying at this property. Parking is expensive but then again this is LA so what else would you expect..... DEFINITELY WORTH IT!

Reviews.Title: “The problem is, it's just good”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior2010_10
Reviews.Content: It's not great and for $300+ per night for a regular room, you can and should expect more. At the end of it I probably spend $500 per night after all the add on's like parking, any food you eat, taxes etc. The people are pretty nice, Ryan at check in is great. The location is good, easy walk to work. Century City has some good food at the mall and BH is right down the road. For the same price, I stay at the Beverly Hilton, unless there are no rooms available. Like the title said, it's not bad, just not a very good value for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for cost”
Reviews.Author: Snowtravelers
Reviews.Content: This was the host hotel for a week-long conference. I found the entire facility very disappointing considering the cost. There was a balcony in the room, allowing me access to outside air during my stay. The swimming pool area also seemed nice, although it was too cold to use it. Cost for the fitness center was $20.00 a day, and there was also a charge for the in-room internet. The restaurants were high-end, but did offer reasonably priced cocktail snacks. There was a shopping area with a food court nearby where the bulk of us attending the conference took our meals.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: 2angel
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights and I was almost 1000 for thoes three nights. Not worth it I thought because of the bed bug scare I should go expensive not true. This hotel is beautiful and you have to pay for everything you do. The car cost 35 aday to park more than it cost to rent the car in the frist place. Then you have to ask for coffee in the room and they dont refill it unless you ask and the freg is full of stuff and you can not put anything in there . The stuff in there is like soda and redbull that cost 5 and 7 dollars and they have chips and candy that cost 5 and 7 dollars this hotel is not what I expected . Since I have allergies I was hoping I would not have to see dogs not true they had dogs in this hotel too. No wonder the floor smelt like p. I want stay again . To expensie for what you get noting the internet is 25 for three days or 10 a day. Just not worth the money I could have stayed at the Westin Boniventer downtown LA again for that price and recived so much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Westside location, great pool.”
Reviews.Author: Augie39
Reviews.Content: A great city location for a retreat, convenient to the Century City Mall and a relaxing pool area. The staff was welcoming and helpful. We were there to relax and shop and this was a perfect location for both. The hotel looked to be a popular conference location with many international travelers. We had to laugh when a movie we were watching had been filmed around the hotel exterior. The only complaints were the uncomfortable bed and the parking fee. Great sunset toward the ocean both nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rockemsockemrobot
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty good. The location was ok, but to get anywhere but the mall, a person needs to drive. It is close to Beverly Hills, but not close enough to walk. The room was a roomy king that was renovated in a 3 star way for a 4 star hotel. The problems are minor, however, they are noticable. First, the bathroom sink had either very hot water or very cold water. There was no warm water. I pointed this out when I checked out and the front desk clerk said she would check into it and removed the charge for my water in the room. The bathroom only had 2 lights in it and it was dark when you closed the shower curtain. These are minor issues, but I notice these things. I have no complaints regarding the staff. It is evident the owner is trying to save money, but it seems to be at the cost of maintaining an overall 4 star hotel. The hotel should pay more attention to the details.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel With Fantastic Service, Luxury at a Bargain Price”
Reviews.Author: Ant_and_Kresta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 4 nights in Spring. The first thing we noticed was that the service was absoloutely fantastic. We do not usually care about service, as we keep ourselves to ourselves when travelling and rarely ask for anything. However, their pursuit of excellent service really stood out at this hotel and kind of spoilt us for the rest of our trip. The rooms were large and comfortable, modern and luxurious, i believe 5 star standard, with a nice big balcony overlooking a sort of business district of Beverley Hills. There is also a Westfield Shopping centre a 2 minute walk away so you can buy groceries, go shopping or get something to eat. Hollywood and Downtown LA were both a good twenty minute drive away, we did not mind this as we quite like driving whilst overseas, but you DEFINITELY need a car to stay here, and for that matter, LA in general. The bed was a a big comfy king size, with quite comfortable bedding. The Valet parking became quite expensive, it wa $20 a day plus tips every time they brought the car up to you, or you dropped it off, so may have cost up to $40 per day on some days. All in we thoroughly enjoyed this hotel, expecially for the price, which worked out at less than $160 aussie per night for us. We also did day trips from here to Universal Studios, which took around 15 mins and Disneyland, which took no more than an hour on a weekday. Granted, there are many better hotels in LA, many of them closer to Hoolywood or in a better location, but none of them for anywhere near this price. Stay here, you won't be diasappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Perfect Stay.”
Reviews.Author: AndWeWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on way to Vegas from Australia. Lobby is beautiful. Check in flawless. Customer Service flawless. Bed was fantastic; Plush and comfortable. Very convenient location between LAX and LA city, Beverly Hills only minutes away. Westfield Century Plaza right across the road, Movies, shopping and food... We will definately return again. HOT TIP: After you have booked online, take advantage of the Hyatt room e-upgrade system! You will NOT be dissapointed! THIS IS A GRAND BEAUTIFUL HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: EfficientTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the Hyatt for a conference. Check in was smooth and easy. My room was clean and comfortable. No coffee maker in room (but Starbucks on ground floor!). Elevators were fast and not crowded. As a Platinum member, my internet was free and I got coffee coupons, which was a bonus. The hotel is right around the corner from a large mall with a good food court, but not much else around that I could tell. The X bar has some good Stella Artois beer! It was a little pricey for me, but it is a Hyatt near Beverly Hills! The large convention area was nice, but we had some items stolen from our workshop room on the last day.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the protestors”
Reviews.Author: Coast2Coast71
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this fine hotel. Just now I heard a disturbance. 100's of protestors are on the sidewalk in front of the hotel.Blowing whistles, holding signs for cars to HONK, noise makers. Apparently it is some union issue with Hyatt. Bring your ear plugs! $35 daily parking is a rip, as noted before many times

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK facilties, internet a complete rip off”
Reviews.Author: ihatelaserbeams
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at pretty nice boutique hotels but because of a conference decided to stay at this business traveler's hotel (where the conference was). Upgraded the business king to a penthouse suite for a reasonable price. Thought the hotel was OK. Conference facilities were nice. I would give this hotel a favorable review except for 1 thing that in my opinion makes it a no-go: They charge PER device to connect to the internet! So I had a laptop, an iPad and an iPhone. My wife had her Mac. They charged us $9.95 per day per device! That's $39.80 per day plus CA tax to use the internet! I thought that was so egregious and ridiculous that I had to warn other travelers about it. My work is even picking up the tab as an expense, so it's not coming out of my pocket, but I just thought that was so ridiculous and such a scam to bleed their customers ... they know a lot of business travelers don't pay any hotel expense so they're just ripping people off. To make it worse, they won't negotiate. I'm a pretty friendly guy, so I talked to the front desk very politely at check out but they wouldn't budge. So I told them it was so ridiculous that I was going to write my 1st hotel review about it! So here it is. Avoid this hotel unless you won't to pay per device to connect to the internet. Crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Resonable, Accommodating...”
Reviews.Author: Highcountry107
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I headed out to L.A. for a little get-a-way from FL. to enjoy the west coast. We took the Super Shuttle from LAX to the Hotel ($14/person) and it was by far the cheapest mode of transportation, plus the hotel was the shuttle's 2nd stop. Upon unloading from the shuttle, the gentlemen out front took our bags and welcomed us to the Hyatt and directed us to the check-in desk or the option of the Hotel Lobby bar to relax for a minute. Either way, we got the Beer ($7/draft of Fat Tire) and went to check in. The gentlemen checking us in, Tyrone, was beyond friendly and accommodating. He was very detailed and told us about all the right places to go for drinks and entertainment. After all, that is why we were there.... We spent hours in the hotel premier bar - X-Bar. It was definitely a very nice time, but be prepared to pay some L.A. prices on drinks anywhere you go. Figure $7 for beers and $10-$15 from cocktails, but hey you're in L.A. so get use to it. The Breakfast buffet was nice, but highly priced at $25+/person. They Regency Club (if platinum member) was a little escape to go to and pour yourself some cocktails (Kettle One, wines, and Brandy available). The rooms were very nice. We had a West Facing 14th floor balcony that set off the L.A. Skyline (which was perfectly clear and rare) all the way to the ocean. As mentioned, all the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and made you feel like you were of utmost importance. After all, they have no idea of your background and what you do and a lot of wealthy folks move in and out of the Hotel. It is located in the Century City Business District, so there are not bars on the corners, just in the hotel and across the street in the Westfield Mall. A cab ride down to Hollywood and Vine or Sunset to where all the action was, was right around $35 for a 15min ride on a Friday night. I would highly recommend this place. The pools and hot tub were also a nice addition, very clean and good people hanging out and enjoying the day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 007world
Reviews.Content: We tried one of the new Pure hypo-alergenic rooms... It was such a refreshing difference. The hotel itself is in excellent condition, the "backyard" is a nice open air refreshing change in an urban environment, and we were only less than a 5 minute $10 cab ride from all the shopping of Beverly Hills (and saved $250+ on the rate compared to Beverly Hills hotels). The rooms at the Century Plaza are in excellent shape, my girlfriend loved the big bathroom with great lighting. The staff was best in class. Honestly, I can think of a complaint for my stay. We also stayed here on a weekend when a birthday party was in Hollywood and the cab ride was around $20 each way with tip. So we also saved money versus the hotel rooms in Hollywood on the weekend and really enjoyed the peace and quiet when we got back to the hotel compared to the all night noise and lights of Hollywood. On a side note, they have free internet in the lobby and on the first few floors of the hotel guestrooms you can also get the lobby wireless free. I would definately recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing- Did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: infomofo
Reviews.Content: When my work sent me out to LA, I was initially excited to find they had put me up in this hotel, as it had a very good rating on this site. When I arrived, I was pretty impressed, the building is lovely and the rooms themselves are well decorated and are fairly spacious. My room had access to a Lanai deck that was lovely, although I didn't use it. The location was great for me as I was working in Century City and could literally just cross the street to get to work. If you're not working in that area, I can't imagine why you would stay in this hotel, as there's really nothing else in the area. As for the hotel, it was the little details that ended up disappointing me. My work required me to clear my expenses ahead of time, and extras like Internet or gym would have to be approved separately and were a headache. I found when I got there that the room fee included nothing. Gym access and internet had to be purchased daily and were quite expensive. There is a pool, but I found that it is actually not usable for swimming, as it is quite shallow, and is just there for sunbathing I guess? How LA. I also found the bathroom to be underwhelming as well. For such a nice room, I was surprised that this room did not have a bathtub. Even worse, the shower would actually flood, so I could only run the water for very short periods of time. Maybe this is their way of motivating guests to go green? In either case, it wasn't very luxurious. My only interaction with the service was when I called down to get a new bottle of shampoo - they took about half an hour, which was frustrating, but when they came they provided a full toiletry kit, with razors and deodorant. So that was nice I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Over hyped and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CAndrewSemon
Reviews.Content: So being resident of Los Angeles, you hear about local places that are special and this hotel was one of them. The President stays here, foreign heads of state stay here, it's the pinnacle of hotels in LA, etc. so when I was asked to stay here for a convention last weekend, I jumped at the chance. Mistake #1. Upon check-in I found that my "king room" was actually a "two double bed" room. I asked for a king room and they said that they were sold out. Fine. Fair enough. Chances are, the oversold the king rooms and I was a casualty of their mistake. The main issues had to do with the bathroom. There was a tiny shower, with a bad shower head, with terrible water pressure. The towels were the size of a postage stamp and felt like sand paper. The toilet paper was even a horribly cheap 1-ply stuff that John Wayne wouldn't have used. Good grief people, this is a luxury hotel, some luxury amenities would be delightful. Especially with the luxury price being paid. Room service was more than abnormally overpriced as was the mini-bar. $27 for a tiny bottle of Kendall Jackson wine. Really?!? Parking was $35 per night and wireless internet was exorbitant as well. Service was so-so. Not up to the brand standard and certainly not up to the standard of a luxury hotel. If we are putting foreign heads of state and the president himself here, we should be ashamed of the image that we are presenting.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel and convenient location to Century City”
Reviews.Author: mike-lcf
Reviews.Content: This is an above average Hyatt Regency. I was generally pleased with my stay. Rooms and common areas are relatively newly renovated. Valet and doorman were friendly, as is the check out staff. They have the Hyatt self-check in kiosks here, so checking in was very quick - there was no line for the machines and unlike the United Airline check in kiosks that make you decline multiple offers to purchase miles or upgrades, the Hyatt kiosk only took a few screens to check me in. Bathrooms were decently sized and recently renovated. Bed was comfortable. Rooms were clean. The outside of the hotel looks a bit dirty but the interior was fine. If you need to be in Century City this is the most conveniently located hotel to the office buildings and next door to the Century City mall. This place wasn't perfect though. Some drawbacks that were annoying: No self parking on site, you either have to go to an unaffiliated lot behind the hotel or pay $35 per day for valet parking, which is a bit steep. (However, every time I called down to have my car brought out, it was there waiting for me within 10 minutes when I got to the front entrance). In room wi fi internet access is noticeably slow. If you are running basic citrix, you will see a noticeable delay. No bath robes or slippers provided in the room. The hallways were not cleaned regularly, as I would see multiple old room service tables sitting outside rooms for hours on my hallway without being taken away. They also have the mini bar and refrigerator with the automatic sensors so if you even open the refrigerator to take a look, you get charged. I hate that - it gives off such a nickel and dime feel to an otherwise nice hotel. Finally, avoid the room service pizza. It was soggy, gross and luke warm when it arrived. On the other hand, the chicken soup with matzo ball was quite good (although also luke warm when it arrived).

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Beverly hills”
Reviews.Author: gauravsharda
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency looked like an old hotel which had got a facelift., but still required more to be done, the location was fantastic, and with Starbucks in the hotel,we were more than happy. But the rooms and the entire hotels definitely needs a major makeover...

Reviews.Title: “Third time this year so they are doing something right”
Reviews.Author: withkidstravel
Reviews.Content: I spent a night there last week, and it was the best night yet -oddly, because I had a problem and they worked incredibly hard to solve it. My room phone had some sort of problem and kept ringing at odd intervals with a non-normal ring. I had jet lag and was too settled in and tired to want to move. They sent engineering up and he worked on it but could not fix it. I finally just said that I woud unplug the phone and they could call my cell if there was a problem. They could not have been more solicitous and nice about it. When I woke up the next morning there was a reduction in my rate and a free breakfast card waiting for me. The room was clean and comfortable, interesting view, good location. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A good Hyatt for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: myvoiceofreason
Reviews.Content: I spent three days at the Hyatt Century Plaza. While not the best Hyatt Regency out there this one definitely ranks up there. The rooms, halls, common areas have all been upgraded in the past year to give the interior a very nice look. The odd numbered rooms look out on Avenue of the Stars and the CAA building and higher floors have a good view of BH and Hollywood Hills. The even numbered rooms look out over the pool and higher floors would have a good view of LA. All have a lanai. First, as noted by others, that this location can be a bit more expensive. There is only valet parking here. $35 unlimited in and out. I called down about 10-15 mins before I needed my car and each time it was there and ready to go. If you need limited access to your car there is another lot not affiliated with the Hyatt at a cost of $24 a day. Next, there is no gym opportunity here other than the Equinox Club just off the pool for $20 a day. This is a decent club and if you want to mix with the agents who represent some some of Hollywood's top stars you'll find them in here. I used the gym one day. It fits the bill. Great locker rooms. There is a nice pool and hottub here. Would be a fine place to lounge the weekend away complete with bar service. However, based on the room rates here you could stay at a boutique hotel in Hollywood for less and likely have a better relaxing weekend. My room was a standard queen room on the 6th floor. It was fine. Comfortable bed, tons of pillows, nice linens, small sitting area and a desk. Theres a good size flat-screen in the room and two phones (one cordless). The bathrooms are big and a high standard though it's clear they were refurbished, not gutted in the renovation. Still, very nice although a bit dark. The rooms are kept clean and the room attendants do a nice job. One noticed my toothpaste was about out and she left me two new travel size tubes. Perfect attention to detail. There were some people picketing outside the hotel one night I was there for about 30 mins. They had a bullhorn but they stopped promptly at 7pm and it was nothing more than a mere annoyance. In general, I give this place the thumbs up. If you are in BH on business it's a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: CirceLovely
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for VidCon 2010, and the rooms were lovely. We had comfortable beds, a balcony overlooking the awesome outdoor and pool area and an amazing bathroom. My friend's room, at the front of the hotel, had just the best view at night over LA. Also, the location's really good. Just around the corner is the Westfield Mall, where you can get good (if not a little exorbitantly priced) food, and decent shops like Sephora, Bloomingdales, Tiffany & Co, Louis Vuitton andJuicy Couture. They even have Vitamin Water vending machines. They run a shuttle service to LAX which is $14 (way cheaper than getting a taxi), and they have computers so you can print your boarding pass in the lobby, which was very useful. The convention place is really good, too. And we got the rooms for $149 a night, as part of the convention. Really, if you can afford it, you should stay there. I'd be happy if VidCon is held there again next year. The only downside is the stupid price for WiFi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms not the most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bo1790
Reviews.Content: Postives: Room & bathroom quite large & nice. Very comfortable bed. All rooms have balconies. Quiet. Negatives: it's not in a convenient location. Parking is expensive and DO NOT have the breakfast buffet. Almost $30 a person for baked goods, cereals, runny eggs, bacon and sausage. Total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “What a mess”
Reviews.Author: Bo94114
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at the Park Hyatt all the time but that became an Intercontinental ages ago and we wanted to be in Century City again so we thought we would try this one. Check in great. King bed room facing downtown LA. Room was good. Bathroom was very dark especially the shower/Tub. Good closet. I loved the balcony. Room and halls looked very un-Hyatt. Looks more like a Westin or W. The Regency Club was very nice. The bad was the hotel was hosting some Playboy function and all these ladies (and I do use the term loosely) and their drunken admires had taken over the penthouse, hotel, and much of the pool for our entire stay. They were hooting and hollering late at night. We were at the pool the next day when they decided to expand their turf and we refused to move as we were paying guests too. Our room was not made up until after 7:00p that night. The restaurant was good. Check out was quick even at 4:30a. I think I will try the Intercontinental next time

Reviews.Title: “Close to what you need but pricey”
Reviews.Author: seasunsounds
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for business, and for the most part enjoyed my visit. I must agree withthe other guest who mentioned the loud, obnoxious protest out front. I almost hit a few of them in the driveway. I was not offered any compensation for the noise? I did move rooms beacause i could not hear in my room. The parking is wayyyyyyyyyy over priced 30+ no self parking option. Close to amll, UCLA, Gelsons and good restaurants. The valet and othe rstaff were great!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Union Protests & Riots that start at 5:15am in front of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: honurider
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and liked it, but Hyatt seems to be having labor disputes that involve union protestors in front of this hotel and the Hyatt on Sunset Blvd too. The protestors start at 5:15am, and use megaphones, whistles, clanking sounds like pots & pans, and loud shouting to wake up the guests. I guess it's legal as long as the protestors don't come on to the hotel property, but they are right in front of it and they protest for the entire day, sunup to sunset. It is impossible to sleep. I asked for a reimbursement of the money I paid to stay there but did not get it. I got a free buffet breakfast which was mediocre at best. As long as the labor dispute is on, DO NOT stay here if you want quiet rest. Oh, and parking your car is $35 a day!

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Anonymousmoron
Reviews.Content: Our booking for the Century Plaza was made through Priceline and i got the room at a ridiculously low price. I did not inform my wife that we were gonna be staying at the Hyatt @ Beverly Hills, and she couldnt stop giggling out of amazement when we reached there :))) I loved everything about the Hotel - The staff was courteous and very helpful, the breakfast was great, the rooms were great! Just felt a bit out of place with the location of the hotel. Have never been to 90210 and expected a lot of hustle-bustle, which wasnt to be, to my surprise. Its a huge hotel in the middle of a place thats a bit deserted, though we have a mall with lots of shops closeby, though well connected by the tour buses (they have a stop there). Bottom line - Highly recommended for a good stay, if you dont mind the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a treat!”
Reviews.Author: jazzy81
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Hyatt in Beverly Hills. We walked a few times to Rodeo Drive and it was just wonderful staying in this location. The hotel was really grand, the foyer was beautiful, the room was clean and very large. We had a beautiful view. We were on the second floor form the top, so it was nice sitting on the balcony - apart form when our neighbour got out to smoke pot. We would definitely stay here again. The staff were super friendly and helpful. We felt spoilt. There was a pool, but we didn't get to use it as it apparently leaked and they needed to fix it. It wasn't warm enough to swim really anyway, but it looked like a really lovely pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Happenning Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kellmcn
Reviews.Content: Other than parking being outrageous, this place is fantastic. Beautiful decor, comfy beds and lots going on b/w the X bar, lobby bar, and meeting space for big banquets/fundraisers. A lot of high profile people visit this hotel and great pool area. Only drawback is that there isn't much else around other than the mall. No clubs/bars within walking distance and the traffic on Santa Monica Blvd can be bad. Save a few bucks by doing shorterm parking for free at the mall then overnight self-park for $24 (compared to $35 plus tip valet).

Reviews.Title: “History and tradition”
Reviews.Author: duohrs
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed after a good 7 years hiatus with the renovation and improved services since the ownership has changed from Westin to Hyatt. The meeting and catering service were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller073
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. Our rooms were on the 12th floor and were clean, well furnished and very comfortable. The staff were all very helpful and efficient. Valet service was great (if pricey). Breakfast was delicious - lots of choice on the buffet. The only dowsides were that the pool was in the shade of the MGM building for much of the time and the noise of conferences. There was a party for one conference while we were here and even on the 12th floor with our door closed it was noisy but luckily they packed up at 10pm. Overall a great place to stay and explore LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but not a value”
Reviews.Author: cosmotron
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend, as it was the site for our conference. After reading the reviews about valet parking, we opted to self-park (very easy but expensive). Our room was on the 15th floor, dead center of the building, facing east and looking straight through the â€œwindowâ€� of the office building across the street. (That is, the buildingâ€™s design has a square â€œcut outâ€� and you could look beyond to the mountains, with downtown to the southeast.) The spacious balcony was a great place to relax; our room was comfortable â€“ the bed was incredibly comfortable; but the TV had very limited channels. Not even a decent cable TV package. The bathroom was nice but I couldnâ€™t believe the sloppy glass tile job along the walls â€“ wow, Hyatt paid for and allowed for this type of workmanship (or lack of)?! I am an early riser and had to wait with other guests for Starbuckâ€™s to open downstairs (employees arrived late too). If the hotel doesnâ€™t include coffeemakers as part of the room amenities, at the very least, they should have Starbuckâ€™s open earlier than 6:00am (guests from the East Coast or abroad would agree). We had breakfast at Breeze out of convenience. We ordered the continental breakfast buffet (good) and off the menu (just okay). In general, the hotel was fine, the staff were all very courteous and professional, but the lack of amenities â€“ not to mention paying to exercise at adjacent Equinox â€“ is not worth staying at this particular hotel, considering other options in this part of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hyatt standards.”
Reviews.Author: theatremamma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. As I often stay at Hyatts, I was pleased the conference chose the hotel. Unfortunately, I found the hotel to be in need of renovation, over priced (even at a discounted conference rate) and the level of service sometimes very good and sometimes rude and ineffective. Stay began with a ridiculous run around with keys that did not work and then the bad news, that now that my key worked, the other keys for the room would not. This was not an uncommon problem. The rooms are a good size but the bathrooms outdated, with a dated hair dryer in the closet. Wifi for an additional charge, really everything was for an additional charge. If you are use to running on a treadmill in the morning, be prepared to spend another $20.00 for acess to the spa. No coffee maker in the room, you have to call down and request one, and then request it again, and then again. No robes in rooms. Pool is nice with plenty of chaise lounges. Low point was when I attempted to join friends having coffee at the lobby bar. Sylvanna serving at the bar (which was nearly empty as it was the middle of the day) informed me that I would have to move along as the stools were for paying customers. One would think they would consider a hotel guest a paying customer but no so. Complaint to the desk manager yielded a promise that the food manager would call, which never happened. On the other hand, the catering staff was wonderful in conference rooms. Tech services were as outdated as tvs in the rooms. Hyatt should either invest in this property or take their name off of it and reduce the rates.

Reviews.Title: “No coffeepot in the room and other inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: Melissa5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza Los Angeles to attend a conference. Therefore we got a conference rate. We had to pay for everything ourselves, so we do care about value. The good news: The staff was friendly and helpful. The beds and pillows were comfortable. Upon check-out, the front desk was thoughtful and generous enough to give us a little discount, because we complained that the room smelled like some previous guest had a dog in the room recently. (Note: we couldn't change rooms because the hotel was full.) The bad news: Incredibly, there wasn't any coffee pot in our room! That was very inconvenient when attending a busy conference over several days. There is a Starbucks in the lobby but it always had a long line due to the conferences. If you order coffee from room service it was around $9 for the coffee plus added fees of about 25% !!! Our conference provided free coffee only in the early morning, but the conference room was far from our bedroom on the 12th floor...so how do you get free coffee in your room for breakfast? Answer: you DON'T! )-: I associate the name "hyatt" with luxury, but our room had no robe, no slippers, and no coffee maker! Tip: There is a Gelson's supermarket in the mall around the corner...we did get a few groceries to bring to our hotel room for a quickie breakfast. You can ask for an empty minifrig for your room for $5 a day. There is a charge for internet too, although it was discounted for the conference. If our conference is in the Hyatt again next year...yes I would still attend and stay at the Hyatt. I did appreciate the friendly service, and I appreciate the small discount upon check-out (because the room smelled like a previous customer had a dog in the room.) This was a nice gesture. Would I choose this Hyatt for a romantic splurge, though? No, if I was paying full price and looking for a romantic getaway, I'd stay elsewhere. I rated this room "3" for cleanliness because our room needed a deep carpet cleaning for example. On the other hand, the daily housekeeping were very good about keeping our bathroom clean, and giving us fresh towels etc. every day. In my opinion, this Hyatt is a bit TOO pet-friendly. Oh yes...we didn't hear any noise at all from the hallway, which was nice. But the wall seemed a bit thin between our room & the next one...so that we could hear their television, and we could hear them opening the drawers on the other side of the wall. Fortunately, our neighbors didn't stay up too much later than we did, but it was a bit annoying. Overall, I'd say this Hyatt is average for a large hotel which accommodates conferences. They would get a lot more points from me if they provided a coffee maker in the rooms, with free coffee, and also if they didn't charge to have a mini-frig in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2madmike
Reviews.Content: We had the Hyatt Regency for about three days. The room was absolute clean. The View room the balcony was amazing, seeing the pool, and the MGM Plaza. The beds could be a little bit more hard. The location of the Hotel is also perfect, right next to the Century City Shopping Center where u can have buy something to eat or drink. There are two Starbucks Coffee, one inside the Hyatt Regency and one on the other side of the street. The concierge was very cooperative and friendly. Public Wifi was also available at the Lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: floridagirl407
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. We loved the location because it was close to Rodeo Dr.,( by car- 5 min ) and restaurants .It also had a great pool and a beautiful garden. guest services desk was very very helpful with driving directions and they gave us a map for each of our itineraries. Their restaurant recommendations were EXCELLENT. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel for LA...service was subpar to say the least!”
Reviews.Author: pernoski
Reviews.Content: takes 30 minutes for valet to bring up your car...and took an hour to get luggage brought up to our room?? Not sure what was going on but after 30min of waiting I went down to find my luggage sitting on the cart in the middle of the lobby...unattended?? I had to advise someone at the checkin counter that I was still waiting...when it didi finally arrive to our room the guy was literally standing there with his hand out expecting a tip?? ARE YOU KIDDING?? room was no hell either...bathroom falling apart and the balcony railing semed quite weak!

Reviews.Title: “One word...WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chplhill
Reviews.Content: If you like a large very elegant hotel, this is for you. The parking is expensive (remember you are in LA) so add another $30 a night for that. They have an incredible gym and workout facility (I think it is $20) and a full service spa. The rooms were HUGE, all had balconies, great views of LA and Bev. Hills. It is a highrise so every room has a view. Cabs are plentiful and cheap to Beverly Hills proper, but it is a hike to walk. They say it is Bev Hills but you are a few miles away from the shopping and the "Bev Hills" of your fantasies. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Just figure the parking into whatever your rate is....only drawback here. THE POOL IS BEAUTIFUL. One of the nicest ever seen outside a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: JHilpert
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel. Excellent Service and Food. Very large rooms. Perfect to stay when in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: Ziplocked
Reviews.Content: Another Priceline bargain at 70.00 per night with no charge for the parking. Absolutely stunning room with nice view, not great, but nice. Everything in the room is what you would expect from a 5 star hotel, although I think Priceline rates this as 4 star. Great mall within walking distance complete with movie theaters. Hotel lobby exudes wealth, if you want to experience how the rich and famous live, this is the place, but keep in mind we only paid 70.00 a night, any more than that and we are priced out. We wanted to stay one more night and were told it would cost 248.00 lol. I think also the free parking was a billing error. Can't complain about anything, totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: itchntotravel
Reviews.Content: Came for UCLA graduation! Got a fair price at the Hyatt Regency Century City w/ Pricline "bid your own". Parking was a pain! $36 valet but had in and out privl. Great mall next to hotel with free three hour parking. We used that during the day and then found a parking place in the near by neighborhood at night (after 8pm. You had to move your car by 8am and was quite a walk but we liked the exercise anyway. Hotel was very nice, clean and fancy! Expensive food and crowded Starbuck's. We brought in food from the mall and had a picnic! Pool area gets shaded early in the afternoon bummer! Public bus near by! Good breakfast place near by off of Santa Monica Blvd. Would I stay again???? Not unless I got a good price! (But,....enjoyed the hotel better than reviews I had read on TA) Glad I had a chance to stay there! Thanks for such a helpful website! (:

Reviews.Title: “Although room was OK, parking was a...”
Reviews.Author: danbeug
Reviews.Content: Although room was OK, parking was a nightmare ($35.00 plus tips), no coffee in room, and staff constantly make you feel like they want to be tipped. Bed gave us back aches, the hotel is cheap on amenities,and they tried to charge us because we moved something in their small fridge to store a medication!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but univiting and be prepared to pay for EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: MikeSF
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice. The lobby is nice, the rooms are nice, and it's got a nice pool. Now for the negatives. Parking is $35/day, and since there aren't many overnight parking lots nearby you're pretty much stuck. Fitness center is $20 per person, per day! No in-room coffee. Nothing around there (except the mall next door). I know it's LA, but Century City is absolutely bleak for pedestrians. Drinks/food are expensive. I didn't like the vibe of the hotel at all and would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: flyfishingattorney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Memorial Day Weekend based on a successful Priceline bid of $109.00 per night to stay at a 4 Star Hotel in the Beverly Hills area. We stayed from Friday night through Monday. We asked for a room with two double beds as high as possible and we were placed in Room 1556 which featured a balcony looking west. The room was a fair size. Not large, but not cramped. The beds and linen were low quality and not nearly as nice as beds one would normally find at a true 4 Star property. The bathroom was older in look. The molding around some of the wall tiles was wearing away and the toiletries provided were of a low grade/quality. The shower head was also just a standard, lower grade and the bathroom itself was hardly 4 Star. The room had a medium sized patio with some garage sale looking cast off furniture. Our room was on the west side of the building and the view was nothing special - just a view of the mall and a not very interesting neighborhood of office complexes. The hotel is within a 5 minute drive to Beverly Hills and a 20 minute drive to the beach. The pool was out of order for half of our stay which was extremely unusual for a busy holiday weekend. However, because the hotel is nestled amongst high rises, the pool area never really got sunny. There is a health club attached to the hotel. However, the daily fee is $20 and is just one of the ways that this lackluster property seeks to nickel and dime its "guests". The hotel does not have coffee makers in the room because they want you to buy coffee from their Starbucks in the lobby. However, they do not open until 6 a.m. and for those of us adjusting from the Eastern Standard Time zone, it's annoying not being able to get coffee until it feels like it's 9 a.m. We did notice that there is ZERO checking of hallways for dirty dishes. We frequently saw discarded breakfast trays left for hours in the corridors. On the last night of our stay we tried to go to bed at 10 p.m. because we had a 7 a.m. flight to catch at LAX. However, after dark, the mall across the road apparently turns into the world's LOUDEST outdoor nightclub. The mall has several bars that BLARE music at levels reminsiscent of the music blared in military siege situations as a form of psychological warfare. (Think the siege of Manuel Noriega where the US military tried to drive him out of his complex by blaring music in an effort to drive him insane). When we laid down at 10 p.m., we could feel the bass beating in the room. Closing the patio door did nothing to decrease the pounding music. After an hour of hoping that the music would STOP at 11 p.m., I caleld down to the front desk to complain about the noise. I spoke with the on duty front desk manager, Clifford and advised we would like to move rooms to the other side of the building because the music from outside was so loud. He acted as if he had no idea about the music. He said he would send security to see if there was a problem. A half hour later, with no knock on the door from security and with the music from outside getting LOUDER, I called back down and asked to speak with the on duty manager. The operator gave me to Debra, the night manager. I advised Debra that we had called a half hour before to complain about the noise. She said that there was nothing she could do as her security guard had stood OUTSIDE our room door and heard no noise anywhere on the floor. I then went downstairs and confronted Debra. She initially tried to claim that there was no noise problem. I requested that she and her security guards come to the room to verify the noise problem. She initially said "That noise from the mall is a city problem and you need to call the police." So, in order to enjoy peace and quiet at their hotel, I would need to be the one who made a noise complaint through the Los Angeles police department - all while Debra STILL insisted that there was no noise problem. As we were waiting for security, she tried to make small talk about the weather. I told her I wasn't in the mood to be dismissed with idle chit chat and that I was stunned that a Hyatt property would treat their guests this way and that I would do all in my power to make corporate know about how poorly guests were treated at the Hyatt Century City. At that point Debra said they were a franchise property with no accountability to HYatt and that a complaint to Hyatt corporate wouldn't make a difference to her AT ALL. She didn't yet offer to move our room to the opposite side of the hotel. She did go up to the room with 2 security guards. One of the guards upon hearing the VERY audible music said "That's the way it is ALL NIGHT, EVERY NIGHT." So, I had an admission from a hotel employee that the music from the mall is ALWAYS like that at night. We hadn't noticed the nights before because we had gone to bed late and exhausted from sight seeing all day. It was now 1:00 a.m. and the hotel's own security guard admitted that the music was a very common problem. Finally, 2 hours after I had started complaining that we couldn't sleep because of the noise, Debra offered to move our room. We had to leave at 5:00 a.m., so by then there was utterly ZERO point in switching rooms in the middle of the night. We packed up and left at 2:00 a.m. So, if you would like to stay in a hotel that has music blaring across the street until the middle of the morning and if you'd like to stay at a hotel where 2 departments' managment tries to deny a major problem affecting "guest" satisfaction until a lower level employee conceded that the music is a constant problem - then the Hyatt Century City is for you. Oh yeah. Valet Parking is $35 a night and the valet is run be a separate company that is completely disorganized. It always took at last 20 minutes to "find" our car and we stood next to a couple who had been waiting for a half hour because the valet lost their keys. This hotel is a major embarrassment to the Hyatt Brand and we will NEVER stay in a Hyatt or use Pricleline again because of the lies, denials and utter lack of care for guest satisfaction shown by the property's managers Debra & Clifford. Horrible, horrible, horrible experience that ruined our intended long weekend "getaway". The getaway was when we left the awful, awful property that should have its Hyatt label taken from it.

Reviews.Title: “hotel billed me $140 in parking when I didn't even park there”
Reviews.Author: 12samos12
Reviews.Content: At check-in I gave my credit card "for incidentals." I had no such charges (paid thru Priceline, which was OK), but the hotel had $140 in parking charges on my bill which I discovered at checkout. I told them to remove that. Yet the $140 appeared on my credit card anyway. Hotel was noisy (thought I heard a jackhammer at night - it was mechanical inside bathroom wall).
