Got upgraded to nice poolside room at checkin at no extra cost. Parking even off-site is so expensive as to offset much of the good room pricing thru Priceline. Room was clean., nice view. Employees seemed helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhanks12
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a nice central area. Rooms are a nice size with very comfortable furniture as well as quality service.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay IF you get a stellar deal...”
Reviews.Author: b0nv0yage2007
Reviews.Content: You're staying near Bev Hills, so you should expect to experience three things at hotel of this caliber...stylish decor, high prices & excellent service. Check to all three at the Century Plaza Hotel... The interior of the hotel is gorgeous and up-to-date. I especially appreciated the modern artwork lining the hallway to my room. If you're bargain savvy, you can stay here for about $100/night by naming your own price on Priceline. But, be prepared to be set back between $24-$35 for parking and $25/pp for breakfast (if you eat in the hotel restaurant). Priceliners...eat breakfast in the single digits at the Starbucks in the lobby. This is not a hotel where you walk out the front door into the action, so choose wisely on the parking...self-parking ($24/day) has NO in/out privileges, but valet ($35+tip) does. Service is stellar...from the moment you step out of our car, at check-in and out, and every experience in between. Free internet in the the lobby and I could access it in my room until I left the next day. I'd definitely stay here again IF I got a great price on the room. If not, I'd be looking to stay more in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chuck S
Reviews.Content: Ever heard of a hotel that charges $300/night and doesn't have coffee available in the room or in the lobby? I FOUND IT! Hyatt Regency Century Plaza is so CHEAP they don't provide coffee makers in the rooms! Nor do they give you complimentary coffee in the lobby as any upscale hotel would do. OOPS operative word, upscale. That means this place is NOT. The W hotels greet you with champagne and give coffee and muffins in the morning for less money than this place. Not to bang on about this, but this place also had some brain child negotiate a contract with Starbucks who rents a kiosk in the lobby that limits their ability to provide coffee to their guests. So they don't give coffee in the rooms nor complimentary coffee in the lobby. You can order room service coffee if you can wait 45 minutes for it. Not being cheap here as I would be willing to pay for coffee if I could get it on time..... AND TO TOP IT OFF THE KNOBS AT STARBUCKS SLEEP IN...they don't open until 6 am!! So you can't even buy coffee to run if you are leaving on an early flight. This place is so cheap that I will NEVER stay here again. Do these people know what's going on in the economy and how other hotels are competing for business by providing the basic things you would expect from a hotel? Has anyone who is running this hotel ever traveled before? Honestly avoid this cheapskate establishment, there's much better value out there.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Business if Close to Your Meetings/Needs”
Reviews.Author: mkouzmine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a convention and received the convention price, therefore making it an affordable option for the area. The hotel was a nice location for an LA conference but I wouldn't choose this hotel on my own for a stay in LA. The location is not so hot. It's nearby Bev Hills, but it is certainly not in Bev Hills. In fact it's not near anything except for a very marginal mall. My room was nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. I ordered room service once and it was good and came quickly. The concierge was good and helped me book a few things to keep myself occupied during down times.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing for the chain”
Reviews.Author: aphex732
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for two nights at the end of a trip and were very unhappy, to say the least. Apparently they were having a charity event when we arrived, and we waited about 20 minutes in a line of cars to get to the front of the hotel (which is understandable). Our bags were unloaded and the bellman gave us a ticket. After checking in, we waited for our bags - which never arrived! No one could find them, until I saw them sitting, completely unattended, at the outside corner of the hotel (no staff within 30 feet of them). Luckily, no one decided to grab them and run. Our room was very lackluster - we had stayed in four hotels this trip, and the Hyatt was by far the worst. There was mold in the bathroom, the carpet was worn, and the room was shabby overall. As if our first run-in with the front door staff wasn't enough, I parked the car in front of the hotel the next day to speak to the concierge about dinner reservations. The valet told me to leave the key under the front mat, which I did. When I returned, the key was gone, and no one knew where it was! Not in the valet station, none of the valets had it...finally, they tracked down the bellman, who had it in his pocket for some reason. Unlike the other night, there were less than ten cars in sight - no reason to lose keys. On the plus side, the concierge was very helpful and informative - the only plus side to an otherwise lukewarm experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: lcmg71
Reviews.Content: This was rated a 4 star hotel by AAA. In my book it was only a 3 star. We had a king room on 7th floor overlooking pool which was fine. But, the bed sheets were worn and had holes, the carpet had some stains, the phone seemed to be malfunctioning, the lights were difficult to turn on/off, the bellman just dropped our bags on the floor and did not pull out the baggage stand and place the bag on it (there was also only 1 stand, and we had 2 bags), in a couple of instances no one answered the car valet service phone (also $35/day for parking - a bit steep), business center was not 24 hour, received a morning newspaper at the door only 1 morning out of 3, and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Not so hot”
Reviews.Author: hinkgen
Reviews.Content: We did get an okay price for this hotel ($100/nt.) on Priceline. Parking was $30 a night, and the staff always had their hands out for tips. When we arrived in our room (the only "update" was a flat screen TV), there was a fridge still full of someone else's food, and items remained in the drawers. When we called staff, they did take care of it right away, but with zero apologies or compensation (drink coupon???/coffee coupon???). The mirrored wall in the bathroom had a large crack in it. The lobby was very nice with an open bar area and lots of seating. We didn't use the pool area at all. The view was excellent, and it was very quiet. The beds were very comfy. Upon check-out, the desk attendant didn't inquire about our stay, say thank you or good-bye (and I had a pleasant enough look on my face). I'd sooner stay someplace with a bit more personality and not so much stuffiness.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: paulday448
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on our arrival in Los Angeles from the UK. The valet parking is 30 dollars for one night or the self park is 25 dollars. We had a nice quiet night before setting off for Las Vegas the next morning. The hotel is clean and spacious, it has a Starbucks in the foyer and a bar serving cocktails etc. The morning of our departure we shared one breakfast from the room service menu. 30 dollars got us a pot of tea, 2 eggs, 2 rashers of bacon, some grits and 2 muffins. Most people went to Starbucks to get breakfast though. The location is not too bad but nowhere within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but, would've preferred a better location”
Reviews.Author: SRBe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the financial district therefore, not much around within walking distance other than a shopping mall. The hotel itself is very nice and the rooms come with a balcony, so that's an added plus. You probably want to request the view from the back of the hotel. Somehow I was upgraded to a high floor w/o knowing and was charged w/o being informed! I had my bill adjusted @ checkout. Unfortunately, they charge you for the gym. Parking is a bummer as well, $35/day +tip etc. The self park garage behind the hotel charges $24/day w/o in/out privileges! If your'e staying here you will need the in/out privileges!

Reviews.Title: “Loud night and uncaring staff - bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: latraveller2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our one-year anniversary. I booked it online and clicked on the "quite room" request along with the upgrade to the penthouse. They gave me the upgrade for free, which was nice of them. The room has very poor insulation to the outdoors, so we heard the traffic and loud people all night long - even though we were 19 floors up. We also heard people partying around 2:00 am and again at 4:00 am. Even though we had a non-smoking room, we smelled heavy smoke around 4:00 am. We could also hear the guy next door coughing most of the night. Additionally, there were flies in our room and the bathtub was backed up. I told the staff all this when we checked out and all Ryan said was "sorry." Big picture, the hotel is well-located, but it's definitely not a quiet getaway. I felt like I was in NYC with all the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...possibly bed bugs?”
Reviews.Author: Dewey76
Reviews.Content: I actually had a nice stay. The staff are friendly, and hotel is really beautiful. My one criticism of the amenities is no gym. You can use the Equinox, but at at 20$ a visit, that seems too expensive. However, here's the thing: one day after returning home, I began being bitten by something. I had taken all of my clothes out of my suitcases and left them on my bed...and now I'm getting what seem like bed bug bites? I have a very clean house--never had this problem. This could be a COMPLETE coincidence, but my warning would be to check your room (check your mattress). Again, it's a lovely hotel, but I would just say, check your mattress for any signs just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great staff, close to Beverly Hills/Rodeo Dr area”
Reviews.Author: dls1834
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel. Staff was very friendly, rooms were clean and nice. If you have a car it's a quick drive for sightseeing in Hollywood etc, and very close to Beverly Hills area. Be prepared to pay for parking...ugh, but I think you have to pay almost anywhere. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down: Best Hotel In LA!”
Reviews.Author: jamiezausaus
Reviews.Content: I am an LA resident, yet due to work and many late night productions in the theater and in studio. I often still stay in hotels (even though I only live 40 min away). For any high budget production I ALWAYS put my cast and crew here. Excellent, well appointed, and get's my vote for the best hotel in the city!

Reviews.Title: “major dissappointment how can anyone rate this a 4 star ?”
Reviews.Author: windandseagirl
Reviews.Content: We had booked a Century Suite 3 night stay at this Hyatt the week of Feb15th 2010. We were traveling with 2 thirteen yr old boys. I want to list the positives first. One bedroom /extra half bathroom/ great views ! Staff very attentive to one of my boys having a peanut allergy. For some reason the security guard was our bell man and said he would help us if ever needed? { a little weird} Negatives- the room was very dirty . It had an inch of dusk everywhere . When we opened the pull out couch I was disgusted ! There were stains all over it and the mattress was so thin and worn out one of the boys couldnt even sleep all night. The roll away bed was so dusty and dirty I had to dust it before I let me son sleep. To top it all off this was the noisiest hotel I ever have been in. It is centrally located yes . However its across the street from a mall and a bus depot and the buses are constantly roaring by. I could not sleep until after midnight and woke up to at 5:45 in the morning from the beeping of backing up trucks !! Constant ! In the morning when I told the front desk why we were checking out they actually told me " You have one of the best rooms in the hotel but its in the back where the loading dock is ! " Not only did I get no sleep / I have terrible allergies and I was miserable after the one night there. The pool area looks dated and dirty and finally the view they give of the pools from above makes it look like they have a few pools . Dont believe it. They are one inch deep pools for show and the ducks . The jacuzzi was dirty as well. I would never go there again. It ruined one day of our vacation. I usually love Hyatts.

Reviews.Title: “Good service makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: TravelguyNYC75
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hyatt Century Plaza after a very long flight extremely tired. You'd be surprised how much of a difference can a genuinely nice front desk receptionist make a difference. Ben, with a quick and smooth check-in and a warm smile was what made a difference for us. Rooms at the Hyatt Century Plaza are spacious with a nice bathroom. The gym is Equinox which makes it a full gym. It just costs $20 which are excessive in major city where appearance is everything and hence gyms are abundant. The Pool is very nice. Location is convenient (you must rent a car) but make no mistakes this property isn't in West Hollywood or Beverly Hills. Though we used the valet, the parking lot is just behind the hotel which can't justify the laziness (mine included).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodation”
Reviews.Author: jonastenbent
Reviews.Content: It's been a couple years, but I doubt the quality of this establishment has changed. If you can stomach the high price for a room here, you SHOULD stay here if visiting L.A. (I didn't have to pay, I was here on business...company paid.) You can expect top-notch service and treatment, spotless rooms (and every other area), and absolutely beautiful surroundings. I'm just a hick from Indiana, but I have to say the beds are among the best I've ever slept in. (Little story...my flight was delayed and I arrived a little late. So I checked in and needed to wait a bit before going to the next scheduled event. While waiting, I sat on the very fluffy and inviting bed--just to check it out. Next thing I know, it's three hours later and my phone wakes me up--my boss wanting to know when I'd show up for dinner!) Anyway, if you have the coins to stay here--DO IT, you can't go wrong. Also, it's reasonably close to the best nightlife L.A. has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Considering the reviews, I was pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Susanloveshotels
Reviews.Content: First of all, I want to thank the reviewers who mentioned asking for a coffee maker and refrigerator. I requested them upon check-in, and they were delivered quickly. The coffee was great, by the way. I was very pleased with the room and the condition of the hotel. I especially loved the bathroom. However, I found the mattress somewhat uncomfortable, while the shower was fantastic! I attempted to negotiate a reduction in the parking fee since I had stayed for 4 nights, and plan on returning for another 4 next month, but was told by the General Manager's office that they contract out the parking, so they were unable to adjust the fee. However, I did notice on the last night of my stay the entrance to the hotel public parking/MGM building is just around the corner on Constellation Boulevard. I'll take advantage of that knowledge next trip. I also purchased Hyatt gift certificates at a 20% discount from Costco, and used them to pay for parking, which brought the fee down from insane to merely outrageous. Also, I have an air card for my laptop, so I didn't have to deal with the internet fees. I do find it hard to fathom a hotel of this caliber charging for internet access. Apparently the price of parking at the hotel is known in LA. I was scheduling a meeting and the person I spoke with said she didn't want to meet at the hotel because the parking fees are so expensive. She said "everyone" knows about them, and avoids meetings at the Hyatt because of the parking. I wonder how much revenue the hotel misses out on because of the parking fees? Nevertheless, I still recommend this hotel if you can get a good rate on Priceline and discount certificates from Costco!

Reviews.Title: “Los Angeles Vacation”
Reviews.Author: AnjanetteG
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, centrally located to everything a tourist would want to do in LA.

Reviews.Title: “a great experience”
Reviews.Author: howards2010
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to the USA, I stayed in 5 different hotels and this was definitely the best of all. The staff are friendly and helpful, the ambience is good and the rooms are clean and modern. The lobby is spacious and clean and all dealings with staff were pleasant and efficient. The room was surprisingly large and clean and comfortable. Location was good. No gym on the premises - had to walk there but its close by

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: hazel2
Reviews.Content: Just finished stay for 7 days and had a very good experience - David Horowitz, general manager, was very helpful in helping to arrange our rooms as we were traveling with 3 young children. Pool is beautiful and heated, but unfortunately the smaller wading pools were ice cold and not kept as clean as when I had stayed here 3 years ago. I disagree with a previous taveller about the regency club offerings - we found that to be a great option for us for coffee, water, juice, snacks. The location is off of the main lobby and that was no problem for us. Staff within the club was great except for one young lady who was disinterested in mingling - one young man even made me an iced latte because of the great warm days we were lucky enough to be enjoying. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Faded but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: utt959
Reviews.Content: I heard this hotel was in danger of being taken out of service so stayed one night. Starbucks was closed early in the day which was disappointing. The hotel is near an upscale mall, convenient for shopping. A bit expensive but the area is expensive. The shower rain and the ceiling on the balcony had rust stains but every room had a balcony which was a big plus. A good rate would have made the experience better but I would recommend The Century Plaza to a traveller to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingaussies
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and it was excellent. We booked this through priceline and had nothing but excellent service. We had a room on the 11th floor with great views. Yes the parking is step but well worth it. It's very close to a great shopping mall and only a short drive anywhere. We enjoyed our stay and would return if back in LA.

Reviews.Title: “No parking, no king beds, expensive internet, $20 exercise”
Reviews.Author: drgeach
Reviews.Content: They basically nickel and dimed us to death. It is a nice hotel, a little old, but kind of a nice reminder of hollywoods golden age. That being said. We had two cars and they wanted $35/car for valet, so we drove around to their "parking lot" and it was like a half a mile from the hotel. It was still $24/car/ night. Then we get to check and we have to decided between a double size bed and a smoking room. Finally we ask if the exercise room is still open and they say it is, but you have to pay $20 each. Also, if you want to use the internet, $20. I am sorry, but that is BS, we are not coming back

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, nice quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: meljup
Reviews.Content: Our first hotel in the U.S on what is to be a long trip. We found the hotel to be fantastic. We loved the location, as it was a tidy area, with lots of interesting things to watch from the balcony. We saw a movie being filmed across the road one morning. The valet service was good (but $35)and all the staff were impeccable. The location across the road from a shopping mall and supermarket was also handy for travelers with children who needed essentials. Overall, a great experience, and a perfect location near Santa Monica blvd if you have a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - more for business than tourists.”
Reviews.Author: Gil57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my daughter from 26th until 30th October. We flew in from Las Vegas where we had been for a few days to celebrate her 21st. We arrived about 3pm, there were no queues at check in, and we were quickly allocated 2 rooms (she will not share with me). I had a room with 2 beds, and she had a room with 1 bed - a few doors apart on 6th floor. Check in staff very helpful. Bellboy bought luggage to rooms very quickly. The rooms were very large, and had more than enough hanging space and drawer space. There was an iron/board in wardrobe. A fridge - touch it and you are charged for items. The bathroom was fine - with reasonable lighting. Loads of towels - with my usual complaint of bath towels not being big enough to go round a slightly larger lady - so I just used two. There was also a range of toiletries. The beds were extremely comfortable. We found that this hotel is more suited to conferences than tourists and is slightly out of the main "hub" of the city. I know that L.A. like London is very spread out. I found the concierge extremely helpful in helping me choose tours and booking them for daughter and I. Our room rate included American breakfast buffet - which I found to be OK - would have liked it more if there had been pancakes or french toast included, but there was more than enough choice. We were given vouchers for breakfast - and if you get them, do look on the back because if you don't want breakfast you can use it at the Starbucks until about 10.30am for coffee etc. worth $12.00. My daughter paid for and used the gym/spa attached to the hotel and found it to be first class. We only sat out at the pool a couple of times - as it was during the week there were only a handful of people around it. It was very helpful having the Westfield shopping centre around the corner with some lovely restaurants in it, lovely shops and supermarket for snacks etc. We were leaving on a Friday and on the Thursday I asked whether it would be possible to keep one of the rooms until we left at 3pm for no extra charge, and they said of course. This was a great help to us in changing for travelling and last minute packing. I did not use the bar so cannot comment on it either than to say it was full of delegates for the main convention on that week the first couple of days. Would I stay here again - probably yes. I did not rent a car, so did spend a fair amount on taxis which i had budgeted for, so no real problem. One other bonus is opposite concierge there are 2 free computers solely for the purpose of "on-line" check in and printing boarding passes for many airlines.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business stay, better than expected of brand”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_TravelsSF
Reviews.Content: I generally can stay at Peninsulas or Ritz Carltons for business travel. I was not that excited about the prospect of the Hyatt in Century Plaza. I was pleasantly surprised. Hotel lobby and restaurant (breakfast) were very pleasant and upscale. My room (facing the pool) on a high floor was very quiet. Bed was comfortable, room had Ipod station, flat-screen, mini-bar, arm chair and ottoman. Bathroom was clean and larger than standard. Complimentary Wall Street Journals in the restaurant in the morning. All in all, a good hotel for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and terrific location”
Reviews.Author: TBenson89
Reviews.Content: Kids eat free--lunch and dinner only. Great hotel and walking distance from Disney

Reviews.Title: “Overrated...Past Its Prime”
Reviews.Author: ArchTrekker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at least 40 years old surrounded by newer, taller and more modern buildings. Although the room decor and furnishings are up to date, the general design and layout of the driveway, lobby, shops, and other ground level facilities are really very disappointing. Don't sign up for its Regency Club feature...the hospitality room is in a very isolated location relative to the rooms and the mid and late day snacks, etc. are very short in quality, quantity and imagination.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Hollywood, Even Closer to High Prices”
Reviews.Author: scl44
Reviews.Content: The exterior hints at the Hollywood of Greta Garbo or Marilyn Monroe. Yes, the Hyatt Century Plaza retains the faÃ§ade of a previous era and evokes a sense of nostalgia. Once inside, the modern lobby transports visitors to the current era. But any sense of Hollywood dissipates as guests discover the hotel. The guest rooms incorporate one element of Hollywood â€“ trendy designs behind the bed â€“ but outside of this creative touch, an unknowing guest may think he was still at the Hyatt Dallas airport. The only other aspect of the room worth noting is the balcony which allows guests to enjoy the temperate California weather. Beyond the guest room, the pool area is pleasant albeit suited for a hotel half this size. While Hollywood is not evident in the rooms or in the amenities, the hotel delivers a not-so-subtle reminder on the bill. The restaurant offers a few California specialties at California prices, and the fitness center maintains its exclusivity through a $20/day entrance fee. In short, for those expecting a first-class experience consider this your warning: the Hyatt Century Cityâ€™s proximity to the stars also means proximity to high prices. And in this hotel what you get is not correlated with what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Service great, location not so much.”
Reviews.Author: BalSingh
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Century Plaza is a lovely hotel located in Beverly Hills. The one thing that really stood out is the effort they went to to provide for our 18mth old. They offered a crib, fridge in room, microwave, baby toiletries etc and that to me made the service more than exceptional. The rooms were spacious and tidy with all standard things expected from a 4* hotel (minibar, safe, flat TV). The room had a balcony which is great in the hot weather. A nice outdoor pool and fitness center are free for all guests too. Theres a restaurant (expensive), bar and a Starbucks on site. Now the not so good bits .... location is average. Its more in a financial area with all office buildings around it. The main Beverly Hills sites are a taxi ride or a drive. The savign grace is that there is a nice shopping centre with restaurnants within walkign distance. Other than that, have your card ready .... everything at this hotel is expensive eg. room service, valet parking, restaurant etc. A nice stay but a car is essential!!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS TRIP!!!”
Reviews.Author: beckyjUk
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to LA. We came over for the MLS tournament and business meetings. The hotel was great and all the staff were really helpful. The rooms were clean and comfy. There is a starbucks in the hotel lobby which is huge. If you have watched Lie to Me and The Ugly Truth you will see it. Whilst we were there, they were filming Lie to Me, which was great. The day before we took a tour around the stars homes etc and stopped off to pick up more people and met Tony Curtis.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HanaleimomTx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights: 9/3 & 9/4/2009 for $99/nt by bidding on priceline.com. Lobby is very nice. Pool has nice lounge chair, warm hot tub, can't complain. The Breeze restaurant's outside courtyard is a little oasis itself. Bed is very comfortable. Restroom is large with double sink. I was surprised that a travel tube of toothpaste is included. Room is extra clean. We got the balcony facing the business building: 2000 Avenue of the Stars (where they were filming "The Green Hornet" while we were there). Balcony is nice size, but we didn't really use it. One nightstand has the iHome plug in unit. Westfield Mall is across the street with lots of choices in the food court. There are other restaurants inside the mall also: Italian, Seafood, PanAsian, etc. Overall we are very happy. Check out the pictures. Valet parking with in/out privileges is $33/day (pricey) but they are fast and there are plenty of them to get your car within less than 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, on the pricy side”
Reviews.Author: CSRE
Reviews.Content: Very nice luxury hotel. This is a huge, very nice, expensive place to stay. I only recommended if you have a car (even though you have to pay over $30 for parking), cause it is a little far for walking. Rooms were big, nice and comfy. And service was very good. The pool is nice but if they have an event you wont be allowed to use it (or even walk by for that matter) The place stills holds plenty of parties and important events so you might spots celebrities and important people. I have no complains of this place cause I got it for 100 on priceline, but I would never pay their >$300 rate to stay here again. I just donâ€™t get why you stay at a comfort or holyday in for $80 bucks and get breakfast, wifi, free parking and movies, and on a $300 one you have to pay $14 for room internet access, $50 for breakfast, $35 for valet and $15 to catch a movie. Lol. They had no vending machines in the floors and the minibar has that electronic system that if you touch something it is billed to you, so forget about bringing a bottle of water to cool in the fridge. Again, donâ€™t get me wrong, this place is super nice and service was great, but for that kind of money and such little extras, I would go elsewhere (if i had to pay full rate).

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great location and excellent service to boot!”
Reviews.Author: SameerPattni
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly impressed with the staff and the service we received during our stay. In fact, I dont recall staying at a hotel where the staff has been so friendly and yet so professional all at the same time. Each and every member of staff we met would take the opportunity to wish us a good day and ensure our stay was going well. It was beyond our expectations and we wouldnt hesitate in staying with a Hyatt hotel again in the future. Even when things went wrong the staff took our complaints very seriously and worked quickly to resolve them. The hotel itself is clean, spacious and modern.

Reviews.Title: “elegance in LA”
Reviews.Author: vagabondCvilleva
Reviews.Content: When I fly cross country to LA to visit my 20 something daughter, we love to have a day or two of luxury at a nice hotel. Believe me, we have stayed at many over the years she has lived and gone to school in LA! Our new favorite is the Hyatt Century Plaza! The rooms are elegant and spacious as well as the balconies that open out onto a private sitting area with wonderful views, a table and comfy chairs [ask for a room on the pool side on a high floor for stunning views]. The pool area is large and inviting with nice greenery surrounding it, firepit,jacuzzi, private cabanas,bars etc and 2 wading pools. The reception area is beautiful as well. There is kiosk check in[which we didnt use]. And the neatest thing I havent personally seen in any of the other hotels I have stayed in, is the airport checkin computer just for printing your boarding passes in lightening speed! Upon arrival into the capacious shiny marble and glass lobby, We were greeted at the reception desk by a friendly lady who made us feel instantly welcome. It is so nice these days to deal with people who really seem to love what they are doing. She even made sure we got a great room. [I think she actually upgraded us as we had a super saver rate].This hotel has everything from a Starbucks,to a sundry shop that actually stays open most nights until 11, bars, spa and fitness center,casual as well as more upscale dining , and gorgeous grounds. They also allow canine friends which is, for me, always a good sign [though we werent traveling with any pets]. The park like grounds are perfect for strolling or dog walking. One would not know you were in LA! Across the street there is a large upscale mall, The Westfield Center, with groceries, theatres , many great shops, and a better than average food court. The rooms are so comfortable! The first night we had trouble with our ac though it was cool out and we didnt really need it. But they came immediately the next morning and fixed it..the nicest 2 men, very apologetic and quiet as they worked. Then we were offered a free movie for the inconvenience. We have stayed at The Renaissance, Beverly Hills Hotel, The Roosevelt, the Mondarin, the Ritz Carlton Marina Del Ray, The Palomar Westwood [our second favorite], Parc Suites in B Hills as well as private rental homes. But this hotel for us had the perfect balance of glam,comfort,friendliness,great bar..try their special Skywalker martini, service, ambience,outside space, and views! We felt much more special here than we did at the Beverly Hills Hotel, which is getting ragged around the edges these days. So Park Hyatt.. we are your new regulars! [they also have an extended business center for all your needs, and also prompt courteous valet service ..you may self park as well at the garage behind the hotel, a luxury money saver in LA]. Try this hotel, you wont be disappointed..if I had one tiny thing negative to say it would be only that the food at Breeze [other than the delicious kobe burger, 18.00$ ] for lunch that day wasnt the best for the price [though the waiter was extremely nice ]..I had the sushi special, rainbow roll..I've had much better at some of the little hole in the wall sushi places around the area..the 80 dollar bill took my breath away..but then I guess that's LA] Yet it didnt dampen our perfect stay one bit!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty swish”
Reviews.Author: Offagainareyou
Reviews.Content: A very swish hotel with very nice roomsand comfortable beds. The hotel is well located in Beverly Hills. You can access nearby freeways easily enough to take you most places but you do need a car to get anywhere. The Getty Centre is only a short drive away which, having visited for the first time, we shall visit every time we stay in LA. Staff were helpful and friendly. Housekeeping was good although they had a thing about not replacing drinking glasses with clean ones. Valet parking at $33 a day is, although expensive, very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but Big and Old.”
Reviews.Author: anecessaryevil
Reviews.Content: Reminds me of some the big awful hotels in Vegas. Comfortable rooms, and prompt service. The Starbucks is either so busy you have to wait half an hour, or closed. No discernible bell desk or service. I am sure it is an important location, but as I had one night, maybe better off at an on-airport LAX place. Good access to downtown and Westwood. It's a clean hotel. What can I say ?

Reviews.Title: “Classy property and good location. Gouged for parking!”
Reviews.Author: Paulguyinnj
Reviews.Content: This is a classy property smack in the middle of the business district of Century City. Gorgeous and elegant interior design of public areas. The rooms are also tastefully elegant and beautiful. It seems this property was renovated within the last few years since our room had a huge flat screen TV, marble bath, and excellent bed. The room was spotlessly clean and equipped with high end furnishings. Service was friendly and quick as well. The biggest gripe about this property is the exorbitant parking rates of 24 dollars a day with no in or out privileges. That is purely asinine. For 33 bucks you can get valet parking that has in and out privileges. I suspect they get away with charging such fees since there are few options for parking in the area. Also, they charge 10 bucks a day for internet access. Which is another form of needlessly gouging a customer. I really shouldn't complain much since I got the room for 100 bucks on priceline but gouging customers is gouging no matter how much was paid for a room. Is it worth the 225 buck rack rate? I don't think so if you also have to be gouged for parking and internet access. Aside from parking and internet fees this is a very elegant property and is recommended for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Century City”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkGail
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect location for walking to the Century City mall which has everything, you don't even need a car if you stay here. Rooms are small and do not have shower stalls.The pool is lovely and Equinox Fitness is next door. Service is excellent and staff bends over to please unlike the Intercontinential next door which we loved when it was a Park Hyatt. I heard both hotels are on Priceline and Hotwire for $100 Great deal.

Reviews.Title: “LA '60s classic holds up as an excellent hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: I hope they don't tear it down soon, but it's a real possibility. One of the few classic '60s buildings in LA, it could come down in favor of two soulless condo towers (do we actually need more of these) by some soulless developer. We have to stop him! In the meantime, Hyatt took over from Westin a few years ago and upgraded the rooms. They're nicely done without being too fancy or elegant... no marble bathrooms, for instance. But the rooms are huge, the lanais are huge, the entry is large and the bathroom slightly less so. The views facing east are the best... you get the CAA building, the Hollywood sign and the downtown skyline. The pool area in back was quiet pleasant and large. The staff was friendly without being too starched and there's a Starbucks in the lobby. Parking is steep... valet is $35 with in and out privileges, while self-parking in back is $28 with no privileges (but if you show up late at night and leave early, you can get by paying in the teens and storing your car across the street the Century City mall for 3 hours free). They also shouldn't charge you $20 a workout at the Equinox gym attached to the hotel... it's a rip-off... but what can you do? The bed was comfy, the a/c worked great, and the rooms were extremely quiet. All in all, a great stay and I stayed at an astonishingly low Priceline price. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: CnJ-July9
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline for $100/night and we'll stay again in the future. Easy/great location. Nicely updated. Great staff. Comfortable bed, shower, clean. Check in was less than 5 minutes and check out was over the phone from the room. Very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely supprise after LAX”
Reviews.Author: MikeUSA99
Reviews.Content: Well I don't really have to say alot about this place the only complain was that the sign on the Ice machine door was a little hard to read so it took me a while to find it. Everything else A* Early check in 9am! Great Clean Modern Airy Helpful Would recomend to anyone in LA

Reviews.Title: “Plush and comfortable in a very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: boomerz
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. Our room had a great view looking west. Located just a short drive to Beverly Hills, UCLA, West Hollywood, etc. The area around the hotel looks like a financial/business district, a lot of very large office buildings. The adjacent outdoor shopping mall has up-market stores and restaurants, movie theater. If you need a nice place to stay within driving distance of Hollywood/Beverly Hills attractions, this is a great choice. I got a terrific room rate by bidding on Priceline, but parking is expensive. They were filming an episode of Monk in the lobby of the hotel when we were there... a real L.A. experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but lots of extra fees”
Reviews.Author: PASkyGuy
Reviews.Content: I found the best rate/offer by calling this hotel directly and asking if they had any deals or promotions for AAA members. For staying 1 night we got 4 free hot buffet breakfasts and free valet parking. Valet parking here is around $35/night so the free breakfasts and the free parking sealed the deal. I stayed here several years ago when it was a Westin and Hyatt has made some nice upgrades to the lobby and the guest rooms. But some minor things are still the same - they seem to always run short on pool towels by the afternoon and it seems to take an unusually long time to get more. The other thing is that this hotel has many extra fees. The business center wanted $5 for 15 minutes of internet time. Much smaller hotels have free internet access in their business centers. Also, be sure not to bump into the mini bar's food and drinks as the hotel could charge you even if the food was moved but not consumed - fortunately my young son didn't see the mini bar til just before we left.... Overall the pluses vastly outweigh the minuses as the breakfast buffet was excellent, the main pool was clean with many pool chairs available, the rooms were clean, bathrooms were modern and large, and the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Hotel, Great Service, Not the Greatest Value”
Reviews.Author: RuralMA
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel several times a year because it is the most convenient for my business meetings in LA. It's reliable from a consistency of room quality and service standpoint, and I've always been able to check in early (often before noon) with no hassles. mid week pricing varies widely depending on what else they have going on - I've payed less than $200 and well over $400 for the same room depending on the trip. hotel has a nice pool, good running routes nearby and is easy to get to from LAX. Dining in the hotel is good but pricey, however you can easily walk over to 2000 ave of stars for breakfast or lunch options, or down the street to the westfield mall for dinner. Valet is mandatory, but it is quick and has in / out option which is nice. I hate to get nickel and dimed for things like a USA Today, internet service, etc., but I realize they're not unique in these things.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Art, Lousy Amenities”
Reviews.Author: SteelerFan81
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for a week. The hotel property is very well maintained. However, they should have spent less on their decorator and more on their guests. No in room coffee maker, and you received one towel set per day - even if the towels had make up stains and were left on the floor for them to collect and wash - they were refolded for you to use. I called and asked for clean towels at 5:00 pm they didn't arrive until 10:00pm. The ice bucket is more like a mug, and they only provide one water glass. The noise level in the hotel is very high. The taxi line in front of the hotel is loud even at 2 am - with many curse words shouted in many languages. This hotel is in the middle of office complexes, but it is nice to have the Westfield Mall with a Gelson's market within walking distance. You can walk to Rodeo drive, it's about 3 miles round trip. By the end of the week I felt like I was in a concrete and glass prison. Not recommended for anyone but a business traveler (although internet access is $10 a day) on a short stay. Valet parking is $33 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tjnkriss
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for and was a Great two nights. concierge was a great help wonderfull landscape . enjoyed the spa services realy nice and inviting people . the only down side to the hotel is the meal and drink prices my wife and I ate Breakfast at the hotel and it was good but I thought $50 for a breakfast buffett was steap . we had a drink in the lobby bar and a domestic beer was 7 bucks wow the mini bar in the room was the same price .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing All Around”
Reviews.Author: YYZBUF
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a brief night, but had an amazing stay. A hotel is just a hotel, its the service that makes the difference. Quick Check In- Ordered extra towels, and they were there in less than 3 minutes flat. Valet Service was very quick and friendly! A very elegant and chic high ceiling lobby where we saw an MTV personality, Great patio/pool area to sit. Rooms had a nice bathroom (minus an ugly caulking job) with balcony and modern decor. The lobbys leading up to the rooms are probably nicer than the rooms with art work in them. You can not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Dlclay1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza on May 23, 2009. It is a great hotel. The staff was all very friendly and eager to please. The room and the common areas were very clean and the view from my room was outstanding overlooking the pool area and the mountains in the distance. The restaurant was great and the service was wonderful. Iâ€™m looking forward to another visit in the near future for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “They get it right!!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2world
Reviews.Content: I've been practically living at this hotel on and off over the past few months while out here working on a project for work. I've recently come to appreciate this place more and more as I stay at other hotels in the area to "switch it up." Although the Intercontinental down the street isn't bad, it's location is much worse. Pros: - rooms are nice size all come with balconies and nice size bathroom - hotel has heated jacuzzi & pool - staff is really, really nice and make the special effort to ensure you're comfortable (from general manager, front desk managers on down to the woman in the lobby store - nice bars & club - food is decent (you can order lunch items during dinner) - quiet for the most part (as long as you're high up, in the back & not close to the X bar) - ipod stand in all rooms - good location close to century park mall ...can walk around and do shopping there's also a movie theater, gelsons grocery store, very good restaurants- houstons, pink taco and my fav rock sugar - have rental car in hotel (can cab from airport & rent car as you need) -give free starbucks coffee coupon (for lobby starbucks) Cons: - no health club- have to pay for Equinox attached to hotel $20 (hotels this size & calibur should have a health club) - valet parking is a rip off but there's a parking lot a block away at 2040 century park east that is reasonable (monthly fee of $135- perhaps cheaper daily fees) - can get overcrowded during event nights (but sightseeing opportunity for stars- if you care about that) -They don't have Bravo on TV

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, centrally located hotel, but beware the add-ons”
Reviews.Author: FlatSix911
Reviews.Content: My finacee and I live in a city near LA, but as we spend most of our weekends in town, we figured we'd have a more romantic Memorial Day weekend. The rooms are of average size: neither cramped nor huge. The hotel appears to be recently renovated, with modern looking furnishings in generally very good/excellent condition. I know the lobby has undergone quite a face lift, with numerous bar areas added inside and outside. We did have an excellent experience with their concierge, Albin, who was both personable and diligent. When we asked him at 1pm on a Saturday for a reservation at a short list of restaurants (all of which were booked at prime hours), he suggested a few excellent spots that I'd forgotten about. Dutifully calling restaurants after they opened, he came through with a terrific restaurant, at the time we wanted, and a great table to boot. Do beware, however, that there are some fees that, while not hidden, are unavoidable and will significantly boost the nightly cost. First, there is no street parking anywhere near Century City; valet at the hotel will run you $33, and a self-park parkade on the back side of the hotel is both rather inconvenient, priced at $24 a day, and doesn't have in-and-out privileges (i.e., you'll pay each time you leave). Also, there is no gym in the hotel, although you can buy guest passes to the Equinox attached to the hotel for $20 a person, per day. That said, with its proximity to good shopping, restaurants across Avenue of the Stars and at Clementine on the north side of Santa Monica, this could very well function as a nice little way to burn a relaxing weekend without driving. As long as your expectations are set to add an additional $30 - $50 a night in extra services, you'll be very satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rich!!”
Reviews.Author: hemantvelury
Reviews.Content: Really rich and classy place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but noisy bar”
Reviews.Author: Westinhan
Reviews.Content: The room was well-appointed and everything was great. But the food and drinks were overpriced. I think the room service meals could have been better considering how expensive they were ($50 entrees). Dinner in your room will cost about $80 or so. The outside pool and jacuzzi are nice, albeit simple. I couldn't sleep because of the noisy bar though. I guess it's the hotel's way to make extra revenue, but what about the guests who want to sleep? At least it closed early (maybe midnight?) There is the Century City shopping mall and theatres across the street, so it is a great location. Also, you can take a short cab ride to Beverly Hills and West Hollywood (meaning US$15 plus tip for a 3 minute ride). I left a comment about the noisy bar and the manager was kind enough to send a letter offering to upgrade my room the next time I stay there which was a nice gesture. The hotel is definitely upscale and there are only Bentleys, Jaguars, and Mercedes-Benzes parked in front.

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: meeravelury
Reviews.Content: The place is classy and the view is excellent! Absolutely recommended :)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: EZT
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic property in the midst of LA, blocks from St Monica Boulevard and the Century Plaza Mall. The rooms are very large, very comfortable and impecably appointed. The beds are huge, and as good as they can be. There is a large LCD screen too. There is a very confy desk for computer and other work. Internet is excellent at high speed (both wireless and through cable provided for by the Hotel). The bathroom is great, and there are no faults which can be found. Safety box is also available in the room for no fee. The lobby is very large; staff are very attentive and the price, in our case, was very reasonable as we picked this up at the last minute for the bargain price of $99 + tax. That is a steal for a property which is 4 star but should be 5. Carpark is extra at $33 per day. You need a car in LA obviously so this is a cost to consider. Location of the property is excellent in the middle of everything, a short drive to Beverly Hills and all other attractions in LA. Highly recommended for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice hotel - I'd happily stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SiouxSue
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 days and nights for a conference at the hotel. Used the Super Shuttle airport limo to/from the airport, and it was fine ($14 vs. $40, est., for cab from LAX). The concierge set up the return trip for me from his desk. Painless. Also a place in the lobby to print boarding passes and other travel documents, connected to 2 computers w/Internet access. Convenient! (The airport was another story, however! Be sure to allow at least an hour to get through security for United when you are headed home.) Loved my room! Comfy chair with foot stool, desk with 2 (2!) chairs, bed with plenty of pillows of many sizes, good fee-based WiFi access (also an ethernet cable in the desk), many plugs for recharging cellphone and computer batteries, and nice, large bathroom with plenty of counter space and great traveler sample lotions and potions. May sound strange, but I really liked the elevators. They came quickly - never a long wait for an elevator, and it's a big hotel. And the food, whether at the conference or in the restaurant, was excellent. Frou-frou (this is LA, after all), but excellent and a teensy pricy. There is a food court at a nearby shopping center, a couple of blocks away, for a change of pace and a chance to get outside for a short walk. Only two negative comments - marginally negative, at that: 1.) The billing. It was a 4 day conference, but I could only get the conference rate for 3 of the 4 days. The second night was at the higher AAA rate. So, I received 3 bills - one for the first night (conference rate), a second one for the second night (AAA rate), and a third one for the last 2 nights. The good news is that they didn't make me check in and out every time. The bad news was that you would assume, in 2009, that Hyatt's accounting system could manage 1 bill for all 4 nights, given that I stayed in the same room the whole time. 2.) The Starbucks in the lobby. It was a fine Starbucks, but it closed at 3 in the afternoon. It's run by the hotel, and I guess they didn't have the staff or didn't want the competition for the hotel restaurant. Don't know. But, as a Starbucks fan, I was annoyed to find it closed by mid-afternoon. It did open at 6 a.m. though.

Reviews.Title: “Who needs this place?”
Reviews.Author: AeroTex
Reviews.Content: A bad location - unless you have business with FOX Studios. Expensive, nothing notweorthy. Basically, an over-priced gaudy hotel that should probably be moved to Las Vegas or some city where gaudiness, and tastelessness are the accepted standards. Ridiculous valets thet make it difficult to get in and out, expensive add-on parking costs, and a staff tha does not seem to have been very well trained (most of them have limited English skills -- but are probably great for Latina American, southern Asian, or African guests).

Reviews.Title: “Lured me in with competitive price and then discovered many incidental costs”
Reviews.Author: chmsully
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nicely decorated rooms and the rooms are rather spacious as hotel rooms go, but since there were no amenities included in the price, I would rather go to other hotels for the same price and get more amenities with friendlier service. The extra charges to stay here include: $33 parking charge, $20 per visit charge for the gym, hourly cost for internet access in the rooms, $23 per person breakfast and no coffee in the room. I would not stay here again. The service was professional but not warm. The pool looked beautiful but I didn't get a chance to use it. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: mciordan
Reviews.Content: We were in town for one night only- I knew that location wasn't what I wanted ( unless a mall is what you're looking for) and I was OK with that, but. we travel with 2 small kids, so I called the hotel the day before asking for connecting rooms. When we got to the hotel, we were told that it would be 45 minutes if we must have the connecting rooms. After 2 hours !! and 3 trips to the front desk ( they refused to take my cell no and call me when the rooms would be available) I was told that the rooms were still not ready, so they would give me other2 connecting ones. ( I have to wonder why was I not offered the other rooms from the beginning?!) Rooms are nicely appointed, but if you want a coffee maker in your room, you'd have to ask for one.WE stayed by the pool while waiting for the rooms and ordered from that menu- the food was good ( Cobb salad was $20, a beer-$9) Major drama unfolded at check out- when I called to ask if there were any charges on the second room since I only got a folio for one room- I was put on hold 6! times, told to go to the reception area, put on hold again. Eventually someone picked up and yelled at me that they were trying to call me while I was on hold and why didn't I pick up...( I was on hold ...right)..all and more for one question- on a Sunday morning when there was no traffic at the reception. This is not a 4 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacationPlanner
Reviews.Content: We decided to give this hotel a try because the good discounted rate we were able to secure. It was significantly lower than the nearby Hilton property on Wilshire, where we had stayed on several occasions. My wife and I were both pleased with our choice. The lobby area is attractive with a large seating area to sit and relax. It was also where numerous business people gathered for one on one discussions or small, casual group meetings. There is a bar there and also a well used Starbucks off to the side. The X-Bar, just off the lobby area is a popular after work gathering place for drinks and appetizers. Our room was average size, but comfortable with a view of Century City and over to Beverly Hills. The flat screen tv and ipod dock were nice amenities. Service from the parking valets, bellmen, front desk and housekeeping was professional and courteous. We found the concierge service to be exceptional at this property. They were knowledgeable and helpful, providing computer printed driving instructions to a number of destinations we needed to go to. They also gave us several alternate suggestions for us to consider to the shops and restaurants we intended to visit. I appreciated the extra time they took to answer our questions. The hotels location is ideal, just off Santa Monica Boulevard, close to the 405, Westwood, Beverly Hills and the Century City Shopping Center just across the street. We saw many business people there, I'm assuming due to the nearby Fox Studios, but it was also fine for our leisure visit as we were out most of the day and also in the evenings. I would not hesitate to stay again while in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Food”
Reviews.Author: ironhase
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times. I also have stayed at the Intercontinental down the street many times. In comparison, both have very nice rooms, and are fine for business travel, although the suites at the Intercon are a much better value, cleaner, and nicer. The Plaza has a better location, as it is 2 blocks closer to the Century Plaza and mall, but the difference is minimal. Overall, however, the Intercontinental has far better service, much better food, and is a better overall value. The employees at the plaza are nice enough, but seem to be just doing their jobs and no oen goes out of his or her way to be friendly or helpful. The Intercon employees, on the other hand, seem to love their jobs and go out of their way to be nice. Many times I have had them go well beyond the call of duty, while at the Plaza, they will do the minimum, but nothing more. Further, the cost of everything is alot higher at the Plaza, for no real added benefit. Food, though is the real issues. The Intercon has a changing interesting menu, good wines, and a unique cocktail list, while the signature rest. at the Plaza is really terrible, and does not even bother to have a drink list (the lounge is adequate and there is a decent but way overpriced bar --12 per cocktail minimum) I actually have no idea, but if I had to guess, I would bet money the Intercon is non-union and the Plaza is a union property, based only on the drasticaly better service at the Intercon. Again, either one is fine, but if you plan to eat in and want a better vale, I would go with the Intecon (and the suites are a real bargain).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service.... Didn't Want to Leave”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Century Plaza. Didn't want to leave. Great breakfast in the concierge room..... definitely recommend upgrading given the breakfast and evening food (save on cost of dinner and breakfast). Was there on a Friday/Saturday and property was very quiet (not sure if weekend effect or recession). Definitely recommend and even prefer over the Beverly Hilton except for location.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: StaceyP
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel; beautiful room and excellent service. The concierge (Greg) was so helpful recommending places to go - just made the experience amazing. Loved everything about this hotel - from housekeeping to added amenities, lobby and service attitude. Definitely stay here! Very luxurious and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: TribeDT
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here at least 10 times over the past 5 years and every experience has been great. It's an overall classy place, but not over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tommypain
Reviews.Content: A top notch hotel. Very fancy. Great room with an excellent bed, nice flat screen TV, extravagant bathroom. Well appointed dÃ©cor in the lobby, hallways and rooms. Only complaint was the Internet. In the guestroom information book, it described how to hook up and gain access, but no mention of price (which implied it was free). The LAN could not be accessed by the cable, so had to choose the wireless router (not secured). $9.95 per day. Not expensive, but felt like a gotcha.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel........A Few Small Complaints”
Reviews.Author: lakid9728
Reviews.Content: This is an upscale, mostly excellent hotel in Century City. The restaurant is fantastic, the rooms are quiet, the service is good. My main complaint is this - this hotel sort of nickel and dimes you. Parking: $33 a day. Internet: $24.95 for three days. That is pretty bad, considering you're spending premium money to stay here already. Also, I had to request a coffeemaker, and when I did, it was not refilled unless I requested again......which involves a visit from housekeeping....which involves more tipping.....valet, maids, room service, it really adds up. My minor complaint is that Hyatt sets the TVs in the lobby to Fox News. Which is not a legitimate news network. But you change the channel. No big deal. The view from my room was unbelievable. One of the best I've seen in LA. You're not super close to everything, but you can walk to Beverly Hills. You'll definitely want a car if you're here to explore LA (I live here already). Overall, this is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: hoops7k
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a wedding on the avenue of the stars side of the hotel. Check in was easy as I used the self serve kiosk. The rooms were nice with new furniture and good tv's. I didn't use any of the services of the hotel except the valet which was very expensive as noted by other reviewers. If there are alot of cars it can take up to 20 mins to get your car even if you call down before coming down. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential; not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxwhile
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked our room on Priceline and were initially excited about staying in a 4 star hotel in LA. When we arrived, it had the skeleton of a 4 star, but service and amenities were absolutely...typical, as in Days Inn typical, Super 8 Hotel typical, without the in room amenities you'd find in an average roadside economy lodge! I'd feel bad for anyone that paid full price for the room, which I believe is somewhere around $400. There were no drinking glasses and when we called for some they delivered paper cups. Paper cups at the Hyatt? There was no coffee maker or coffee. There was no microwave. There was no refrigerator. That said, they spared no cost in installing an intricate mini-bar with extremely expensive M&Ms that were attached to a sensor device so that when moved your room was automatically charged. Parking was astonishingly expensive, as in downtown San Francisco or Boston or New York City expensive. Don't get me wrong: LA's cool and all, I get it, but where we were in LA does not call for $24 self-parking. For that price, I'd better be looking at the Golden Gate Bridge outside my window, not a construction site and an algae infested water fountain adjacent to track housing. So, let's break it down: no drinking glasses, no microwave, no refrigerator, $24 self parking and $8 M&Ms. We felt rather nickle and dimed, and that isn't a good feeling to take away from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt, stylish and functional”
Reviews.Author: vlad_dc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long day at the Hyatt, and really loved it. I primarily chose it because of its location (across the street from where I was going), but from the second I pulled up to the entrance I was impressed with the service, style and functionality of the hotel. Staff was efficient and friendly in an understated sort of way. They generally left you alone (I think they primarily cater to people there on business), but were always friendly and provided useful advice. Yes, valet is $33 a day (there is self-park a 2 minute walk away for $20 each time you go in or out), but that is pretty typical for this kind of a location. The valet guys were helpful with local area advice, and they got my car super fast. I stayed in a Regency Club room and loved it. I actually don't know if the rooms are any different than "normal" rooms, but you get access to the Regency Club in the lobby that has free breakfast in the morning, drinks throughout the day, and appetizers in the evening. It also has free Wi-Fi access and 2 computers with a printer - very handy. It's a very functional room, affording a surprising amount of privacy for business conversations. I LOVED the room. I was on the 18th floor - not sure if this is a special Regency floor or not, but it was great. Very wide and stylishly appointed hallway that slightly curves so it feels smaller and more personable. I had an even numbered room, and those look out west towards the ocean and the sunset. Checked in around 3pm as the sun was starting to set, and the whole room was just washed in glorious sunlight. Great views towards the pool area and then all the way to Santa Monica. Had no trouble seeing Catalina, even though it wasn't a particularly clear day. Very expansive view. Loved the balcony, which they call the lanai. It is very large and has a carpet, feels very cozy. Room is huge, tons of space, everything very functional and fresh looking. Nice big plasma TV (which I didn't even turn on). Big, luxurious and modern bathroom. Only two complaints about the room are that (1) the water pressure in the sink (but not the shower) was very low, and (2) the mp3 attachment for the clock radio was crappy and there was interference when I tried to play my Zune. Very convenient location - there is a fancy open air mall a 5 minute walk away that has a ton of dining options, from food court to very fancy. UCLA, Beverly Hills, Hollywood - all are only minutes away. The pool area looked fabulous. I only got to relax out there for a little bit. It had that old-Europe beach club feel to it. Pool was seriously heated - I was there Dec 22 and people were swimming in it at 9pm. Also has a nice big outdoor Jacuzzi. Overall, I really loved everything about the hotel and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings are unavoidable. Many ups but many downs”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: Booked at a decent price through priceline, the hotel is not bad in itself but - even though it HAS the POTENTIAL to be a decent 4* hotel, I don't think it reaches that level. First of all, the parking. It's amazingly bad that they wanna charge you 31 USD per night for the valet service. And that the self parking costs 20 USD per day but without in/out service. Ok, this seems to be a pretty standard fare at luxury hotels throughout the US, but still...! Then, the room: mine was very nice, newly redecorated. Bathroom was ample and quite nice. I liked the plasma tv (42"), but I find a bit strange that such a pricey place in a fancy city like LA doesn't provide you with complimentary slippers or bathrobes or coffee machine! Guys, come on! Internet is fast yet expensive in room (even though it's free in the lobby area). I liked the nice lanai. The swimming pool are looked ok. Again, I don't believe you have to pay 20 USD/day to access the Equinox fitness center! I didn't try the food, nor the room service; while the food and the main restaurant looked very nice, the prices were on the VERY STEEP side! Not even the Ritz-Carlton Dubai was so expensive! Location wise, it worked well for me: being in LA to visit UCLA it was a short drive from campus, and Beverly Hills is really minutes away (you can actually walk). Yet, all in all, I feel like a 4* hotel must offer more when it comes to complimentary items. If the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza will implement that policy, it will surely ranks as a 4* hotel. Otherwise, it will remain a big question mark in the LA luxury hotel panorama.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal but grows on you”
Reviews.Author: st8sman
Reviews.Content: A functional hotel for the business community, it can easily make the tourist who is not dressed for the office or in a noisy group feel they are not in the right place. It seemed that any small talk by the reception staff would be a dismissible offence and even after five days there was no sign of our being recognised. This approach however may be preferred by others, the hotel being sited between the MGM tower and Fox studios. A report of a dud bulb in the bathroom was dealt with promptly and when we brought a bottle of wine into the room, glasses appeared without request. Once we persuaded the concierge that we really did not want to hire a car and pay the exorbitant hotel parking fees he was very helpful in showing us how to walk to Rodeo Drive (10-15minutes away) where you can get a 45 minute tour of the stars homes on a tram for a fraction of the cost of the coach tours that collect you from the hotel. Outside the hotel are regular buses to Santa Monica (cost 75cents), the Farmers Market ($1.25), and Hollywood ($1.25). The bus guide tells you to catch two buses to Hollywood but if you are willing to take a ten minute walk at the Hollywood end you save time and money. The garden; outside swimming pool and Jacuzzi are all one would expect of a good hotel but they need to sort out their catering facilities with e.g. the coffee shop run by Starbucks closing at 3.00pm. It feels like the management is dominated by accountants, but for all its faults, what the hotel did provide, was provided very well. By mixing what the hotel did well with the food hall And supermarket at Century Plaza shopping centre on the other side of the road our satisfaction with the hotel grew through our stay. St8sman Essex

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel, but Unfriendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8008
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, after seeing the rooms and amenities on the website. There are good and bad with the hotel. The Good: - Stylish hotel. Modern decor and clean rooms. We were on the Regency Club floor and had a beautiful view of Los Angeles. It got noisy though, with the large buses that park outside of the hotel. - Drinks in the Lobby bar were good. The dessert was mediocre, but the service was good. - Fitness center is well equipped with plenty of cardio machines. If you are a Diamon member, it's free. Otherwise, it's a pricey $20/day. - Lobby is bustling and busy. Active area. - Westfield Mall is 2 blocks away - incredibly convenient. The Bad: - Service, Service, and more Service. The front desk reception was rude and cold. We asked for other options outside of the Regency Club, and they said there were none. We went to the Concierge and asked for other options, and they said there's no other options -- even though the sign outside of the Regency Club specifically says to "see Concierge for other options." (This was Thanksgiving Day, and the Club was closed.) We asked the hostess at Breeze Restaurant if we can just have dessert, and her immediate answer was "No." She just looked at us, and didn't offer any other option. All in all, it was a rude reception. - The Hyatt charged us for drinks and food that were delivered to our room, even though it was free for Diamond Club Members. We had to go to the front desk to remove the charges. - No car parking. There is valet, but they charge $31/day. (We parked next door, which is $20/day.) The next day, the staff was much friendlier. However, we've already had a foul experience. I recommend the hotel for location and decor, but not for service.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: alexandriava
Reviews.Content: great redo of rooms and lovely pool area. We parked at mall across the street and worked out fine. Great mall with great restaurants. Nice location to in LA. no complaints but there is construction next door, which could get noisy in certain rooms I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: andrew23
Reviews.Content: A large business hotel in the heart of Century City, right next to the Westfield mall with a good variety of shops and eateries. The lobby was impressive and large, and the hotel had a very cozy little alfresco dining area by the pool which was just the perfect setting for the beautiful Californian weather. Guest rooms were newly renovated not too long ago hence furnishings were pretty much brand new. The beds however, were not the most comfortable â€“ they donâ€™t feel like the Hyattâ€™s Grand Bed at all! The soundproofing at this hotel is rather poor â€“ you can hear the traffic from the roads outside, people walking above you, carts rolling on the guest floor corridors, and there was also a very loud concert at the Pavilion while I was there too. The corridors leading to the guest rooms were very long and Iâ€™d say it was a little too dark for my liking. Finally, service was top notch at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: travisdog
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and couldnt wait to get back here on my recent LA vacation. The location is perfect bring handy for the beach and beverly hills and right next door to the Century Mall which has great stores and a movie theatre which we visited, also has lots fo eating places. The hotel was refurbished recently and they made a great job, the rooms are airy and spotless clean and the beds are too comfy you dont want to leave them. One of my favourite things about this hotel is the balcony and the distant view of the Hollywood sign and downtown LA we got from here. The front desk staff are great and always very helpful plus the lobby always seems to be a hive of activity which is a sign of a great hotel there was always something going on there, I also loved the gym which does require a daily fee as its not owned by the Hyatt however its got a provate entrance by the pool and was never too crowded so you could get a good workout done no problem/ Didnt eat on the hotel as we ate out however breeze looked nice for a bite to eat. All in all i love this property and cane wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hyatt standard”
Reviews.Author: Casualist
Reviews.Content: Having originally booked for the Riot Hyatt in West Hollywood, we were disappointed to find that renovation work to this hotel meant we were moved to the Century City Plaza. Certainly we couldn't find it on any of our maps, Century City is just west of Beverly Mills and pretty much in the middle of nowhere with regards to the local sights, although the Century City shopping centre is right next door. I'll admit to having low expectations for this hotel, but in actual fact its location just off the freeway (Santa Monica boulevard) and the main route into Beverly Hills/Hollywood from the West meant it was a dream location for touring LA by car. A taxi ride to the Strip on Sunset Boulevard took less than 10 minutes. The hotel almost looked Soviet era with its giant concrete facade and supersize, but the interior was tastefully done and the rooms were up to a high standard of modern decor, even better, every one appeared to have a balcony. The bar had a funky cool atmosphere with a nice mixture of business travellers, tourists and even the odd clubber. Again the usual Hyatt service was provided and although this might not look at first to be a good base for touring LA, it certainly delivers. My only minor grumble is the price, perhaps a little high, then again this is LA I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Car Park feel and soul”
Reviews.Author: brick_one
Reviews.Content: My stay was as part of the hotel's reward scheme, so I've stayed in many of their hotels throughout the US and world. Whilst the rooms & facilties of this hotel look standard the reality is somewhat different. Much has been outsourced and is not integrated well for guests and is 'user-pay'. The fitness centre and spa, widely advertised by Hyatt, both in their hotel description and Concierge email service, is a completely seperate business and hotel guests are treated no differently from the general public. In fact you can't even transit the facility, the easiest way to the nearby mall and hotel grounds, as the spa staff actively 'police' the entrance and send you round the street. This is false advertising by Hyatt and they should be held to task. The gym which is good is a $15 charge per visit - $30 a day for our room. I consider that expensive. The pool has the landscaping of the local carpark, inadequate & poor pool service and again the cafe, which serves the best range of juices and food, is a seperate business and only takes cash , not charge. None of this is clearly explained and you are left to 'stumble' around finding things out for your self. Request for extra towels went unanswered 3 times, taking a trip to the ever-helpful front desk staff to resolve the issue. Worth pointing out that the service here is exemplary. Car parking is $27 per day, again amongst the total additional charges, adding to the daily bill as a car is a necessity for this location. No in-room coffee/tea means that the 'in-house' Starbucks is an additional charge. This is an expensive hotel, with poor service requiring many additional charges for the average stay - wouldn't stay here again as there are many options more worthy in the local area.

Reviews.Title: “More dodgy mini bar charges”
Reviews.Author: melbourne23
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were nice at check-in. The room was comfortable and quiet with a decent view. Concierge was attentive and helpful. Housekeeping Dept. was poor, with no respect for privacy and mini bar items disappearing. This is unacceptable for a higher caliber hotel like the Hyatt. When I reported the incorrect charges to the front desk I was advised my account would be corrected, however when I subsiquently checked my credit card I was disappointed to see the charges were still there. I then took the time to write to Hyatt guest relations in mid Sept and am still awaiting a response nearly 1 month later. Disappointing how such a small thing can leave a sour taste!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JB&CT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the final 3 nights of our round the world honeymoon. We were both a little aprehensive about our stay in LA. We need not have been! It turned out to be a fantastic hotel. The beds were by far the best that i have ever slept in! If you're staying at the Hyatt Century City you need a car! infact if you want explore LA properly you'll need a car, even if you're right in Hollywood. At least if you're staying in Century City you are midway between most places!
