Valet parking was $30 per entry which maybe a little steep but it was very efficient and we normally went out for the whole day so we only paid once per day. All in all an excellant stay and a great end to our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE: Houskeeping Staff Stole $30 from mini-bar and charged it my account!”
Reviews.Author: ReasonableReview
Reviews.Content: Reception staff was nice at check-in. The room was comfortable and quiet with a decent view. Room service was just fine. Housekeeping Dept. is another story. My company does not pay for tips. And since I don't think it's nice to make people do the work and not give them anything for it, I put the privacy sign up to let them know I didn't need my bed made, towels replaced. Because I didn't leave a tip, the housekeeping staff racked up almost $30 worth of mini-bar charges to my room as retribution. This is despicable for a higher caliber hotel like the Hyatt. Such employees should not be tolerated. Of course I reported this to the manager and suggested such staff be fired.

Reviews.Title: “The More You Spend, The Less You Get...”
Reviews.Author: MikeALarson
Reviews.Content: I have found my aforementioned title, "The More You Spend, The Less You Get" to be painfully true in my last week of travels. We stayed here on Thursday, September 4th. The hotel is very impressive. The lobby is beautiful, and the rooms are awesome (We stayed on the 18th floor). It is the little things that peeved me. Internet cost ya, no coffee make in your room, no business center, room service is highway robbery, in room items are highway robbery, and valet is a joke. People pay all this money to stay here and yet the most basic creature comforts are not included or cost a ridiculous price. I needed to use a computer with a printer to print Dodger tickets... I was sent down to the business center (After paying $10 bucks for internet in my room) and was charged $7 for using their internet for about 40 seconds, and printing three pages (my tickets). No one thought it would be nice to help a customer out. The concierge blew me off when I asked, and the front desk had no idea. If there is a lesson to be learned it is this. If you want to pay a lot of money to stay at a "cool" hotel that is fine. But don't expect nearly the same service, amenities you will get at a Holiday Inn or Comfort Inn. Sad this is the case, but hands down the smaller guy on the block offers a lot more for the buck then the big dog. For me and my girlfriend it is a lesson learned. Hope this guides you in the right direction. -Mike

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, ripoff extras”
Reviews.Author: mikester92117
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel - there is no question about that. The elevators are very fast and rooms are comfortable. The lobby is nice and it's cool having a real Starbucks right in the hotel, though I though it odd that it was not open when we checked in at 4:00 p.m. However, I have to warn you that the Hyatt (and similar hotels) have designed ways to get as much money out of you from the moment you check in until the moment you leave. As others have mentioned, valet parking is $31. When you drive in, the sign says valet and "grayed out" are the words self park. In other words, they have removed that option from the front of the hotel. You can drive around the block and find the garage and park there at $10 a day but you will pay $10 each time you come and go (the hourly rate reverts to a daily rate after two hours). Anyway, the process is by design to get you to valet park and pay $31 (+ tips). Next, there is a hi-tech mini bar in the room but there are no prices on the snacks. If you pick up a bag of potato chips looking for the price, you might be charged for them because the minibar detects removal of an item and automatically bills your room for it. It says that on the glass door, but you might not notice that (as we didn't). I didn't get internet access, though I normally do. However, I'm sure they charge it. I wish organizations such as the Hyatt looked at their customers as customers rather than simply revenue sources. You can have such a wonderful stay in such a wonderful hotel but what sticks in your craw are the various scenarios where the hotel is seeking to take more of your money at outrageous rates compared to the rendered service.

Reviews.Title: “Bad attitude; I would not go here again.”
Reviews.Author: VisitortoLAfromChina
Reviews.Content: I have a really sour view of this hotel. We planned ONE YEAR in advance for a wedding. Here were the problems: - Repeatedly lost and mixed up reservations, up to the day of the event; - Were promised one year in advance "pool view" rooms for several of the wedding party. On check in, "sorry, they have been booked"; - A gouging attitude everywhere you go. Overnight parking $31 per night. Each visit to the gym $20. Note in room: "If you require a personal coffee maker, please touch 0." Nice touch is "require" - The people we'd dealt with over the past year were all "unavailble" on arrival, leaving to a "not my problem" / "sorry, I didn't do that" attitude. For the money......

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Buenzli
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, everything seems clean and new, rooms are spacious with carpeted terrace, only downside is the expensive valet parking ($ 31), if you don't mind walking 5-7 minutes, there is a public parking on East Century (parallel to Ave of Stars) for $ 16 weekdays and $ 10 on weekends

Reviews.Title: “Cool Rooms, Great Pool, Fun Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: DCguy30
Reviews.Content: The building's exterior is nothing to marvel at, but the interior certainly is! This place rocks. The room was spacious and well decorated. The lighting in the bathroom was perfect. The pool was very cool, and if you want to stay somewhere that will let you have easy access to Santa Monica, Westwood, and Beverly Hills, this hotel is a great place to stay. I did not find the parking fee ($31 a night) to be completely unreasonable, but I went in and out several times during my stay. The walls could be thicker, but that's true of many hotels. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, especially at the rate of $115 a night I secured on priceline. Beware that the gym costs $20 a day if you want to use it. Seems like the nicer the property, the more you get nickeled and dimed, but such is life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: LiberatedMindFL
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for a family reunion - large rooms, contemporary decor & great service. Can't think of any misses during the stay. Starbucks on premesis was a nice option for a quick & inexpensive breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: ttrinchi82
Reviews.Content: We booked the room in January 2008 for a stay in July 08. There are four of us. We booked a room with two double beds. We get there and everyone on line to check in was mad. The hotel staff kept apologizing to people. I knew I was in for something. They apparently booked all of the double bed rooms for some cheerleading competition that was going on at their hotel. Because they have a contract with them, they had to bump everyone even though we booked it in January. They told me they could give us a room with one king size bed and send up a cot. We are four adults! Three of us had to squeeze on one bed?? Not going to happen. So one of us slept on the cot, another on a chair and ottoman. They couldn't give us another cot because it was a fire hazard. They also explained to me that the hotel does not guarantee a bed type, the only guarantee a room type. I never heard of that before. Then, when we got to the room and there were no towels at all! Luckily, I was nosey and opened up the doors to a cabinet in the middle of the hallway and saw a bunch of towels. so we took them from there. Then the thick curtain that keeps the sun out was missing! Luckily we were on the side of the building that the sun sets on. They ended up comping us that entire night but still, that was wrong. They only comped us for the night AFTER we called to complain about the curtain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: george1688
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights and everything was perfect. The valet was expensive at $31 per day but it was worth it. The fridge had refreshments and is electronically monitored so i can't put anything in it. The rates were reasonable. The location is brilliant, its a five minutes drive from Beverly Hills and really near to Westfield Century City mall. I'm definitely coming back to this hotel during my next vacation to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Disappoints This Time”
Reviews.Author: AllisonNNH
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Hyatt in the last year, and while I like the hotel , it disappointed me this time. It is extremely convenient to my firm's LA office which is why I've stayed there, but I think this time was the last. As has been mentioned before, the rooms are very nice: the finishes are high-end, with granite countertops and gorgeous flat screen TVs. The rooms have very nice balconies and no matter which way your room faces, it's nice to be able to sit outside. The beds are also very comfortable. However, all this is negated by bad housekeeping. My bathroom floor this time was covered in hair. Not just little stray hairs, but lots of long, black hair which was impossible to miss. I did not arrive until really late, so I just took a towel and wiped them up myself, which I immediately regretting doing. When I lifted the towel, it was clear that the floor had not been washed in a while. UGH. The next morning, as I was getting ready to take my shower, I looked for the first time at the towel rack in the tub area, and realized that both towels there were used. DOUBLE UGH. I called housekeeping and while they were up in a flash with clean towels, I was disgusted beyond belief. As I left for the day, I reported all of this to the front desk, and when I got back, there was a message from housekeeping apologizing - sort of. It said they were sorry *if* their housekeeping did not meet my standards. I am pretty sure this doesn't meet anyone's standards, and the "if" in the apology sounded hedgey to me. Anyway, I was leaving at 5 the next morning and did not have the time or inclination to pursue it further. Unfortunately, the worst was yet to come, when at 4:30 that next morning I tried to take a shower only to find that there was no hot water. I got a tepid shower, but my colleague could not even get tepid water on her floor. She reported it and the hotel accomodated her with a credit, but still - it was a lousy way to start a long travel day. In any case, the long and short of it is that I've had 2 nice stays at this hotel and 1 pretty bad one, so I am giving it an Average rating. Any hotel can be "off" on occasion, but the cleanliness issue probably pushes me to try the Intercontintal up the street next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: JN2323
Reviews.Content: The room was just absolutely breathtaking. We had a poolside view on the 10th floor that enabled a wonderful scope of LA, as well as, the sunset (not to be confused with Sunset Blvd.). The bed was amazingly comfortable. The flat screen TV and granite countertops on all the surfaces gave the room quite a luxurious feel. Our room did not include a bathrobe, coffeepot, or glassware. I think it's weird that the more you pay, the less amenities you get. I guess they make up for it in the furniture and environment. I do prefer a non-odorous, luxurious room without coffee over a malodorous room with hair on the bathroom countertops with a coffeepot that you would prefer to keep away from anyhow.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: crystalswa
Reviews.Content: Even though we only stayed one night out of our 9 day trip to California, I would say it was one of the more beautifully decorated ones. We wish we would have stayed here longer. The hotel lobby is breathtaking with the rich warm colors. There were many chairs, couches and places to hang out. My husband used the wireless internet here, while the kids and I "chilled" and watched on of the tv's. Our check in was great, we were able to check in at noon, when check in is normally 3pm! The parking is a pain, but what are you going to do, it's LA. We paid the $31 with in and out privilages. The valet service is very fast and friendly. The pool area is amazing. There is a covered lounge area with a bar. They have a fireplace they lite a night. The pool was an infinity edge pool, and the hot tub was large enough to fit 12. The tanning pools were really cool! They provide towels by the pool and it was open until 10pm, but we were there longer the night we stayed and no one told us to leave. Our room was on the 15th floor and faced the street with an office building and fountain across the street. This view was fine for us, the kids just liked sitting out on the balcony. The beds were very confortable, not too soft, like most hotels lately. The room was decorated very nicely and was confortable. We did not eat at the hotel after reading all the other review about how pricey it was. This hotel was very easy to get to from LAX and convenient enough to all the touristy things to do in LA. Overall, our stay was a pleasant one and we would most certainly stay again if in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: GailofIowa
Reviews.Content: Have you ever noticed, the higher the star ranking, the fewer the included services. This hotel is no exception. Parking is extra. Internet is extra. There are no coffee pots in the rooms. I'll give you a little secret---you can call and ask for one. It will come with 2 coffee pods and then you can buy more. For my $1000 3 night bill, I expect free coffee. I did not see a hair dryer in my room. Perhaps that is another appliance upon request. My room had a nice balcony and view overlooking the pool. The staff was helpful and pleasant. The mall is across the street and Rodeo drive appeared to be within walking distance on the map. Otherwise you will be driving to other destinations. All in all, not great, but not bad. I really prefer more value for my $$$$$.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt was great with some limitations”
Reviews.Author: tripper1988
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Perfect location. Rooms recently updated with flat screen TV's and furnishings. Wired and wireless Internet for $9.95 a day. Must go to the Equinox behind the hotel for $20/day to work out. Valet parking was $31/day or a long walk to self park.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjlee32
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location- close to Beverly Hills, UCLA, Santa Monica, etc. Self parking is a little far but $20 compared to $31 valet. Although, there are no in and out privileges. The outside of the hotel is not that spectacular but the rooms and hallways are almost comparable to a Grand Hyatt. Very nice and very clean. Each room has a balcony too. The ONLY downside was that I asked the front desk for a remote control (missing from the room) and never got one until I had to call again and the same happened when I asked for a toothbrush. Besides that, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking disaster”
Reviews.Author: Billy1115
Reviews.Content: Room are great clean well appointed renovated. Valet parking is great for $31.00 a day. Let me be clear I don't mind the charge. Some people are so shocked that hotels charge for parking. The valet attendants are lazy. Let me explain how it works. You call down x 2500 for your car. The valets get the car We never had an issue with getting our car. The probem occurs when you drop it off. The Valets never come over to your car they make you get out in the middle of the driveway. They never seem to move the car. The other cars try to squeeze by . This causes traffic jams for other guests as there are 750 room. I can't prove but there ws a slight dent on the driver door of my rental. Luckily I had the rental ins otherwise they would have charged my cc until i contacted my insurance at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mstreds
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent and the rooms luxurious. It is a quick walk (yes walk) to the Century City mall and about a 15 min drive to UCLA, WeHo and Beverly Hills. It was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - you should stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Lola_travel_girl
Reviews.Content: You may wonder why you should stay in Century City. Firstly, it's a minute or two, literally, from Beverly Hills and it is convenient to Hollywood and Santa Monica. Secondly, it is a two minute walk (yes, I said walk, although you never walk when in LA) from a wonderful shopping mall. Finally, Century City provides you the luxury of Beverly Hills, the safety you need and proximity to major freeways. The rooms are beautiful and spacious â€“ huge closets, deluxe bathrooms, really comfortable beds, state of the art technology. The staff jump to please you. Their answer is always "yes, immediately". The gym and outdoor pool are excellent. I got this hotel on Priceline twice. I was thrilled to return to this magnificent place. You wonâ€™t be disappointed. Unless you want to pay $500 or more for a swanky Beverly Hills hotel, you should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: ma65
Reviews.Content: First of all, unless you need to be in Century city, there is no reason to stay here. Far from everything, hardly any place of interest within walking distance. Check in went well. When we got to the room, there was a coffee maker on the floor right outside the door. The rooms do not have coffee makers, but you can ask for one. This one was however used, and the staff had forgotten to take it. Well into the room I found that the beds were double, not queens, and that does make a dfference (of 6 inches, to be exact!) when travelling with a husband and two children. The minibar has sensors that charge for every movement of its contents, so you can not use it to keep milk or yogurt for the children, for instance. Went down to the pool to find it in need of renovation (and cleaning!). The pool is not very large, considering the size of the hotel. There are some wading pools, but they were constantly used by ducks!! Good thing my children are past that age! The food at the restaurant was good, but somewhat overpriced. The coffee maker found outside the door when we arrived was still there 24 hours later! Called housekeeping and asked them to remove it, which took an extra couple of hours... Service was in general rather poor.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dbasha
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights at this hotel recently. It was one of the worst experiences I have had. The hotel is, at best, a 4 star hotel, although its prices suggest otherwise. Check-in (at 11.30am) was very slow, with only 2 personnel despite a queue of 10 people. I was then given a very small room. When I called the front desk to ask why, I was put on hold for 25 minutes. I was then told that there were in fact much larger rooms available, and I was moved to one of these rooms. I was not however told that the larger rooms were very warm as the air-conditioning units were small and old (I was helpfully told this by the engineering personnel later). It took 3 complaints for engineering to finally come and let me know that they could not do anything. Having already settled in by then, and with numerous meetings to attend, I reluctantly opted to stay in the room. Service throughout the hotel was uniformally slow, and it was clear that the hotel is under-staffed. At the outdoor areas of the lobby bar and the X-bar, it was not uncommon to wait 25 minutes before getting served; this is unacceptable by any standards. Breakfast was also mediocre and was certainly not commensurate with the prices charged. The door personnel generally tended to ignore people waiting for taxis unless it was brought to their attention that taxis were required. Most suprisingly, considering that this hotel is predominantly a business hotel, the business centre (which was basically a small shop offering limited facilities rather than a proper business centre) was only open limited hours on weekdays, half a day on Saturday and closed on Sunday. On the last day, I checked out at 12pm as required. Since my flight was only at midninght, I asked wheher it would be possible to have shower facilities provided before I left later in the evening (which is a common practice at good business hotels in various countries), but unsurprisingly I was told that they could not offer these facilities. I think that the hotel is a rip-off, and is definitely inadequate for the needs of business travellers. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: suitcasegurl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza for a week this past February. The lobby and main areas are very clean and well kept. We initially had a room on a lower floor but requested, and were promptly moved, to an upper floor facing the pool. I would not recommend the "street" side, as this faces a somewhat noisy main road with a view of the office building across the street. The room itself was a decent size and well maintained. The bath products were above average. The shower was fine, nothing special or bad. The staff at this hotel was very nice and helpful. The pool and hot tub area was very nice, and there were always plenty of clean towels on hand. The reflecting pools were cool, especially if you are into tanning. The location of this hotel is well situated for getting around L.A. You would definitely need a car, but I think this would be true for anywhere in this city. There is a decent shopping mall with a good grocery store on the lower level two blocks away. This is a good place to buy water and things that are priced much much higher at the hotel "convenience" store (which seemed to be closed fairly often anyhow). All in all, a fine, but not extraordinary, place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TJ-USA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Century Plaza on a weekend. We booked through Priceline and got a good rate. Hotel was really nice and clean and relatively close to local amenities. You are on the edge of Beverly Hills and not more than 20-30 minutes to most Hollywood/LA attractions. Don't know that I would pay the regular rate for this hotel which is about $300+ per night. We paid about 1/2 the regular rate on Priceline so it was worth it for that money. The bed was comfortable with a balcony, flat panel TV and was well appointed with nice finishes in the bath. Beautiful lobby and from what I understand, celebs occasionally meet there for business. Unfortunately, it was a little cool outside so we did not have occasion to utilize the pool or outdoor amenities. Valet parking is a little pricey at $30 per day but is convenient. They bring the car in and out and you just get out at the front. We stayed there on a weeked. Century City is a little bit of a business district so on the weekends its kind of a ghost town. However, there is a large mall right next door for shopping, eating, etc, which is open on the weekends. When we left on Monday morning, there was quite a bit of activity as business resumed. All in all, a good experience and for a discounted rate, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pamper With Paper”
Reviews.Author: guyinca
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the weekend of March 21/22. They now have automated check-in at a kiosk, which I found quite impersonal and unwelcoming. Our room was fine, yet they use paper cups in the baths and no other glasses are available in the room. On our second day, the maid threw away our papercups and did not replace them. Maybe she was mad because we had to call at 5pm since our room had not yet been cleaned. The towels are not the kind you would expect with this level of a hotel. No thick, plush stuff here, just serviceable K-Mart towels. We wanted to use the pool on Saturday, but all seats were filled. There was no shade anyway, so it wouldn't have mattered. Saturday night we had to wait a good 20 minutes for the valet line as they seemed quite understaffed. Valet parking is now $31 a night and self-parking is so inconvenient as not to be a choice. It's still a nice hotel, the rooms well-furnished except for the cups and towels. We did see a bill left by someone who had just checked out...they paid more than $25 a night than we did, so all is not bad!

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: ar233
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in March in a Concierge room, view at the front of the hotel with Hollywood in one direction and Beverly Hills greenery in the other. Unspectacular and very crowded pool (with ducks in the smaller pool!) which was perfectly adequate for a couple of hours of sunshine but would not have kept me entertained for a week. However they were hosting a huge wedding on the first day, and then closed the pool for a film crew on the second day. This didnt matter to us as we were going to Universal, and they did make arrangements for guests to use a nearby hotel. Actually we quite liked coming downstairs on our first morning and finding a film set! Concierge facilities were good, with complimentary breakfast, snacks, internet etc. Rooms were lovely - very comfortable beds, nice furnishings, LCD TVs. Location about 10 mins drive from Rodeo Drive, 20-25 mins from Chinese Theatre. Note that the sushi restaurant, Breeze, doesn't do sushi on a Sunday, which caught us out. However, when we complained (as the regular menu was far from satisfactory - food was over seasoned and tepid) they refunded our meal. This was appreciated! Also, the general manager was absolutely charming and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: twsmithca
Reviews.Content: Valet Parking costs $30/day, Self Parking costs $20/day +long walk +stairs to the front desk Coffee maker and glasses are available only by request! All that is provided is tiny styrofoam. Rooms with double beds are tiny beds - not full or queen size

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ... but you'll pay $$$ for it”
Reviews.Author: Karch72
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is very nice and has all the amenities of a 4-star hotel ... although the price per night the seemed a little high for what you got ... I guess you're paying for location. I stayed at the Century Plaza for a business trip, so I didn't pay out of my pocket or else I couldn't afford it. The hotel is located in a business section of Century City. There is a Westfield Mall right next door that offers a variety of eating options and shopping. I chose to eat there rather than hopping in a cab and venturing out somewhere. Pros: Comfy beds, modern decor, fairly large room, patios are nice, Starbucks onsite, huge flat screen TVs. Cons: No free exercise facility (need to pay $20 per day to use Equinox next door), very expensive onsite restaurants, no free Wi-Fi, noisy AC in room, a bit of a ride from LAX

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel For Business”
Reviews.Author: danielleflorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business - attended a conference held at the hotel. The ballroom/converntion area of the hotel is pretty big and they seemed to service it well. Hotel was overbooked so I got upgraded to a suite on the top floor - level called Penthouse. Great, great views of the city and mountains in the distance. Room was nice but nothing extraordinary. Very roomy, alot of open space in the suite area and bedroom. I used the online concierge service to make special requests and received a confirmation letter of those requests being fulfilled when I checked in. Nice, large pool area - was closed off the day I was there for a private photshoot/commercial. Lobby is large and open with a starbucks, 2 bar areas and a restaurant. Had dinner in restaurant - food and service were good - but menu is limited. (have sushi bar too) Really nice outdoor area with firepit for drinks adjacent to pool - good for evening cocktails/appetizers. Overall, was fine for the purpose of a business trip but not sure if its an ideal location for a vacation with family/firends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Mid-Century Styled Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leclaire68
Reviews.Content: The Century Plaza Hotel in the Century City area of L.A. is a landmark hotel that has been home to some of Hollywood's glitz and glamour for decades. The hotel's sweeping arc design has set it apart from other hotels in the area and made it an easily recognizable icon for some time. This hotel has been the choice of presidents, stars, and general business travelers and tourists alike for quite some time. So booking at this property, one should understand that it was designed and built in the 60s. Rooms are of a typical size from that era ... not very big. The bathrooms, too, are on the smallish side when compared to today's hotels. It kind of irks me when I read reviews where people moan and groan about this ... as if this was a hotel that had been built to today's standards. In all, I found my room to be superb. It wasn't huge, but it did have a lounge chair, a desk/table with two chairs, and a king size bed. The bathroom is compact, but nicely updated and clean. The room's patio was carpeted with all-weather carpeting and had two patio chairs with seat cushions. A widescreen LCD TV was provided, as was an iPod docking station. The room's decor was quite nice. It hearkened back to the mid-century roots of this hotel without being kitschy or over-done. The room appeared to be well maintained and clean ... and my standards for cleanliness are high. The staff at the hotel are well-trained in taking care of their guests. Valets were prompt and courteous (and they didn't change my radio station or move my driver's seat, thankfully). The housekeeping staff was pleasant and efficient. The front desk staff were always friendly and professional ... making good eye contact and resolving issues. The issues we had were minor. We put some items of our own into the room's mini-bar fridge ... and then saw a placard stating that if you do so, your folio will be automatically charged for the items removed. I'm not quite sure how this high-tech fridge does that ... but it does ... and the charges did show up right away. We reported that to the front desk staff on our way to dinner that night and it was taken care of promptly and even with an apology (even though it was our mistake). I was disappointed that the room didn't have a DVD player, but I phoned the hotel's concierge service and asked if one could be provided. "Absolutely! We'll have it brought up right away." And it was ... within 5 minutes ... all hooked up and ready to use for our entire stay. That's service. You will read in other reviews about the location. Some will like it, others will say it isn't in the heart of anything. We enjoyed it and found the shopping and dining nearby to be just fine. There are a couple great choices in Century City ... this hotel definitely being one of them. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate in staying here again”
Reviews.Author: jodie102
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days late August /early September for our honeymoon. Researched the area for quite a while before booking it and im really glad that we chose this hotel. The room was fantastic, we had a view over the pool, the bed was comfy and the cleaners did a fantastic job. I loved the fact that there is a shopping center across the road which was great on a lunch time. It had Macys, bloomindales, victoria secrets and tiffanys to name a few. There is also a supermarket there which was ideal for buying magazines, water and snacks to have by the hotel pool. The pool area was nice and clean, although at the weekend they could have done with a few more sun chairs, on a week day there would only been a few people by the pool. I used the room phone once to call my mum and dad and tell them we had arrived ok and when we checked out i think they had charged us about thirty pounds for the pleaseure!! Thats the only gripe i have to be honest

Reviews.Title: “OK - Just Don't Eat in the Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ruchelaya
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights, and had 3 rooms for the 6 in our family. Here's the rundown: The good: 1. We're from Illinois and the Fighting Illini were staying there for the Rose Bowl. You can't beat that when you're travelling with teen boys! 2. The hotel has been redone, and it's really beautiful. The lobby, the grounds (were about to be finished when we were there), the rooms. 3. Beds are great. 4. Location is great if you want to be near Century City, or if you're driving all the time anyhow. 5. I forgot to pack a pair of pants the day we left, and they were terrific about finding them and holding them until we returned later that day. This should be a matter of course for all hotels, but still their professionalism should be mentioned. 6. The front desk help was generally very good. 7. Free wi fi in the lobby. The bad: 1. We foolishly had breakfast at the hotel, because we had a food and beverage credit as part of our rate. Service was beyond bad, and when we checked out about 1 hour later, they still hadn't charged the bill to our room. That took another hour of waiting, which made no sense at all. 2. One of the rooms was boiling hot (it faced the setting sun, and when we checked in the drapes were open). Another room was freezing. Eventually this got straightened out, but it's not pleasant to check into a room that's unbearably warm. 3. Location is lousy if you like to walk (other than to the mall or office buildings at Century City). 4. No free wifi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carla123
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency I would say is a 3.5 star hotel which is getting a little tired and this has also been recognised by Management as it is currently being revamped. The location: The hotel is located on Avenue of the Stars within 10 minute drive of Beverly Hills, West Hollywood and Santa Monica. It is also across the road from the Century Plaza mall owned by Westfield which had nice restaurants, foodcourt (upmarket), cinema, boutiques and department stores. The room: The rooms were old and tired, No coffee and tea making facilities were available. The ammenties were extremely limited and the bath was very low and old. The beds however were comfortable and the rooms were quiet. Good selection of TV channels. The food: The room service menu was very basic however the Starbucks in the hotel was a plus. Overall I would try somewhere else next time, not a bad experience I just think better can be found for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel/location but needs some improvement”
Reviews.Author: SKYtrip
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now a Hyatt Regency although it's unlike most impeccable Hyatts. The hotel location is great as it is minutes from Beverly Hills and across the street from the Century City Shopping Center. The rooms have LCD TVs , the bed is comfortable and for the most part clean (sheets need to replaced, some are worn out). I had a room facing the back of the hotel with a view of the (very, very distant) ocean. I didn't rate this a 4 Star because the front desk staff is not very knowledgeable (didn't even know how to print out a folio!) and when you ask them for anything they just didn't know or had to always ask someone else for the answer. The Club room's continental breakfast is a joke (muffins and juice) so I wouldn't pay extra to include that in the stay and the staff is not very good about replinishing the food/drinks/plates/napkins. Often times I would go in the room to find only muffin crumbs and no plates. The bellmen and valet staff however were very efficient and consistent in providing good service. I think if they train the front staff and revamped the Club room the hotel would get higher marks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight in LA”
Reviews.Author: ChiTown2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in LA at the beginning of our trans-California roadtrip, arriving on Christmas Day. Front desk staff was friendly and courteous even though the hotel was clearly quite crowded. We were given a very stylish room with seemingly new furniture bedding. The concierge was efficient and knowledgable. Self parking at US$20 or valet at US$30 was expensive, but seems to be the norm for the LA area. Hotel breakfast in the morning (incl. free with the AAA rate) was delicious, and again the staff was very friendly. Highly recommended and surprisingly reasonable room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but big problem with outside noise”
Reviews.Author: Gyldenhorst
Reviews.Content: This would have been a "terrible" rating if not for the wonderful service. I travel frequently for businesses and typically stay in 4-star hotels. I am very reluctant to complain and have never asked to change rooms or anything like that before. I read the first 50 or so reviews here and didn't see many complaints about noise. My guess is that because we booked last minute and negotiated a lower rate ($199), we were not eligible for a quiet room, or perhaps all the quiet rooms were already taken. If you stay here, make sure that you get a room on a very high floor (PH at least) and that you are not over the bar, the front drive, or the construction site. (Oh, and there is construction on the 19th floor so avoid that as well). And bring earplugs! Our cautionary tale: We were given an 8th floor room over the hotel bar's outside area, and on our first night were subject to loud music and rowdy patrons well into the wee hours (this was on a Wednesday night). The manager was extremely sympathetic and moved us to a room on the other side of the hotel, on the 14th floor, after personally inspecting the room himself. He also gave us a 50% discount on the room for the night. This room seemed quieter during the day. When we got back to the hotel around 9pm, we could hear a raucous party with a band in the tent out front. Luckily that ended at 10pm. But when we tried to go to sleep that night, we realized that we were directly above the front driveway and busy intersection -- valets blowing piercing taxi whistles, cars honking, etc. There is also a construction site across the street that is very noisy. Luckily we had brought earplugs or we would not have been able to sleep at all! Otherwise this was a nice hotel with remarkably friendly, helpful and professional staff. I didn't mind the cost of valet parking -- very convenient and fast, well worth it. They even cleaned all the bugs off our windshield (we drove down from SF), a very nice touch :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Consultantgal
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Century City Hyatt make this a delightful place to stay. The service is highly professional and very attentive to detail. Every single interaction was delightful. The rooms are also large, very clean and well appointed. I very much enjoyed sitting on the balcony and watching the sunset in the evenings. I was at the hotel for a conference and the meals at the conference were defintely well above average. The only thing I could really find any fault with was that the price was high (over $300 / night), however this is Los Angeles and this is a prime location. Great hotel, great staff, great location and the price tage to go with it.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch -- My conscience hurts”
Reviews.Author: gazooby
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference, meaning I didn't pay for it (that kind of money belongs in my kids' college account, not a hotel chain). Staff are delightful, from room service to housekeeping to front desk. Really great room: large, super comfortable bed, small but okay bathroom. THANK YOU for covering the unhygenic bedspread with a freshly laundered duvet cover. I wish every 4-star hotel was doing this by now (just stayed at Omni-CNN Atlanta, and they still don't). I appreciated the makeup mirror, but found the hotel toiletries to be too strongly scented for my taste (some of us have fragrance allergies, hello people!). Cute balcony overlooking the bank building across the street, but after five minutes the Santa Anna winds sent me inside with an allergy attack, so not much use to anybody. The real kicker (and my kids really laughed at me later) was that I was starving on arrival and couldn't find a restaurant in my price range in the hotel (there is a mall nearby, I just didn't know about it yet). So I ordered a $19 room service pizza which came with another $10 of taxes, service fees, and other charges. So I ate a $30 pizza. Will never hear the end of it from my kids. And will probably never stay here again, but it was nice while it lasted.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kateoz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and was very happy with the quality of the hotel. Check in was easy and the staff very welcoming. There is a Starbucks in the lobby of the hotel which was great to pick up a coffee for the walk to the office in the morning. The rooms aren't large but the furnishings very modern and comfortable. I was supposed to stay 2 nights but my meetings were cancelled and therefore only stayed 1. There was no problem at all checking out early, and I was not charged a cancellation fee or the second night's rate, despite giving the hotel less than 24 hours notice, as their policy states. I was very impressed that the hotel did not try to 'double dip'.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Century Plaza top-notch”
Reviews.Author: Scottas66
Reviews.Content: Century Plaza was wonderful. I arrived late and asked to have a colleague able to check into my room for me. WhenI spoke to the front desk to follow up, as soon as I gave my name, without looking at my record, the front desk agent said "Oh, your colleague has just checked in." That is some good service. Throughout my short stay, the front desk offered amazing service. However, the hotel restaurant falls short of expectation. The food alternated between high quality and mediocre, but the service was slow and the staff seemed confused.

Reviews.Title: “Century Plaza is all Tens”
Reviews.Author: DCflyboy
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Century Plaza Hotel -- it used to be a Westin and now is a Hyatt Regency. The experience is a simple all 10's. It is located walking distance from an incredible outdoor mall with great restaurants and shops. The rooms have an excellent view -- the staff are very attentive. The room is well appointed -- simple and clean. There is a buzz and feeling of Southern California energy about this hotel -- people moving through the lobby -- a lobby bar that always has people at it meeting or enjoying. It is a class act and highly recommended. Centrally located not far from a large number of Los Angeles and Hollywood locations, it is very convenient. Can't say enough good things. Stay here if you have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamababoo
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay. Service was very good. Rooms very clean and well appointed. Some signs of age here and there, but nothing shabby. Very nice outdoor area.

Reviews.Title: “Not a friendly place”
Reviews.Author: OCnative14
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days during a conference. My room was at the south end of the hall. Drawbacks to this location: early morning noise from construction next door, and late night noise from loudspeaker in the fully automated parking garage ("remember to take your parking ticket with you..." over and over and over again). Hotel parking is $30 a day with in/out privileges; in the off-property structure behind the hotel is $20 a day with no in/out. It is a hike (including an incline and 2 flights of stairs) from the off-property structure. The hotel architecture is is straight out of the 1960s, so think austere, glass, featureless. On a hot day all that glass makes the entire western exposure of the hotel a furnace. Keep the black-out drapes drawn during the day because no amount of A/C at night will cool down the room again after getting all that sun all day long. Do they skimp on housekeeping staff? On day 2 the room was still not made up at 1:30 p.m. By 7 p.m. the glasses that lined the hallway in the morning were still there, along with trash left behind by the housekeeper in the morning. The room was very nice, the bed was a dream, the towels were very soft and plump. Nice toiletries (though I generally use my own because I prefer fragrance-free). I DON'T UNDERSTAND WHY HOTELS DON'T PROVIDE SHOWER CAPS ANYMORE!!!! This item can't cost more than a couple of cents, but no matter how much I pay for a hotel anymore I can never get one. You have to plead with housekeeping to send them. It has to cost them more in labor to walk them upstairs than they save by leaving them out of the room. And it makes them look soooo cheap! New, flat screen digital TVs, but no sleep timer on the remote. New-fangled clock radios that let you dock your gadgets (if you've got 'em, which I don't). But no way to re-set the time to the correct time, and no way to adjust the blindingly bright display in a room that should be dark. The shockingly poor condition of the furnishings in the ballroom area is something to remark on. Filthy, stained, worn upholstery on the chairs and sofas in the lounge area. Stuffing coming out of the pillows. Dark, ugly stains on the chair cushions in the poolside cabanas. I guess, given the choice, I'd rather the sleeping rooms be better maintained, okay, but the overall impression the hotel makes is seriously eroded by the condition of the public areas. For the size of the hotel, the public areas leave a lot to be desired. There is only one smallish restaurant. The most reasonable item on the lunch menu was an $18 turkey burger -- excellent sandwich, but astronomical price and poor service (had to eat hunched over a coffee table in the lobby/lounge, had to ask twice for napkin and silverware, long wait for check to be closed out). Starbucks and shoebox-sized gift shop offering soft drinks and candy bars were the only other options. Room service menu very limited and extremely pricy. I don't know who their customer is, but I'd have to say it's a business clientele. Definitely not the right vibe for vacationers or pleasure trippers. No charm. No warmth. Expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but lots of kinks”
Reviews.Author: Kitty_Chicago_7
Reviews.Content: Room nicely appointed. However, major problems with internet service completely messed up my ability to work. They compled me for service after I complained, but it didn't matter, internet service is expected at a business-focued property like this. Room service menu way too limited. Bathroom was dark, needs more light.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels in LA”
Reviews.Author: Riverfrog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt in Century City in late July for my Bar exam. The hotel was quiet and the room was very nicely furnished. I did have a few complaints though: I found the toiletries to be subpar, there is no in-room coffeemaker (but feel free to spend money at the Starbucks downstairs!), and guests aren't allowed to put anything in the mini-bar fridge. I've never heard of such a thing! Parking is expensive (either $20 or $30 a night) which is to be expected in LA, but it's quite a hike to the hotel from the lot! Hotel is also walking distance from Century City mall, which has a great Bloomingdale's. Overall, the hotel was ok. If you're visiting LA, there's not much in Century City except for the mall. You'd probably have a better time staying in Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: appyrider
Reviews.Content: very pricey hotel-not worth the money-if you have kids, look elsewhere-NOT a family hotel-hotel restaurant had very poor, expensive food-room refrigerators came pre-stocked with very expensive snacks-no room in them to put your own drinks or water-had to repeatedly ask for more towels (two of each for three people)-parking also expensive-be prepared to keep lots of extra cash for tipping valets

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and nice”
Reviews.Author: TGS67
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Century Suite and it was really comfortable, quite and spacious. Be careful with the minibar in the room, because you have to pay for items at the moment you move them. But in spite of that I would come back to the same room and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovation”
Reviews.Author: hartss
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here in late August with my 10-year old son. We had a terrific time. The property was renovated with an eye for detail. The room was great, with dark wood modern furniture, a large LCD TV, terrific beds and a stylish bathroom. The bathroom lights weren't functioning properly, and they promptly sent a very courteous repairman to fix the problem. Even the hallways and elevator lobbies on each floor are very stylish. I was told that the pool area is to be renovated soon, and I was kind of surprised because it is very nice as is. Looking forward to seeing what they do with it. We booked the AAA rate and to our pleasant surprise we were given vouchers for free breakfast for both of us for all three days of our stay, The restaurant, Breezes, serves terrific breakfasts, although I would certainly not spend $55 for breakfast for two if it were coming out of my own pocket, The hotel location is terrific. We went to eat at the Century Plaza mall several times, and the standouts were Houstons and French 75, both of which had terrific food and treated my son with respect. The food court on the top level has some nice lunch options, as well. We went to see the Harry Potter movie at the new AMC movie theater in the mall, which has comfortable stadium seating. My only real issue with the hotel is the $31 valet parking charge, which I feel is excessive. All the nice hotels in Southern California are doing this now, and I think it is outrageous. Aside from that, loved this place and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDallasTX
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The best pool area/hot tub in the los angeles area. The hoel itself is HUGE but very quiet. If you're lucky enough to be on the backside of the hotel, you'll have nice views of the mountains/westwood area/pool area. The room service was presented very well and came promptly when ordered. The beds were firm but comfortable and the individual a/c worked perfect. Parking was not the easiest if you were doing it yourself, because it was about 100 yards from the hotel. Parking ran about $20 a day. Valet parking was considerably more. You are also a short walk from the Westfield shopping center which has plenty of restaurants for a quick bite to eat. If you are looking to be in the middle of Hollywood this hotel is not. It's very close to Rodeo and Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: lrishblueyes
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. Close to great shops & restaurants. We didn't sample any of the nightlife locally, but it was just a short cab ride to Sunset Strip. Easy access to public transport.... Santa Monica one way & Hollywood the other for under $2. Staff were helpful, rooms were immaculate, and luxurious & we had a huge balcony we could sit out on. Pool area was nice, although we didn't use it. It was always lively. Huge shopping mall literally on the doorstep was a plus! A very up-market hotel we booked through Priceline & got a great deal on! Impressive to say the least!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor”
Reviews.Author: 2Kids4Dogs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hyatt for two nights earlier this month while on an all-girls trip to The American Girl Store. Driving from Disneyland, we called the hotel to find out how long it would take us to get there. We were told, "two and a half hours"! We were incredulous, and sure enough, it took us less than an hour to arrive. When we checked in, we asked how long it would take for us to get to The American Girl Store in The Grove. Now, it's only about 4 miles away, but we were told, "forty-five minutes"!! Maybe they gauge these travel times based on peak travel with multiple car accidents along the way, but their estimates were so far off from reality they weren't helpful at all. We were taken aback by the valet parking charge of $31 per day. We were told about alternate parking but it would be about $20 with no in and out priveleges. Both a parking valet and front desk clerk told us it would cost us $20 each and every time we parked and left. Because we arrived late and just wanted to get some sleep, we parked at the hotel and didn't check out the veracity of their information regarding the other parking lot. As another review mentioned, the front parking area is quite congested. Be sure to call ahead to have your car brought around if you use their parking. Everything about the hotel is beautiful from the lobby to the hallways to the rooms themselves. The beds were comfortable, room decor was lovely. I would probably stay there again but cringe at the thought of the parking charge. We used the pool one evening but it closes at 10. I think that's a bit early, considering that loud voices were coming from the outdoor bar area well past midnight. Since our visit centered around visiting The Grove and American Girl Store, the hotel's location was perfect. It took us about 20 minutes to get where we were going each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Zebra11
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel! I canâ€™t say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The rooms were clean and up to date. We loved the view and the 42â€� HDTV. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. The location is great. You are close to so many things in LA. We spent 4 days in LA on a family vacation and were centrally located to any attraction that we wished to visit. Fortunately, this eliminated a great deal of traffic concerns. The hotel made sure that our room was located on a non-business floor as to not distract the many business travelers. This hotel delivers everything that you expect for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveler98
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine for business travel, but certainly nothing special. There were constantly lines for the front desk, I was on hold interminably when I called to report a problem with my television and the housekeeping was a bit spotty (some days great, others not so great). They didn't have the king room I'd reserved available on my arrival, but did offer to move me the next day. There is construction going on next door which begins quite early in the morning. The Equinox gym is wonderful, but the $20/day charge is a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scmk3000
Reviews.Content: I have used this site for a while and thought I should contribute at least by giving my review on my hotel stay. I hope this will help people choosing their hotels in LA. I visited LA, SF and NY from 7/12 to 7/24 and stayed in 5 hotels along the way. Hyatt Regency Century Plaza is by far the BEST hotel of the whole trip. Stayed there between 7/12-16. Picked up the hire car at the airport and drove to the hotel directly (OMG the traffic!). Got there at about 6pm and the valet parking was a bit chaotic. Very limited space in front of the hotel. The lobby was very grand as you could expect from a Hyatt. Went to the receiption and told them my details and showed them my newly registered Gold pass - was told that since we used an 'Online agent', no points would be earned, except incidentals. Nevermind, worth a try. The guy (Alessandro or something) was very polite nevertheless. Parking was about $30 I think with in/out. Asked for a high floor room and got assigned a room on the 26th floor. Tipped the guy ($20) as he was very helpful. Thought we would be given the smallest room but to my surprise it was a very big king delux (could easily fit another bed in). It faced the Ave of the Stars and directly opposite the 2000 office building across the road. You could see a bit of distanced houses and even a bit of the sunset. Although it's right on the main road, you couldn't hear much at all once doors to the balcony are shut. The balcony itself was carpeted and with two chairs and still space to move around. The bathroom was huge as well and plenty of toileteries. Shower wasn't powerful though and there wasn't any space you can put the toileteries (no ledges no racks - a bit inconvenient). Since we hadn't eaten since the morning, we hurrily went over to Century Plaza's well recommended food court. OMG I was stuck! So many choices!! Settled with sushi after 20 mins of checking out the counters and ate it outside - beware of the pigeons, their hungry eyes were quite disturbing. Went down to Gelson's to get some fruits and water etc. Nice store but I would recommend the few stores close to (one open 24 hours I think) on Sonta Monica Blvd, close to San Vicente intersection. Much cheaper. Century Plaza had all the famous brands though. Went back to the hotel and checked out the pool and the gym. Pools (one main and a coupe of splash pools for kids) were outdoors and were OK. I am not sure if it was a temp arrangement but the gym was next door (Equinox) and needed to pay to use it. Apparently it's very popular among the celebs and there was a long waiting list for memberships. Express our discontent that we had to pay to use one basic hotel facility. That Alex guy mentioned above whispered to the person we were talking to and immediately he offered some breakfast coupons to shut us up. The magic of tipping! So got to enjoy breakfast every morning and Marie in the Breeze restaurant who served us a few mornings was very attentative and we tipped her every morning too. Food was OK, we chose buffet breakfast as it's easier. Fruits were good with few choices of cereals. Cooked section could be better as choices were limited. It was OK though. Also newspaper daily by the time we got out of the room - probably one of the Goldpass benefits.. All in all, enjoyed my stay very very much. Highly recommended. I think it's more a 5-star hotel than a 4-star in my opinion. I would definately stay there again given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Biz & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: writer_lady
Reviews.Content: The recently renovated rooms are mod, plush, and gorgeous! Rooms, bathrooms, TV, furniture in the rooms are all top notch. You'll get the LA experience here. Great pool, nice grounds, good restaurants. The new X Bar was really cool - great outdoor lounge with firepits for the cool nights. The location was excellent. Safe, albiet not in a happening spot, but you're close to everything - Rodeo drive, Universal, PCH, Melrose.

Reviews.Title: “great location and luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: soccermommy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline, looking for a safe and convenient base for our first trip to LA (mom and 2 teenage girls). This turned out to be excellent in almost every way. The location is perfect. It is very close to the 405 - a major artery in LA. It's around the corner from Santa Monica Blvd, and close to Beverly Hills and Hollywood sites. The staff are friendly and helpful. The concierge gave us easy directions for each day, and great suggestions. The public spaces and the room itself are all clean, updated, and lovely. We had a room overlooking the pool, with cool views at night. The beds were really comfortable and we slept late each morning. It really is a beautiful hotel. As others have stated, the only drawback is the ridiculous valet parking charges. Although the valet staff are kind and efficient, $31.00 per day is a lot to tack on to an already expensive 4* hotel. And you really have no other choice. There is a mall next door, and I saw a parking garage on the next block, but both are inconvenient and also expensive. I found parking in LA to be exorbitant everywhere we went. It's the first time in my life I have paid to park at a mall! Hyatt is certainly making enough money- a more reasonable parking system is not too much to ask.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: M90_AMT
Reviews.Content: loved this classy hotel. lovely lobby, beautiful rooms, pleasant staff. Didn't eat here but located short stroll from upmarket outdoor mall with nice restaurants/cafe. Valet parking good service but pricey. When returned to UK appeared to have been charged the wrong amount to our credit card - tried to sort out by email but are insisting we write to them if we want a copy of our account -not hugely convenient when you live on the other side of the world. hope to get this sorted out as appear to have been significantly overcharged and if we can't sort it would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking Aaahh!”
Reviews.Author: Margaritaville11
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 2 nights in July , very convenient location, next to the Century City Mall. Close to Beverly Hills. Very nice luxurious rooms, comfy beds, good views with open balcony. Lovely pool area suitable for all ages. Starbucks onsite. My only complaint was the mandatory valet parking which I found very expensive at $31 per day plus tips . There is a parking station around the back of hotel that charges $20 per day it is quite a walk , and for safety I wouldn't like to do it late at night. I parked at the mall during the day it is free for the 1st 3 hours at least this saved paying for tips . The staff were quite aloof , their attitude was similar to the New York hotels we have encountered. At the mall there is a very good supermarket Gleeson's with a deli and coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay at the Century Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Renoir184
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned (and reluctantly returned I might add) from an excellent stay at the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza. We were in L.A. on business, and the hotel, with its central location, provided us with an outstanding "home base" for our stay. The room (Room 726) had a west-facing view over the pool area and was very large, extremely clean, very modern and very inviting. The large balcony overlooking the pool was fabulous! The flat screen television was a very nice touch in the room. Cleaning staff were very polite and accommodating, and the front desk staff, concierge and valet staff were extremely polite, very helpful and most pleasant. The Starbucks in the Main Lobby was a welcomed addition on those early mornings also! Two negatives: 1. The $31.00/day parking fee is absolutely excessive. Only valet service is available at the hotel directly, so the inconvenience of having to have one's car brought up each time you want to leave for the day is a bit of a pain! Given the room rates in the hotel, the parking fee is, in my opinion, unreasonable. 2. Unless you have a laptop with you, there is no computer Internet access available anywhere in the hotel except in the Business Centre. I needed to access my home email a couple of times for very short periods of time, and I was unable to do so from anywhere in the hotel except the Business Centre in the lower level. This was very inconvenient. All in all, this is an OUTSTANDING hotel and I will certainly stay there again - - - I've found a new favourite place to stay in Los Angeles!

Reviews.Title: “No need for a car at this one”
Reviews.Author: MichaelInSF
Reviews.Content: I did a two day business-related stay at the Hyatt Century Plaza. One can tell from the architecture that the property probably dates from the 60's, but the hotel has been renovated so thoroughly, and seems in such great condition, that it's really difficult to tell what the true age of the place is. The primary giveaway that it's an older property is that each room has a balcony you can walk out and sit on chairs they've placed onto each balcony. The view from the East side of the building is onto a shiny silver building with striking architecture (according to office workers who work next door, this silver building is home to the Los Angeles branch of the C.I.A.). Behind the Hyatt, on the west side of the building, is the sunny side of the building with the pool (which I am kicking myself for not bringing swim shorts). There are reflecting pools there, and people can tan quite easily there. The gym is next door (it's a branch of Equinox, a super fancy fitness chain), and there is no complimentary gym access for Hyatt guests. A day pass will run you $20. WiFi access is free in the lobby. In the room using Ethernet, the cost was $10 for 24 hours of access. With our AAA membership, we managed to get free breakfast vouchers which we were able to use in the downstairs restaurant. Apparently the Hyatt just started a breakfast buffet at this location very recently. The buffet offerings were kinda meager... different kinds of cereal, yogurt, lots of pastries, eggs, quiche and chicken sausage. Beyond the balcony, the furnishings in the room were very modern. A widescreen flat panel TV. A minibar fridge that apparently charges you if you so much as touch it :-) The bathroom was nicely sized and when my wife asked for a showercap, the housekeeping lady ran off and came back with three little showercap boxes. The mall next door has an AMC movie theater, a very diverse food court on the top floor and a full grocery store on the bottom floor, so if you're doing business in one of the office buildings nearby there really is no reason to rent a car or pay the parking fees. The taxi to and from LAX airport was just over $40 each way. Aside from the minibar fridge (which I didn't open), there was no other fridge in our room in which to store perishables. The U.S. Council of Mayors conference happened at the Hyatt the weekend we were staying there and even though there was enhanced security and an incredible amount of traffic in and out of the place, the place did not feel very overwhelming at all. This was a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: ncdoll
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline and got a fantastic rate. We were in town for my sons graduation from UCLA and we couldn't have been more pleased. Nice size room with balcony over looking the gorgeous grounds of this hotel and have the mall right next door was very handy. We walked over our lst day and got a salad at the grocery store there and sat outside which was very pleasant. Overall a wonderful stay in a very clean & convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracey P
Reviews.Content: We just spent five nights at this hotel in May 2007. Fabulous. It was extremely busy the whole time we were there but that didn't stop the staff going out of their way to make us welcome and remember us whenever they saw us in the lobby. Sean on the front desk, Lance and Lincoln were just the nicest people and went out of their way for us. Its very well located - right across the road from a large mall and fairly close to Santa Monica and Beverly Hills. Quite central to most things although this being LA you would need a car. After spending a month travelling through the US it was a lovely end to our time overseas and I would definetely stay there again. Note to people like me curious about the mini bar - if you lift something out of the fridge....you will be charged...be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cpbino
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in June and was very pleased with the hotel. The rooms were not large but big enough for my daughter and myself. For the size room, the three phones might have been a bit overboard. Beds were very comfortable and the desk and swivel chair came in handy. The bathroom was larger than most. I agree with a previous review that the front of the hotel could get noisy from road traffic and new construction. We were on the 15th floor and I woke to the sounds of speeding motorcycles or cars a couple of times. Contruction work started early in the morning in the next block. It woke me but my daughter slept right through it. Waking early was not a problem, however, the balcony offerred a nice place to sit and read the paper each morning. This was my first visit to L.A. without renting a car. The $30.00 parking rate helped me decide to try cabs and public transportation. You are a long way from the subway and the busses are slow and packed. Other than that, the Westfield mall across the street was a nice place to visit and had every major store you might want. A taxi ride to the airport early Sunday morning was $40.00 with no traffic. I might have been taken on that one. There is a Gelson's grocery store in the mall garage. They have great sandwiches and salads. We picked something up there twice and took it to our room. The balcony offers a nice place to sit, eat, and enjoy the cool breezes. There are also plenty of restaurants in the mall with a variety of food. Overall, a nice place to stay and I would do it again. Would probably rent a car the next time and pay the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ursoyou
Reviews.Content: Staff: Friendly and Helpful Cleanliness: Awesome Amenities: great pools, family oriented, good restaraunts and great shopping across the street w/ movie theater. My only complaint was parking. They said parking garage, but don't state the price it's $20.00 a day and it's a little walk away - challenging if you have much stuff and small kids. Valet Parking at hotel is $30.00 a day and does not include tip. Location: close to all LA, Hollywood and Beverly Hills sites. Great area.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: HotTubJohnny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hyatt Regency Century Plaza near Beverly Hills for one night recently. I was very pleased with the experience. Pros: Nice lobby, very sophisticated quiet hallways, widescreen LCD TV in room (with some hi-def channels, nice!), comfortable pillows and linens, Portico bathroom supplies, friendly staff and great valet service. Cons: breakfast in the restaurant was insanely priced ($13 for pancakes? c'mon!), noise from road fronting hotel. They are also beginning some big construction across from the hotel, so i expect the noise to get worse. Staying on the backside would be the way to go. Location: This could be good or bad depending on what you're looking for. Its within walking distance of a mall, which was great for shopping and quick eats at the food court. Also somewhat of a unique mall b/c its open to the outside. On the downside, its not near any "party district" type places. However, the hotel is right off santa monica, so it was easy to get to other areas like west hollywood and beverly hills. The parking was a bit steep as well: $20 self-park w/ no in-and-out, or $31 valet per night w/ in-and-out. The valet service was great but that is pricey. We didn't use the pool, but it looked pretty nice and was heated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: interviewtraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decorated with a contemporary style. There are abstract paintings all over the hallways outside the rooms. The staff was very friendly and accomodating my group's needs, and the rooms were cozy and roomy. The pool area was beautiful and provided lots of sun. As for location, it was very convenient to be located right across from the outdoor Century City Mall. The hotel also just opened the cool X Bar, which was very nice. It's a decent walk or nice run into Beverly Hills, and there is convenient access to the 405 and 10 freeways. It's not right in the heart of the city, so you can relax and enjoy the beautiful surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking, the best I've been”
Reviews.Author: Flakky
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time and the swimming pool area was excellent. I enjoyed the early morning swim and spa. Very nice facilities and near Beverly Hills and 15mins drive from Hollywood Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Just Mind-Blowing”
Reviews.Author: SeaSunNFUN
Reviews.Content: We found a good rate online -- paid about just over $250 per night. We weren't expecting much of it as we paid a bit more for the intercontinental next door previously, and a lot lot more for Loews Santa Monica for two nights earlier, but we were pleasantly surprised, the queue at check-in was kinda long, but they were pretty efficient and we only waited about 5 minutes. The lobby is magnificient, lot of open space, polished, and quite big. Superb location -- a stone-throw away from the Century City mall, cabs are instantly available outside the hotel, and rodeo Drive is quite close by. The rooms are quite generously proportioned. Have a big Plasma TV. The pool view from the room is great. The bathrooms are very clean, well maintained, and had no problem at all....not very huge though but good enough. The beds were cozy, not too soft. However, there is no turn down service available. The Pool area is amazing, spacious, the main pool is surprisingly big, unlike the intercontinental next door. The service is great, and the concierge go out of their way to help you and find information/directions for you. And their drinks are reasonably priced and Mojitos are AMAZING... One of the best hotels I've ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!! Great Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Southernvbgal
Reviews.Content: We returned from the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza on Saturday but did so reluctanly. We had a really good experience with this hotel. We arrived on Sunday around 11:00 a.m. and was able to check in as soon as we arrived. My husband requested a room on the west side of the hotel because it had a wonderful view and lady at the desk was very willing to help with our request. When we got to the room there wasn't a coffee maker so he called and requested one be brought to the room within a matter of minutes we received the coffee maker, Guest Services even called to make sure that we had received it. The only problem was that the coffee filter from the previous users was still in there, but it really wasn't that big of a deal. We waited for a very limited time for our car any time that we requested it. The concierge was very helpful with tours and getting back to the airport. The whole staff was very nice and quite attentive to any of our request. The hotel recently went through a major renovation and the rooms are very nice. We will definitely be returning to the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: ah929
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this great property. The hotel has gone through a $30 million renovation & looks updated, modern, & fresh. Beautiful public spaces to enjoy as well. Pool area was lovely, & spacious. Get a room facing the ocean & pool...lovely to see West Hollywood & the Santa Monica mountains as well. The rooms are large for a city hotel & with the terrace it feels even larger. The rooms are clean and very well decorated. The staff was incredibly nice. Very prompt service, and personalized as well. They always try to use your name, which makes this large chain hotel a little more personal. The concierge arranged our tours & restaurant reservations with a keen idea of our needs.......a family "LA" experience & made excellent recommendations for us. Especially enjoyed the tour they recommended from the hotel. Nice not to have to drive into Hollywood to get it & it's a small co. that offers a very knowledgable tour. Originally had hoped to stay in Santa Monica, but after this experience would definately return here again. The location was superb-centrally located to everything. Less driving as a result. Also nice outdoor mall across the street which had a nice food court. A great option when you just don't want to get in the car or eat at the hotel, although we did enjoy the restaurant here too. Going to LA with children, I would highly recommend this location & the hotel. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Older, but still a winner.”
Reviews.Author: FairwayFound
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older property. I last stayed here about ten years ago or more. It has a good feel to it. Service is pretty good. The bed was comfortable. The large flat screen tv in the room was a plus. Parking is expensive -- $31 a day valet, the pay lot was $20 a day. There was no coffee in the room. I could not get the Golf Channel which was a disappointment. The banquet facilities and meeting facilities were excellent. Of course, Century City is a great area in LA.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in the US”
Reviews.Author: Tennis0720
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a conference. Newly renovated, beautiful property. I stayed in a classic room and it even had a flat screen tv, a beautiful bathroom, and a balcony. the staff at the hotel is also amazing and willing to help. the conceirge was even able to get me tickets to see jay leno.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: EEYORETIGGERR
Reviews.Content: The plaza is as you would expect a 4* US hotel. The bedrooms are large, with Balconies and the beds incredibly comfortable. The hotel has a nice bustling lobby area. The pool area is nice although the gym is currently in a temporary marquee as the new gym is being finished (it looks like it will be a high quality gym) Just across the road is an excellent shopping mall with a really good food court. The one thing I would say this hotel lacks is any evidence of its history, it is just like any other 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Renovated Hyatt near Century City/Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: LeanaD
Reviews.Content: As previous posters have mentioned, the Hyatt is/has gone through some renovations and looks great! Rooms/hallways are very pretty. Nice flat-panel tv's too! Internet was $4-5/hour. Great location; walking distance to great shopping at Century City; few minute drive to Beverly Hills. Only thing I'd keep in mind is parking. There's a parking structure behind the hotel which is shared by the shopping center/offices nearby ($20/day). Much better to use the hotel's complimentary valet and just tip :o)

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant LA Hyatt Experience”
Reviews.Author: ocGlobetraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Century Plaza (Formerly known as the Westin Century Plaza Hotel) is located in Century City, just minutes from Beverly Hills. The hotel is currently undergoing a 22 million dollar renovation, which includes guest rooms, common areas as well as the Equinox Gym which will soon be available to guests. The room renovation is already complete, and quite impressive. For a hotel which was built in the '60's, Hyatt has done a great job adapting the rooms with a contemporary motif. Guest Rooms are average in size, but do not at all feel cramped in any way. Bed comfort is wonderful, featuring Hyatt's new "Grand" guest bed experience. Plushtop mattresses, nice linens and a comfortable down comforter all make for a pleasant nights sleep. Rooms include large LCD Flat Screen televisions, along with well designed hip furnishings. Bathrooms are also nicely done with a basic tub/shower combination. West facing rooms tend to be a little quieter, as they are removed from the main street. We were quite impressed with the dining selections, and food quality was typically Hyatt- terrific. Service throughout the hotel was very pleasant. Whether you are looking to tour Los Angeles, or work, I think you will find this location to be ideal.
