From a touristâ€™s perspective, it is just minutes from Beverly Hills and Hollywood, yet away from the sometimes annoying hustle bustle. The immediate surrounding area includes an upscale mall (Century City Mall) and several office buildings. Once the renovation is complete, I think the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza will be a wonderful LA choice, as it is convenient, quiet and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Rooms as new”
Reviews.Author: thiakopes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night back on October 2 2006, at the end of our 3 month around the world trip. The hotel is going through a major renovation, and check in upgraded us to a newly renovated floor (12th) which was a nice gesture. Rooms were very nice, with LCD TV and lovely king size beds. Didnt eat at hotel, because generally find them all too pricey but there is a westfield accross the road with some nice restaraunts open at night. Hotel has a Hertz agency located in it, which was handy because we hired a car and drove around mailub, santa monica and beverley hills. The hotel is centrally located which is a major plus. Also not too far to LAX either. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Nice introduction to LA but no pool”
Reviews.Author: travelinbunny
Reviews.Content: I was staying here because of a conference. I was looking forward to this conference for quite some time and kept checking the hotel's website for more information. No where on the website was I told that the pool was going to be closed due to construction, or that the hotel would be renovating. The lobby construction wasn't that bad, but when it sounds like people are bowling on the floor above, that's when you begin to expect some type of forewarning. I'm used to staying in Best Western's and Quality Inn's, so I was really looking forward to staying in a nice hotel. The room was nice, but some basic ammenities found in lower class hotels were missing. For instance, no refrigerator or coffee maker and no hand soap in the bathroom. But, most importantly, when one is traveling to LA from Seattle in October, one expects a pool at the hotel. The closed pool was probably the biggest disappointment. The bowling alley sounds above were another strike against this hotel. You'd think if construction was happening they wouldn't put people on the same floor or directly underneath the construction, but they did. This hotel was definitely lacking in basic communication and customer service skills. The valets were nice and the conference facilities were good, too. The location is right next to an outdoor mall, which is nice, too.

Reviews.Title: “Star Treatment!”
Reviews.Author: barbie1959
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the same convention in July with a friend. I arrived on July 21st and left on July 30th. Super Shuttle brought us to the hotel from the airport and we used them when we left. We were early for check in but, was allowed to check in at 12:00pm on our arrival. We were warmly greeted and checked in promptly. My friend and I paid in advance for our room and told the clerk we would not be making long distance calls or using the minibar. No suprise additonal charges appeared after we checked out. The hotel room we had was a 2 double bed room, 10th floor, with a view of the pool. The balcony was wonderful to sit on at night and view the city lights. The bathroom was a great deal bigger than most hotel bathrooms and very nice and clean. Our room was kept very clean and our housekeeper always honored our requests. We tipped her daily so that probably helped. Coffee (Starbucks brand), tea, USA Today paper and fitness center was free with our Hyatt Gold Passport (wonderful tip from a Trip Advisor member!). My friend and I ate mostly at the food court at Westfield mall across from the hotel. There were many restaurant choices in the food court. If your on a budget, go to the New York deli. It's not in the food court but, at the back of the mall. They serve enough food for two people. The salads are HUGE! I ate one meal, lunch at the Breeze restaurant. I had the crabcake and steamed dumpling appetizers. Both were good but, a little too fancy and pricey for my taste. Remodeling construction was going on on the top floors 17th and 18th of the hotel so there was some noise complaints from conventioneers about that. I assume the construction is going from the top floors down. I went on one of the LA Tours tour of LA and also did my own sightseeing by bus. The Concerige are very helpful with your tourist plans, just see them near the front desk of the hotel. I had a wonderful time and if I could afford the non-convention rate, I would love to stay here again. My stay was pleasant and made so by being greeted warmly by name whenever I telephoned the front desk and being treated by hotel staff as a valued guest. At the pool, I did not have to ask for a towel, they were left on my lounge chair for me to use upon exiting the pool. My friend and I received the star teatment and hope you do too upon arriving at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kravman
Reviews.Content: Located just a 10 minute drive from the Sunset strip, this is an exceptional hotel as regards both the amenities and the staff. The hotel is undergoing a $20 million dollar renovation. I stayed in a renovated section of the hotel. The rooms were large, extremely clean and newly furnished with an exceptionally modern bathroom. The fitness centre rivals a professional gym with both its size and the quality and quantity of equipment and the pool and hot tub (outdoors) area provide a great place to relax. The staff was very curteous and helpful, always offering a friendly hello, good afternoon or good evening. The only drawback is the price of parking: $29 valet with the only other option being a public lot which charges $20 everytime you enter the lot. However, the valet service, while expensive, is quite convenient as a quick call will guaranty that your car is waiting for you once you exit and you can exit and re-enter as many times a you like.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meh7976
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza for a convention July 26-30th. Pricey even at the convention rate but well worth the money. From the time I pulled into the valet parking area until I checked-out the hotel treated us as if we were the most important guests in the hotel. The hotel check-in was great our room wasn't ready but the lady at the desk put a hold on a room with 2 double beds and we were able to check in within the next hour. Our bags were promptly brought to our room by a bell man. The room was wonderful with down duvet covers a table and two chairs (workstation), bedside chair and stand, mini-bar (which they emptied for a small fee so we could use the refrig.for our picnic supplies), closet with ironing board, safe, bathroom wonderful, and a coffee maker. We also had a nice view of the pool and mall next door. All rooms have sliding patio doors and a balcony. We felt like we were getting the star treatment. The hotel was able to handle a convention of over 1000 people and then turn around the day after and handle a high profile political person staying with them without compromising the convention activities. The hotel was located in a wonderful area 30 minutes from Hollywood, 20-30 minutes from the Grove, 10-15 minutes from Beverly Center, 30 minutes from LAX. I would definately stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with the Century Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Dudega1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights, before moving to the world class Beverly Hills Hotel. This hotel is very bland, the lobby does not have much character and kind of reminded me of walking into a large office building, just very plain and lackluster, not at all like it was years ago. I stayed in room #631, which had some issues. Two of the three telephones in the room did not work, one of the lamps in back of the chair was missing a light bulb, the balcony was FILTHY, stains on the balcony carpet, cigarette butts left in the corner from the previous guests. The entire 6th floor had a musty smell to it as well, they should invest in some air freshener. As far as the staff, the most outstanding was the valet, he was very friendly and kind, went out of his way for the guests. Housekeeping was bad, they left trash in the room, knocked on the door at 7:45am even with my do not disturb sign out. I got a decent internet rate of $209 per night, plus tax, which was not great but not bad considering this hotel is close to Beverly Hills. Also, the pool can have potential if the poolside attendents actually do their job and bring guests drinks, all they were doing was standing around talking, not waiting on the guests....I think this hotel ran better under Westin management.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: chem_dr
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I traveled to LA for a conference at the Hyatt. There is some construction on Little Santa Monica Blvd (after exitng the freeway) and several lanes were closed during our time there. Upon arrival at the Hyatt, we were able to check-in very quickly and the front desk staff were friendly and accomodating. There was some congestion at the front of the hotel (like most others) with guests loading, unloading, valet parking, etc. Parking at the hotel was an issue for us because the hotel is only 'responsible' for their valet parking area ($20/day). Self-parking can be found at a garage behind the hotel spa that is owned by a third party, but used by hotel guests and shoppers at the Century Plaza Mall. The guest rooms were farily large with double closets and an in-room safe (extremely small, only good for jewelry). Our room faced the construction site across the street (yuck!), but had a cute balcony with chairs that let you get some Beverly Hills sunshine during the day. The bed and bathroom was clean and well-maintained. The bed pillows were very comfortable, plentiful, and fluffy (not like most hotels). The meeting facilities had great acoustics (always a plus) and were mostly accesible by the main bank of elevators. There is a mezzanine level that is only accesible by staircase from the lobby and a second bank of elevators. If you're a shopper, you'll love the close proximity to everything. Century Plaza (Macy's, Louis V., Ann Taylor, etc.) is directly across the street from the rear door of the Hyatt. Rodeo Drive and the Beverly Center are only about a 15 mintue drive away. The nightly rate at the Hyatt will run you upwards of $200 (in most cases), but it was worth it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we stayed in LA, we decided to splurge one night and stayed here. The poolside, upper floors offer a great view of Santa Monica and Beverly Hills. The upscale Century Shopping Center is just across the street...where many of the stars shop. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was big with nice hardware. The balcony was a plus with great view. To eat here is very expensive though. Recommend going to the shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Hyatt...but not bad”
Reviews.Author: thankstomiles
Reviews.Content: We got a decent price from Priceline. The location was great, easy to get to Beverly Hills/the strip, and also to Santa Monica. The concierge service was fantastic--not only called multiple restaurants to get a us a table for a Saturday night, but also made good suggestions and followed up with calls to my cell phone to confirm our plans. Excellent service. The valet price is over the top, but you do have no choice, so just consider it part of the cost. Sign up for the Hyatt Gold Passport (free to do at their website) so you can use the gym for free, otherwise you have to pay some exorbinate fee (again, nickel and dimed). The bed is comfortable and the rooms are a good size. We didn't hear any real hallway noise, though the street noise was present, even on the 12th floor. They obviously put a lot of money into updating what would otherwise be a very dated hotel. We did not eat/drink there, but the lobby had a great vibe and lots of business travelers were having drinks and a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience tarnished by all the Gothchas”
Reviews.Author: soldearly
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast after our car was surrounded by Valet Parking guys who aggresively hyped valet by saying it would save me money over self-park. When I got the bill I was shocked, as they added $29 for half day of parking. Add tips, and it came to nearly $35. The first room offered smelled strongly like smokers, but they moved us quickly down the hall to a similar otherwise ample room. The rollaway was delivered quickly, and the only other unpleasant surprise was $13 for a supposed TV movie we did not order. My daughter simply turned on the TV and watched a 1 hr. disney sit-com. If that costs $13 (!), they should be very obvious in disclosing that to guests. They did remove the charge when I politely protested it. The hotel is in the heart of Century City's business district, so no street parking whatsoever -- they kind of "have you where they want you" and in my opinion exploit that. Otherwise a decent stay accross from major high-rise construction. Not quite worth the $130 (incl. taxes, etc.) we paid, but we were down to the "wire".... I have gotten much better values from Priceline at half or one-third the cost, as nearby as Anaheim Doubletree Suites. Reading other reviews of this Hyatt, a common theme emerges of aggressive charging of extras, which clouds your view of an otherwise nice roomstay in a comfortable bed and bath, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice pool, ok food ....”
Reviews.Author: rock412
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Century City for 4 days for a business conference. The hotel rooms are spacious as are the bathrooms. My only negative comment about the hotel rooms would be the housekeeping, it took over 45 minutes to get fresh towels one evening and 2 days in a row the bathroom area was not swept or mopped, as there was still plenty of hair on the bathroom floor. When you are paying over $250/night and in LA you expect housekeeping services to be a bit better. The hotel catering is not good at all, they served the same bellpepper "goulash" on 3 different occasions and it gets old fast. If you are going to use the hotel's catering department please taste the food before hand. I would stay here again, the location is suberb and the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bridgedol
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel, I was a bit skeptical upon our arrival. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that we had none of the problems that others had experienced on this board. The hotel is very nice and clean with VERY comfy beds! Nice, spacious baths as well. Our car was parked in valet with in/out priveledges and within 10 minutes of calling our car was waiting out front. There is a mini bar/snacks in the room that are quite expensive. When we noticed on our sheet that some of the products were checked off as used, we contacted the front desk and they told us that we would not be charged for them. We also had some incorrect room charges upon check out but they were taken care of as well. The front desk staff was very polite, friendly, and helpful (they printed out our boarding passes for us). I would definitely recommend this hotel for your LA stay. Be aware that there is not much in the way of entertainment, restaurants, etc. surrounding the hotel so you will need to have a car available to you.

Reviews.Title: “Can I Live There?”
Reviews.Author: HappySF
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place! The room was very clean and nicely decorated with the kind of beds, pillows and comforters that you never want to get out of. For just an extra $12 per day, there is a lovely spa (steam room, sauna, fabulous showers) and excellent work-out facility. The front desk and room service staff were great . . . although the spa staff weren't especially adept at helping acquaint this first time user to their facilities. I hope to stay there as much as possible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel late, because of a delayed flight. When we arrived we were told that they had given away the last room with 2 beds.( I had requested ahead of time) I was upset because there was 3 of us and I did not want to have to share a full size bed. Before I said anything the woman checking us in said we are going to give you a suite. The suite was huge, two bathrooms, two large rooms, a dining area that seated 6. We had two large balconies with nice view of the pool.The room was spotless, and comfortable. The valet staff was very nice, the restaurant staff at Breeze was extra nice and the food was great. The room service was quick and the food was very good. We loved the lobby with the piano playing, and light food and cocktails available. We had a wonderful time in Beverly Hills and the hotel stay made it even better!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: brachanam9
Reviews.Content: We were treated like royalty from the time we got there until the moment we left. We got married in a small ceremony Saturday and thought we'd stay the night at a nice hotel here in town. We will be having 2nd wedding (church wedding) and honeymoon in Ireland in 2 weeks, but we wanted to treat ourselves to a special night here. Since we're spending an arm and a leg on the Ireland trip, we thought we'd try priceline to get the room here in LA. Honestly, I was hoping to get the Beverly Hilton, because the last 2 times I used Priceline for LA, I got that hotel. When we got this one for $100, I was disappointed, especially after seeing the reviews here. However, when we got there it was incredible. Check-in was a breeze, and when we told them we were just married they upgraded us to a beautiful suite on the 18th floor that overlooked LA! The suite is about 700 square feet, and includes a private/separate and well appointed "powder room", a dining area that seats 4 and a living area. Also, there is a TV, mini-bar and coffee/tea service and a walk in closet! The view is breathtaking and there is a balcony with a small table and chairs. The color scheme was light and very welcoming and comfortable. As we looked to the left, there were big double doors and through them was the bedroom. It was fantastic! Spacious - with another closet, iron, and fresh, fluffy robes! The modern master bathroom was also spacious and super clean. And the view!! The bedroom also had an incredible sweeping view of LA and another balcony w/ chairs and a table. And the bed. Oh my. So, comfortable, fresh, and relaxing. The duvet was so fluffy and soft, you just melt right into it. Before settling in, we decided to have dinner at the restaurant Breeze there in the hotel. We both ordered the filet mingon, medium rare. I have traveled all over the world and have had many wonderful meals, but I have to say that this was by far, the best filet mingon I have ever tasted. I found out via their website that Breeze was rated one of the Top 20 New Restaurants of 2001 in the USA by Esquire Magazine as well as a Top 10 Los Angeles resturant and I can see why! I figured it would be a nice meal, but never expected just how incredible it would be. What a treat! Also, we happened to tell the waiter we were just married, and at the end of our meal, he suprised us with a decadent creme brulee, compliments of the chef with his congratulations. Amazing. It was so cozy that my husband called to request a late checkout - they said, "no problem!" and gave us until 2pm. Even the valet guys are great, Jack was especially personable. If you have any doubts about this place - don't! It's a fantastic hotel. Clean and comfortable, wonderful staff, great views, quiet, spacious rooms, etc. I will say that $27 IS pretty darn steep for valet parking - that's my only quibble.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: dr63
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel (now carrying the Hyatt, not the Westin name) for four nights. My room, on one of the top floors, was very well furnished, with a beautiful modern bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room had free etherent internet access. Upon arrival, in the early hours of the morning, I noticed the TV wasn't working. The quick arrival of the maintenance technician soon solved the problem, in spite of the very late hour. I was initially concerned to see a major construction site across the road from the hotel. I nevertheless never heard anything, and forgot all about it during my stay. First class (expensive)spa in the hotel. Nice mall (currently under refurbishment) 2 minutes away. All in all - a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “IT was a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice one i stayed here in the middle of july and it was a bit chilly but we loved it the pool could have been a bit cleaner but overall i liked it a lot

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Cynde
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Century Plaza Hotel in Los Angeles and was quite disappointed. Stained carpets, mildew in bath along with missing grout. Floor was actually slanted at walls to the point that the TV armoire was acutally secured to the wall with a heavy chain. I spent over $250 per night for this.....only positive was that the bed was very comfortable. I was charged for use of the courtesy bar...when I never opened it...although they took the charge off when I complained, when I went down to the front desk to get a new invoice, I noted the clerk on the phone with another guest who was apparently charged for the bar too and calling to complain about the erroneous charge...almost felt like this was some kind of scam. Valet parking (with in and out privileges) was a pricey $27 per day. I would not recommend this hotel given the poor condition of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tcaruanj
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 5 nights in September 2005. Had a nice room overlooking the pool. I thought the decor in the room was nice and the bathroom decor was very hip. Room and bathroom were clean and the room was a good size too. The bed was super comfortable. I normally don't like hotel beds but this one was great! The ammenities in the room were good too. The only down side is the price. I was fortunate that I got a special rate as I was there on business, however, I just think the price overall is too high and you don't even get breakfast nor is the gym free to use! That's ridiculous! Also for the price, I'd expect the common corridors to be a lot cleaner. I thought the carpet area looked a bit dingy, personally, and when someone left their room service dishes in the hall or dropped something it was there forever. I just think that for a hotel of this star rating and the price that should be cleaned. I've stayed at other hotels at the same price and star rating that would never leave dirty room service dishes in the hall way. They send someone to collect the dishes. Anyway if you're going anytime soon, get a room facing the pool as there is some construction across the street so it's not a nice view. The valet parking is pricey at $23 but you have all day in and out privilges (I believe there is a cheaper self park). I wasn't floored with the service of the staff, though the cleaning staff were exceptional. Also, on Thursdays in the patio area they give complementary manicures for a tip, and their is entertainment, etc. very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is pathetic! The rooms are so musty that I was sure to see mold growing on the walls. The furniture is 70s, the carpet is worn-out, and the down comforters are never clean - I stay here every week for work unfortunately. Was staying at the Park Hyatt down the street (which is awesome) but had to switch because this place is $15 cheaper - Company policy. I received 10,000 Starwood points the first week I stayed because of the filthy room. The Breeze restaurant is really bad - they charged my room for somebody elses meal and the front desk would not take it off even though they had a copy of the bill with somebody else's name clearly printed on it. The service ----! They always have 1 or 2 people checking in 30 guests on Monday nights. The gym charges $12 (free if your platinum or $6 if you are gold). Starwood preferred guests gets no preferential treatment. The valet parking is a ripoff (again it is cheaper at the Hyatt down the road). Really bad hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Okay room, awful staff”
Reviews.Author: liloo86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to the century city mall, which if you don't have a car, are on a budget and staying there for 5 days quickly become boring. The hall and lobby are luxurious (gotta keep the appearences up). The room we were in was always clean. But that's all for the good points. We spent 5 days there in the beggining of august, and here's what happened, We arrived at the hotel after midnight, arms full of bagages, but none of the staff helped us, two women. We made it to the lobby by ourselves but could not understand a word the lady who checked us in was saying. We went up to the room on the 14th floor, following the staff orders, to take the elevators on the opposite side from the check in desk, still no one to help us with our baggages. We entered the room, the smell was musty and old, we dropped on the bed and slept instantly, but we were awoken by construction at 6 a.m!!! The cold came into the room from the balcony made our room icy cold at about 3 a.m, even with the drapes closed (not so useful when they don't touch the floor) Then, on the 3rd day, a employee knocked and told us that we were due to leave earlier in the morning, then we told her it was not 3 days but 5 days and she excused herself saying it must have been an computer error. We ran down at the cheking desk, scared that they would charge us 2 imaginary days on our credit card, there they confirmed that their computer said we were supposed to have a 3 days stay, we told them the voucher we gave when we checked in said 5 days, of course they said they had lost the voucher, and that they would make their researches, and that everything would be settled on our departure date, with a tone that clearly said they would leave it on the side until we check out and just take the 2 days stay on our credit card, then pay back we were not lying. I had to call our travel agency and have them call the hotel so they could confirm it was a 5 days stay all paid. Then we went back to the desk asking for a paper saying they wouldn't take any money for the stay from the credit card. They told me I would have it at the end of the day, but nothing, they said the manager wanted them to wait 24 hours to make the papers, could not understand why but said ok, again nothing when we asked the paper the next day. I had to yell at them for a young guy to nicely print the front page of our file on their computer, eventually. I don't know what irritated me more, the women who told me to come back again and again and again for nothing, or the women who pretended to help us, but looked at us like we were dirt on her shoes after our travel agency called them. Even the concierge wasn't very helpful, but I think it was more because of a limited knowledge about their job.

Reviews.Title: “Better options in LA but better then the Bonaventure”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: Just ok. Rooms are a good size and have been redone to catch up to the 90's but none of the cool new features like flat panels. Very limited benefits for Platinum members. No club or concierge level. No free breakfast. No welcome gift. No bonus points to exchange for lack of welcome gift. Even though they have tons of suites, no upgrade was offered upon check in. Valet is 27 bucks and self par does not include in and out priviledges. Staff is just ok. Pool is ok. Location is so so due to massive construction accross the street on the fron side and noise from the HVAC system at the mall on the back side. Spa and fitness center look nice but are Beverly Hills prices. In room internet worked fine. TV has around 30 channels, ten of which are ESPN and Sports networks.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and short on service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at this hotel because I love Westin hotels and this was supposed to be a nice place. You can imagine my disappointment when my stay at the Westin Century Plaza Hotel & Spa was nowhere near satisfactory! In fact, my experience with this hotel was so miserable that I could not wait to check out and go home!! Here is a list of just some of the things that went wrong: -In-room internet connection did not work -In-room TV internet did not work -A stranger's bag was left on my bed by a bell hop the first night of my stay -Spa overcharged me for one service and refuses to refund me for a service I did not receive This does not include all of the things that went wrong . . . I will save you from the misery of reading every single detail of my awful experience at The Westin. I am a platinum Starwood member and I will NEVER EVER stay at a Westin Hotel after my experience at The Westin Century Plaza Hotel & Spa in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Century is a classic”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel 5 out of 5. This is my second time here and it has been much better then my previous stay at this hotel. The overall hospitality, courtesy and attentiveness made our stay pleasant. We asked for a king bed and were given a room at the front of the hotel were there is construction of a new resident complex. Times are changing. In the sixties and seventies this was the place to be. The hotel was among the tallest structure in the area. Presidents and celebrities would wave from the balcony of the hotel. People from all around would take part in the local entertainment. The Schubert Theater and the Playboy club were among the favorites. Local Automotive dealers were among the highest price vehicles. The Century City Mall was also the place to shop. Today the curved building stands out among business hi rises and continues to draw visitors from around the world with special packages for spa lovers, Glamour seekers and romantic couples. There is always something going on at this hotel which keeps it more then active. Room service was excellent. Calling for valet service ahead of time did not save much time, so, we did not call ahead for the remainder of our stay. However, the Asian valet was attentive, he would run from place to place to fetch our vehicle and he always had a smile on this face. Kudos to the Asian valet for a job well done. The bar area was friendly, but not prompt on busy nights. The Breeze restaurant was prompt and the food was excellent. For some odd reason we did not receive our Sunday paper. On final review, I think the hotel should offer King beds on the back side of the hotel for those who would like a romantic view. The hotel should incorporate wireless connection for the bar area and plasma TV in their rooms when they become more common place to the public. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean, Well Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The furniture in all of the rooms is updated, with very modern bathrooms. I'm really picky and the only thing I noticed was that the carpet was a little worn, but nothing to complain about! The beds and the bathroom were great! Every room has a balcony, ours had a great view of downtown LA. The pool and patio area seemed great, we didn't get to spend enough time there though! Our only complaints, the valet and parking is kind of a mess and it took a little while to get a cab. Keep in mind that LA is not really a walk around city, so you have to drive or take a cab pretty much everywhere. The hotel is located right by a huge shopping area and a short cab from the Rodeo drive area and Sunset strip. All in all this is a great hotel and we would go back in a heartbeat! FYI, we got a great deal on this hotel through Priceline which made it even better!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: ajkyc
Reviews.Content: The physical plant is very lovely - public areas, pool, etc. - but: - I stay in Westins several times a month and usually the service is very good. For a "luxe" hotel and for a Westin, the staff at this property was very rude and unhelpful. Examples: - Someone calling herself a "sales manager" was incredibly snobby and snippy with me when I asked her a very simple question. She had chin length straight blondish hair. Look out for her. - I went to the pool towel stand, which was empty of towels. Two people were standing behind the counter, a woman in uniform and a man in a suit. I asked them both where I could find towels. They both just stared coldly at me and didn't respond. I guess it was beneath them to answer a very standard and justifiable question. - Some of the valets were incredibly cold and snobby, as if they were movie stars and I had dared to approach and ask for an autograph. I was driving a very expensive car, and I tip extravagantly, so it wasn't on that basis. I have no idea what their problem was. The only exception that I recall was a very sweet, older Asian gentleman, who was very polite and helpful. The worst was one of the valets in tails and top hat, an older man who bore a slight resemblance to Victor Garber. He treated us as if we were filthy street urchins who had stuck our fingers in his food. Also, the heavenly bed here was the least heavenly of all the Westins I've stayed in. The mattress was not especially comfortable at all.

Reviews.Title: “Disasterous stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was expecting this hotel to be very classy given most of the write-up's I read and what with the price they charge here. I stayed here for 5 nights and by the 2nd night I could not wait to get out of there. It was a string of disasters basically. I am not usually one to complain, but I ended up being a regular at the concierge desk several times a day. I had to move rooms the first night due to construction across the road. I was placed in a room on the other side of the hotel which was not much better. The key I was given for the fridge did not fit and it took 3 attempts and visits to the concierge to get this sorted out. I had a telephone line in my room which was not working for the first 3 days and no-one could figure out why. It turned out the previous occupant had a bar placed on the phone line which was not taken off after their stay. The 3rd evening I had a couple walk in on me whilst I was dining. The hotel had double booked my room and reception made several phone calls to my room asking what I was doing in there. On my last evening I had no less than 6 or 7 phone calls and 2 knocks at my door asking what time I would be checking out the next morning as well as housekeeping under the impression I was checking out that evening for some reason and wanting to service my room. This hotel is definitely 'never again' and considering it is Westin it was a very disorganised and unprofessional to say the least - especially for a business based guest. The hotel also needs a refurbisment, though they claim it had one recently. It was very outdated and rooms had a musty smell.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location and a Fine Stay”
Reviews.Author: Clefsdorsf
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a lovely weekend at the Westin Century Plaza when I came to LA to see the King Tut Exhibit. With my SPG Gold membership, I was upgraded to a lovely suite with a view of the pool and a hint of the Pacific Ocean. All rooms however enjoy the comforatable beds and contemporary bathrooms. I would have liked turn-down service or twice daily housekeeping, but the staff was happy to supply extra towel and a robe on request. The location of the hotel is superb--close to Beverly Hills and shopping. The pool is nice in the morning--but the afternoon sun is blocked by the neighboring MGM building. The spa looked nice--but they were booked up for treatments--my fault for not planning ahead. I had lunch and dinner at Breeze-- both very pleasant-- and room service was prompt and acurate. I had no problems with the valet parking--as I would call ahead for my car from the room. Overall-- a nice stay and i would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: $25 valet parking seemed a little steep. You don't get in/out privileges with self parking. Quick service but $25? Whoa. Even by LA standards was pretty high. Rooms are hugh with high ceilings. I think all or at least most of the rooms have a balcony. There's actually construction on both sides of the building so you're not going to escape noise. The side facing the swimming pool appears to get less construction noise. Some signs of aging. The carpet seemed worn. Bathtub wasn't shiny white marble. Beds were nice but wasn't 100% Heavenly Bed quality -- a little softer than expected. Good location -- only minutes to Rodeo Drive / Bev Hills. A 10 minute ride to West Hollywood and Santa Monica. Agree with other reviews that breakfast at Breezes is pretty good. Overall a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: amiprice
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in May 2005 while on a shopping vacation. The hotel is in a great location, convenient to both Beverly Hills and Santa Monica (it is right off of Santa Monica Blvd in Century City). Obviously, if you are visiting LA you need a car and this location is no exception. But it is a short drive from almost any attraction. The rooms are very comfortable, with good bedding. The bathrooms have excellent counter space, enough for three women to get ready at once! Good closet space as well, and each room has a balcony. The pool area appeared to be very nice, however, it was too cold to explore fully. Do NOT attempt to self-park! The self-parking signs take you to a garage that is not affiliated with the hotel and has no in and out privileges. Service was good. We asked for the air conditioning to be turned on and for extra towels and received both requests immediately. Also, they allowed us to check out at 4:00 PM on the day we were leaving, rather than 12:00, with no problem. I would definitely stay here again on my next LA trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great urban style celebrity hotle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Century Plaza in LA 2x in April for various business meetings in LA. Loved it two times. I can't help but fall in love with the heavenly bed. Recovered from back surgery about a month ago and was concerned about sleeping in hotel beds, (my bed is custom) and it was a great feel and so comfortable. Slept like a baby. Staff was terriffic, valets & bell hops were very nice and helpful. Liked the free Evian from the valet. Washed my windows too...unexpected...and appreciated. Checked in , had to wait a little while but got a nice upgrade and comp breakfast. Front desk people were exceptionally pleasant, especially the tall brunnett (couldn't remember name) . Food at Breeze was pleasantly surprising. Big treat was the celebrity event I happened to watch from the lobby one evening on my way back. Never saw so many stars in one place. That was really cool. This hotel has a great Hollywood history, as I've learned. Looking forward to bringing the family for summer weekend jaunts. Great location too. Central to just about everything in LA. Room were also pleasant and clean, although I was out a lot and didn't get to enjoy the room...except the heavenly bed. Exactly what I would expect from a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Everything wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Century Plaza in April for 3 nights. Everything was wonderful! We arrived at the hotel at about 1:00 or 1:30. We were able to check in right away. We enjoyed all of their restaurants like Breeze and their cafe overlooking the pool. We also used their business center. Every staff member we encountered at the hotel was more than happy to help us with every question we had. The hotel was conveniently located and service was incredible. We will be back again. Highly recommended hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Family went down for a Mother's Day getaway. Nice property. The pools were nice for our son, 4 wading pools of various sizes, the hot tub and the full sized pool w/ steps going from end to end. My wife did a treatment in the Spa next door, she said it was busy, but nice inside. The room was smallish, but the beds were nice, some of the wood on the closets looked worn, bathroom was nice and modern, but again small. Only stayed one night, but saw there was a problem w/ the TV, called down to the front desk and it was promptly replaced, so we could watch the corny National Treasure without 1/4 of the screen having a green cast to it. We took a room on the 18th on the backside, which seems to have better views of the city/sprawl and some of the mountains, but it will not get you away from construction which is happening both directly in front of the hotel and in the Westfield Mall in the back of the hotel. Definetly go for the Starwood Preferred membership (and if you are AAA or AARP, go for Starwood Preferred Plus). Apply online, it's free (as noted in an earlier review - thanks!) With SPG+ were able to do a 4pm checkout, got bumped to the 18th floor (preferred floor) and got 1/2 price on general spa access $6 instead of $12 (but no discount on the treatments :) We also did pirceline - $136 dd the trick, $126 failed. Valet is $25, which seemed on the steep side, considering most people had to wait a little longer then what I consider normal for their cars. Internet is $10 / day. However I got wireless reception from the Westfield Mall in our room on the backside / 18th floor facing the Mall. They charge $3 / day, but I'm not sure what the b/w will be like, I'll leave that for a future reviewer to try out. Easy walk to the mall (which is undergoing redevelopment, but still has many stores and the movie theater open). We had Mother's Day brunch at the Breeze, $58. Nice outdoor table and they let us really take our time. Good service, good food. At night, I smoked my Andrew Estates wimpy Kahlua Cigar and watched the city lights from our 18th floor balcony, good times, good times.

Reviews.Title: “Bad news...”
Reviews.Author: spt
Reviews.Content: I booked the Westin Century City for a Birthday getaway, but I spent most of my time arguing with the front desk, valet, and room service. I waited over 20 minutes at the front desk to check in, and then I was not even given the accomodations I had reserved. The elevators were broken, none of the ammenties for Preffered guests were in the room (robe, coffee, etc) and the operator was impossible to reach on the phone. I travel over 18 days a month, mostly staying at high end properties. I have never had so many things be wrong in one stay, compounded with the most disinterested personnel I have ever encountered. I realize now that many of the deficiencies are due to a long running union strike. This would explain why at around midnight every night, horns and megaphones are engaged outside in the street to draw attention to the strike. I'd say that is not necessary, it is very evident. To add insult, when I received my AX bill I was charged incorrectly and had to spend further time arguing with them. I'd make a wide detour around this disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy!”
Reviews.Author: fundatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of a Disneyland trip to be closer to LAX. The hotel is very attractive and the beds were super. Our only problem was that the first room we were given had a barking dog in the next room. We were quickly switched to another room which was quiet, but not as large and nice as the first room. Since it was only for one night, I did not complain. We had breakfast the next morning in the Breeze dining room. The food and service were very good, but a bit pricey at $75 for 2 adults and 2 children. The location of the hotel is very nice for visiting the Getty Center and Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Amenities/ 3 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Century Plaza from March 1-3. I actually used my Starwood points for this trip, and got a nice room overlooking 2 giant office buildings that were under construction. To comment on the parking situation based on previous reviews, I had no problems with the Self-Parking lot. You do have to go right past the hotel and make a right onto St. Regis Ave to get to the garage, and walk across a pedestrian bridge from the garage back to the hotel. But I'd rather pay $20/day, than $25/day + tip for valet and be able to get my car whenever I want. We checked in and were given a room on the 17th floor right next to the elevators. The room was very clean and updated and was truly a 4-star quality room. The beds were very comfy and the shower is highly enjoyable. We arrived late in the evening and had already eaten dinner, but my wife wanted desert so we ordered room service. I was put on hold and had to wait for the "Next available room service agent" which actually took close to 10 minutes, something I've never experienced before. I ordered a bowl of berries normally on the breakfast menu. 2 minutes later, my wife wanted me to add a glass of milk to the order. I called back and they told me that would be fine. However, when the order arrived, there was no milk. My wife decided to forget about it. We chose the hotel #1 because I could get it free with my Starwood points and #2 because we were going to a taping of the Price is Right and also wanted to tour Hollywood. The hotel is a is in a good location to all of these things as we got lost trying to find CBS Television City at 5:30 am, but still managed to get there in time. The restaurant, Breeze, is excellent. They are supposedly known for their sushi, which I had. It was very good, but I've had better. I live in San Diego where I have my pick of about 50 sushi restaurants within a 10 mile radius, so I know sushi. The prices are typical LA prices if not a little on the cheaper side if possible. My wife ordered Filet Mignon which came with a nice portion of mashed potatoes and spinach which cost $32. All in all, I found the hotel to be enjoyable and in a decent location if you are planning on visiting Hollywood and/or Beverly Hills.
